title: A good shave, but the price isn't quite right.
text: I have had a cool skin razor for several years and always liked it. I finally got around to replacing the heads, and the difference in shave quality was dramatic (my old blades were at least 5 years old).  However, I only give this product three stars because the blade kit is expensive to replace yearly as recommended and only includes new blades, not an entire new blade assembly. I didn't expect this, but for $30 it would have been nice, especially since, as other reviewers have pointed out, the blades and assembly have a tendency to accumulate residue, particularly if you don't use the special Nivea shave cartridges. (I want to be able to use a big cheap can of Barbasol dam***!) Manufacturers are entitled to charge what they wish for their products, but I don't have to like it.

title: Great for not so common uses!
text:
When faced with the daunting task of replacing a 15" drain tube in a boat, one asks themselves, "How the heck am I going to coat the inside of this opening with sealant?"

Did a little poking around Amazon and I found these wonderful hair rollers that were just the right size to get the job done. It wasn't pretty, as I coated the hair roller in tan-colored sealant and then repeatedly inserted the roller into the boat to generously coat the insides of the hole with sealant, but hey, I'll be darned if it didn't get the job done!

There's a use for everything, and it turns out that these hair rollers are good for more than just one thing. I can't say much for how they do with hair, but I can say, if they can handle the abuse that I put them through to get the inside of a hole in a boat coated with sealant, they should hold up just fine for hair!

Great product, highly recommended, no matter what you need them for!

title: Reviews are Right - It Doesn't Brush :/
text:
I saw the reviews that said it doesn't do anything, but I was hoping it was more subjective and maybe it might work for me. Nope, it really doesn't brush anything.

- Bristles are weak, arrived bent
-Maaaaybe could work if you have super thin hair
- Thin and flimsy feeling if that's a concern

I use "wet" hairbrushes that are designed like this, and I have to say that the quality really varies. I have a couple that I love and work wonderfully--brushes tangled wet hair painlessly, evenly brushes hair to tie it up. I've only tried 4 brands, but this is the worst I've seen. The bristles are weak--they're really thin, even for wet brushes, and they arrived bent (not because it was used--it was in the plastic wrap and everything). I do have thick hair, but this is the first brush I've used (of ANY kind--tiny travel ones included) that feels like it's literally going on top of my hair and not through it at all, even when I try to press down. It maaay work if you have thin hair, but I mean really thin hair, and even them I'm doubtful.

I bought this hoping I could use it as a travel brush, so I wasn't too picky as long as it brushed relatively okay. Obviously not, but the plastic is also lighter and thinner than I expected it to be, again, even for a small travel brush, so I'm doubtful it or the hinge wouldn't break easily with pressure while trying to brush thick or tangly hair.

title: Works Great with Dark Hair
text:
I’ve always had natural hair color because I’m super scared of frying my hair and losing my length and natural color. I wasn’t expecting much from this product - everyone knows when you have dark hair, color just doesn’t show in it.

So far, I’ve used the silver and the green. For the silver, I went all the way up in my hair, and for the green, I kept the top third of my hair undone. The color shows remarkably well in my hair! It can be brushed once the wax dries for a softer, less stringy look, but you do lose some of the color.

I definitely don’t recommend wearing white when you have this wax in your hair, the white collar on my jacket went bright green. Also, be prepared that this is going to flake off all throughout the day. If you have shorter hair, it might not be as noticeable, but when your hair goes past your hips, you will get flakes all over your clothes.

Overall, this is a great product to temporarily change your hair color without having to bleach your hair first. Does it do what the pictures show? No, but it’s definitely noticeable, easy to do, and a lot of fun!

title: After 6 years still the best
text:
Thinking my Speed XL might die and wondering what the years have brought in new technology I picked up a new Norelco, and it shaves no better than the Speed XL. I thought I would use one in the bathroom in the morning, and keep the Speed XL in the car in case I had a night meeting, but now I use the XL driving to work and if necessary after work.

In the interim I also tried a Panasonic which was terrible. It is unbelievable how expensive electric shavers have become, and how some brands want an annuity too, with proprietary cleaning cartridges. I don't think my XL was more than $100 and now it's doubled, maybe because it's become exotic over the years.

title: Nice for travel, but limited use otherwise
text:
These hand wipes are good for traveling or any situation where you might come in contact with something gross and soap and water is unavailable. I like to pair these wipes with hand sanitizer to help combat dryness from the sanitizer. I still prefer to use hand lotion over these wipes though. These wipes make my hands feel softer, but don't help dryness not much. They are refreshing, but I still want to put hand lotion on after using one of these wipes.

The price point of these wipes is high, which is why I don't recommend them for everyday use. I put one in my purse to use for "just in case" situations.

I have the unscented wipes, which have a very low odor still. I can tolerate this odor though and I'm normally very sensitive to odors.

Overall, I think these wipes work for certain situations, but since I still need to use hand lotion with them, I probably won't buy more.

title: Light moisturizer with a lemon scent
text:
I like supporting small beauty brands because they typically do not test on animals or sell in countries that require animal testing. It's difficult to find independent companies these days. LDR appears to be a new, independent company that sells on Amazon exclusively.

The Biomarine Hydro Boost Moisturizer works for me. It is smooth going on and not too oily. It has a light lemon odor, which dissipates quickly. I normally can't wear anything that is scented, but from what I can tell, the scent is a byproduct of the active ingredients and not something purposely added to the product.

After applying this product, my skin feels smooth and soft. The canister is easy-to-use and not messy. The price point is a bit lower than other, similar formulas. I recommend this product to people with combination type skin. I think it's a little too light for someone with dry skin.

title: Definitely not universal, but great if you have a dryer that it fits
text:
I don't think this item should be marketed as a "universal diffuser." I tried it with a mid-range Remington, a high end T3, a mid-range Conair, and a low end generic dryer. The only one this diffuser worked with was the Conair. Unless you have a BIO IONIC dryer you run the risk that this item will not fit your dryer.

When I finally found a dryer that worked with this diffuser, the diffuser worked well. This diffuser is very well made compared to the diffusers that come with most dryers. First, it's larger than typical diffusers. Second, it swivels to open and close the air vents. I find that it's best used when my hair is nearly dry to put the finishing touches on. I was a bit skeptical of what a diffuser would offer at this price point, but I think the build quality warrants the price.

Overall, I proceed with caution when ordering this product unless you have the BIO IONIC. If you do own the BIO IONIC, this item is fantastic and I highly recommend it.

title: A Valuable Addition To My Home & Hobby Tool Collections
text:
I am a man with a full, somewhat wavy facial beard.. As individual hairs start to to die, they sometimes need to be pulled out. These tweezers are perfect for that, especially the angled ones, as they allow me to see around the hair to get a better grip on it before pulling. Additionally, the colored coating gives me enough of a resistance to the tweezers as to enhance the grip.

I am also a modeller, sometimes working with 3-D exceedingly thin sheet metal materials [.2 mm] that are too thin to be picked up with this old man's big fingers. These tweezers are invaluable for both picking up / holding on to pieces, but for bending the sheet metal into position, locking the sheet metal tabs into place, and a quick buff up with a micro buffer.

These tweezers have become a valuable addition to my home and hobby tool collection.

title: Pretty amazing...
text:
I've been using this razor since it arrived, approximately 2 weeks ago, and thinking long and hard about the score I'd give it. I actually intended to give it 4/5, the reason being that, while it's an excellent razor, the price point is rather high. In the end, though, I'm so impressed that I really need to give it a full five stars in spite of the price, with the caveat that you may want to take a look at one of the less expensive, stripped-down models; this one is the flagship, but all the models should be similarly excellent (please bear in mind this is the only one I've used).

And excellent it is. While my feelings have already been summed up in the opening paragraph, read on for similarly styled (but moderate) hyperbole.

I've never gotten such a good shave with an electric razor. Norelco does recommend that you give the razor a full 21 days of your time exclusively (i.e. not shaving with anything else) before making a judgment. I haven't had the luxury of giving it a full 21 days, as I need to get my review in; however, I've already adjusted to it so well that I can't imagine going back to my old razors. It will only get better as I get more used to it, although I'm perfectly satisfied at this point and unsure if it could get any better.

Not only do I use it to shave my face (which is obviously what it was designed for, and it does a great job), I use it to shave my head. It's not going to give you as close a shave as a traditional razor, but it's also not going to scrape against your skin like a traditional razor. You'll also save money on shaving cream (the only extra expense is buying a new razor "head" for it yearly, the price of which I am uninformed of). It works "dry". This is nice for me, as it takes a lot of cream to shave both my face and my scalp, and it does, in fact, do a decent job on my head. It's a little stubbly, even right after shaving, but honestly the only thing that would do a better job would be a blade, and that's a difficult way to shave (I was previously using a Headblade). If it can shave a head, where my hair was very thick, I imagine it would be adequate for even the bushiest of beards, and, again, it's designed for faces, not heads.

If you look at the features list, you'll see that this model is full of bells and whistles. Truthfully, they are mostly extras you could live without; the lower-end models would likely be just fine, so I strongly suggest examining them as a money-saving alternative. The meter that shows you how many minutes of the charge are remaining is sort of handy, the icon that lights to remind you to clean it is somewhat useful, but to say they're necessary would be a grave overstatement. In fact, the "wash me" icon lights up after basically every use, so its necessity is particularly dubious. (As a side note, it's marvelously easy to clean.)

In the end, the product does receive my highest recommendation. I think if you tried it out, you'd be pleased, and even if you had to send it back and didn't like it after three weeks via their guarantee (it does take time for your skin to adjust), there would be little time/money wasted. I would, however, encourage you to check out the lower-end models. Ultimately, even the high price point wasn't enough for me to downgrade to four stars. I'm normally quite critical.

title: Works pretty good on dry 4C
text:
This is a nice mask for the price. I have short hair & can get 2 uses from each packet (you get 10 packs). The softness is better if you also use the Royal Oils shampoo. When I used a different shampoo, the results weren't as good. Next time, I am going to use a cap and maybe even some wet heat to see if that helps. I think the issue is that my hair doesn't love coconut oil which is one of the ingredients - even though it's the 6th of 11 ingredients.

The packs are pretty hefty and I think that I could stretch the use more by adding more water to my hair beforehand. But to be honest, I think that the R.O. conditioner works better than this mask!

Love the R.O. line and I think this will work well if I use heat or leave it on longer than 5 minutes. Keep in mind that I have REALLY dry 4C hair... I have almost the entire R.O. line and love all of them but this is my least favorite of the set & I won't buy any more of the mask.

title: Good ingredients, not perfect
text:
I got this because all 11 ingredients are things I recognize & are all "natural". The first ingredient is propolis and the honey is fourth. That's what is shown in the product photo. However, the ingredients are in a different order on the actual product. Still good, but not what I expected. (see my screenshot.)

It's a tiny tube (see compared to a regular toothpick) and the actual stick of product is not very long.

Overall, this is better than the usual basic lip balm I grab at the stores. It's kind of pricy for a lip product but I think that the ingredients are worth it & do make my lips feel more moisturized than they usually are.

I side-eyed the price at first but then I look at the ingredients - even as shown on the package I got - and realize it's worth it.

title: Deep color & fast drying but chips
text:
3.9 stars

1. This is MUCH darker than expected (tho I happen to like it). One coat will give you a purple look but more than that, this gets dark enough to look purple-black.
2. This dries super fast - which is a big deal to me - and that's nice until you start getting to the end of the jar. Once this gets down to the last part of the jar and begins to get tackier, it's hard to get a smooth coat on. Adding any kind of thinner makes the polish effect dull and ugly.
3. This is kind of a small jar or the price.
4. This looks really nice and smooth when the bottle is new but the polish chips easily with more than 1 coat.

Overall, this is a good polish if you want something of a darker color, but it doesn't last very long.

I don't know what it means that I want to buy some more of this color - even though I think the price is too high.

title: As good (or better) than the expensive "R" brand!
text: Finally tried this after using a much pricier whitening toothpaste. This works as good (or better) and I can actually afford it. The other paste (well-known brand, starts with "R" lol) was good, but the price was too high and I stopped using it because of that. The other day, I found this in a two-pack at such a good price that I decided to give it a try. Guess what? I could see really good results after about the 3rd time using it. That's just as good as the other expensive brand. The taste of this one is nice and mild - which is a Plus because I don't like overpowering flavors. I can't believe it took me this long to try this one. I could've been saving so much money all this time...

title: Like the way it makes my natural & nappy hair feel
text:
This has the very, very *very* faintest plant-like scent (which is clean and pleasing). It's also thicker than I expected - almost like a whipped lotion. Before I used it on my hair, I rubbed some into the back of my hand to see if I'd have any kind of skin reaction. I did not. What I noticed is that once this absorbed, there was absolutely zero residue. I don't know what that means, but I was just curious. When I rub in other types of hair masks & treatments, I always get a sense of something left that I need to wash off. When I used this on my hair in the shower, I left it on for about
2 to 3 minutes after I had massaged it in according to the directions. (I have to stop and mention that I was also using the Daelong shampoo and conditioner set beforehand. That might be why I got my results.) This rinses out extremely well. My hair felt conditioned but with a lot less of the residual slip from other conditioners. That kind of worried me. I like to know that a treatment is doing something & the only way to tell until you've used it for a while is by the way your hair feels. Where I became so happy with this is an hour after rinsing it out. I have coarse and "nappy" natural African American hair. My hair tends to be extremely dry - especially after washing. A good conditioner keeps things in check until I can apply my leave-in products (oils, butters, sprays, etc.), but this time, my hair stayed soft and easy to comb through for at least 2 hours. It might have been longer, but I went ahead and applied my usual leave-ins. Still, I know that this did soften my hair (the day after, my hair is retaining softness without any more leave-in applications) without making it feel fragile. With they type of hair I have, I have to worry about breakage. I realize that I have probably been clogging up my scalp by over-doing it with the oils and butters. I like that I haven't had to use more of them for my hair to feel manageable. As a test, I'm going to try easing up on using so much leave-in stuff while I continue to use this.I think these guys are on to something here. I will have to come back and update this review as I use this for a while but, for now, I love the way this makes my hair feel, even after just one treatment. Normally, I only fully wash my hair once every four weeks or so. I will do a co-wash about every other week to keep it clean without stripping it. While I am testing this out, I plan to use it at least once a week as my co-wash. Like I said, I am also using the shampoo & conditioner of this brand. That might be a big part of why this worked so well for me, but I think that this would work just as good on its own. By the way, I'm going to alter my washing regimen for a while to use the shampoo and conditioner at least every other week. I almost forgot to mention the other thing I was concerned about: the label says that this makes the hair "straight and silky" - which is exactly what I, personally, DO NOT want. I love my texture and want to keep it. My texture is the kind that is prone to slow growth (because of breakage) so... I'm not worried about losing my naps. I'm thinking that this aids in stopping breakage more than anything.
I got this at a very steep discount.

title: Great item, but there are more affordable alternatives
text: This works and works well. The reason I can't give it a full  5-star review is because of the price. There is a very similar product that is way cheaper and works as well or better than this one. I found Sole Magic online for about a dollar cheaper than this one. In superstores and drug stores, I found it for a couple of bucks. This one does work and I can't say one negative thing about it - other than the price. When a pedicure is around $20 (even here in Alaska where prices are high), and I can do upkeep with a similar foot smoothing pad for about $2, I just can't see paying almost $9 for this one. If other customers do want this one, I can tell you that it works, the shape is nice and makes it easy to grip and use with either hand. It's also nice that their is a coarse side and a finer side. One thing that I disagree with is that you could use this anywhere but on your feet. I don't know what would have to be going on with anyone's elbows or knees for them to use this on! All in all, a great product, but a bit overpriced when there are cheaper alternative items that are just as effective.

title: Pretty Pricey But Worth It!
text: Love, love, LOVE this moisturizer. I love it so much that I may have replaced my Avon Anew. This one costs quite a bit, but the tiny travel sized tube will last a while. This is a VERY watery product, but that's great for 2 reasons: 1) a little bit goes a long way, and 2) it absorbs really well into the skin. The best way that I have found to apply this is to tap the lotion onto my fingertips, then just sort of dab it onto my face before rubbing it in. This saves on product and keeps me from spilling any from the tube. Like I said, this has a very "wet" texture, so you won't have to use much. The price is way up there but, compared to using a lot of a cheaper product (that doesn't work as well), or a same-priced product (but using more of it), this is the best value overall. I'm going to see how long the travel-sized tube lasts while I save up for a larger size. Since this is something I have to save for, I really wish there were more size/price choices. Still, I love this and I think my skin is getting addicted to it!

title: First Razor In A Long Time That Didn't Give Me Nicks And Cuts!
text:
I hate shaving. I have a beard for this reason, but you still have to do minimal shaving. I have used just about every razor under the sun, but recently I have had a lot of trouble with cuts on my neck. As a last resort, I decided to give a "power" razor a try, and I went with this one over the Fusion because replacement blades are much less expensive.

I was a little apprehensive about the power razor as I thought it might just be a source of faster cuts and nicks. However, I am happy to report that not only did I not cut myself, but I also got a closer shave as a bonus. Knowing that these have been out for years, I am now kicking myself for waiting this long to give it a try. Can you ask for a lot more than a closer shave and no cuts? If you are frustrated with your non-powered razor, give this a try. Hopefully you'll have a pleasant surprise like I did.

title: Pricey, But Worth It To Have a GOOD Charger
text:
I own a Galaxy S6 Edge Plus... AND an iPhone 6 (Work Phone), AND a Galaxy Tab4 10.1, AND a New Trent Battery 12,000 mAh Pack. With that said, each one of these devices is using it's own charger and because of that, I had to resort using a power strip by my bedside JUST to charge all my devices.

The current chargers I use are all stock (1 Apple Charger, 3 Samsung Chargers). One of the Samsung Chargers is directly from the S6 Edge Plus (supports Adaptive Fast Charging/Quick Charge 2.0), yet it fails to work 80% of the time on my S6 Edge Plus for whatever reason...

Another issue is when I go away for overnight trips somewhere. For a day, I could probably just get by with just the iPhone charger & Samsung charger, but when I have 3-4 night stays due to work, I have to pack all of them!!! It's just a big hassle. That's when I decided I'm just going to resort to buying a GOOD multi-port charger. I've used Ankur devices in the past and I've been very pleased with all of them. After reading various reviews, I decided the 3-port is perfect for my situation.

For $25, you get a 3-port charger: 2 PowerIQ ports and 1 Quick Charge 2.0 port (which the Edge+ takes advantage of).

I've used the Ankur PowerIQ tech before via an Ankur Car Charger and I can definitely say it's almost as good as the Quick Charge 2.0 technology. What I like about it is that it supposedly "detects" what kind of device is connected to it and charges accordingly. Whether this is true or snake oil, I can say that it charges my devices fast and never has any kind of power dip when you have multiple devices connected to it. I use these two ports for my iPhone, Galaxy Tab4 and New Trent Battery pack.

The single Quick Charge is dedicated to my Galaxy S6 phone and right out of the box (same cables and all), it would fast charge my phone 100% of the time. Unlike my old stock Quick Charge Charger, it never seemed to work. So when I'm charging my phone and seeing it will fully charge within an hour makes me happy!

The only initial turnoff is the $25 sticker price. Yes you get a multi-port charger, but I think maybe that sticker price will scare some people. But after experiencing and using this product, I think that $25 is DEFINITELY WORTH IT. Never have a poor quality/flaky charger again. I'm 100% pleased with this item!

title: My husband wants to take it with us if we ever move!
text: We decided to buy this after struggling to get our Christmas decorations down from the attic this year.  It took us almost an hour to get everything down (one box at a time w/ two people on the attic ladder - very dangerous!).  It took my husband about 30 minutes to put everything back (by himself)...and you know that putting things UP in the attic usually takes much longer than getting them DOWN.  We had a very good handyman who has done work for us in the past install our unit.  It took him about 6 hours to install and wire the unit.  It was a one-man job.  I don't know that I would have wanted my husband to install the unit. While he's not inexperienced at home improvement projects, this job needs someone who takes the time to make sure holes are cut properly, structure is re-braced as needed, and everything is plumb and square.  Plus, there is a little electrical installation for the power supply.  Unless you're a very talented, meticulous novice home improvement guru, hire a professional installer.

title: A Safer Way To Trim Callouses.
text:
This callous shaver is an improvement over many other cheaper styles. The handle is thick and easy to grasp, the blade holding area is thicker and stronger, plus there is a plastic safety insert which prevents inadvertent cuts while reaching for the stored shaver. The handle also includes a rasp, with a slide-off cover, which is a better and safer way to eliminate the more lightly calloused areas. Do invest in the blades which go with this shaver, they are very sharp and will hold their edge longer. This will help to prevent the cuts associated with cheaper blades, which become dull quickly. This device is a wise choice for those experiencing problems from thickly calloused feet, it other troublesome areas.

The price is a bit high, thus my ranking of only four stars.

title: Ineffective and irritating
text: I have been using the oil-free eye makeup remover for several years, so I thought I would try this. I don't recommend it. It did a good job of dissolving mascara, but really just smeared it around. I had to use several pumps of oil to get the mascara dissolved, but then could not get it to rinse off. I tried using a cotton pad, but still had mascara residue around my eyes. My eyes were irritated and blurry (that stuff hurts when it gets in the eyes) after using this, even when I rinsed with water. I ended up using an additional product to get all the mascara off. The instructions on the bottle make it sound like you can just pump, massage, and rinse off your makeup. That is not the case at all. I love Neutrogena products, but can't recommend this one. I will return it and go back to their oil-free eye makeup remover.

title: Get you feet ready for flip flops!
text: I got this for my younger cousin who kept stealing my as seen on TV version of the callus remover.  She would use it to remove the hard calluses she had from wearing her soccer cleats and I was always left with dead batteries!  I ordered the Calily for her because it is USB rechargeable, and even comes with a USB cord!  However, it does not have the USB wall plug adapter, so you will need to get one or use the same one you use for a smartphone.  She just uses the same plug adapter that she uses for her smart phone.  If the rechargeable battery didn't have her sold, the 2 speed settings and inclusion of a rough and fine grain so she can get her feet in flip flop wearing condition!  She called me to thank me and said it was very easy to use and works well.  She was defiantly a fan of the 2 different rollers!  Overall, it is working great for her and is easier to maintain as the batteries do not need replaced.

title: Power to the Max
text: This electric callus remover has some serious power. It's a sandpaper power tool disguised as a pedicure accessory. It works really fast, almost so that I use a tapping motion when using it so that it doesn't tear too deep into my skin. The lowest setting is incredibly strong. Anything above that is like used to remove grout or something. It's a little loud though but it will take you up to 3 minutes to do both your feet. The cord is a reasonable length (9 feet) and it comes with extra head replacements (which you can also buy more if needed for less than $10 a pack). This is some professional industrial grade callus remover. It has a nice design and easy to clean. Overall, highly recommended.

title: works for my moderate rosacea
text:
I recently starting getting rosacea. Mine is not severe, relative to some photos I've seen, but nevertheless gets out of control if not treated, especially my nose.

Last year I paid $354 for Finacea and it worked, but $354!? At that point the 15% generic was not on the market, and I was unaware of any other options.

More recently, I rolled the dice on this $14, 10% azelaic acid from The Ordinary and it works too. Happy with the results and I don't have to ration it (I made that little tube of Finacea last 6+ months!).

So, I definitely recommend trying it. I am so relieved I found this.

title: Overall Pleased!
text:
I purchased this unit on a Prime Day. Reviews were mixed, but I was willing to take a chance at the sale price. Very happy I did. It looks a little less than 150% when flat ironed, but I like it that way because it looks more realistic. Having too much hair makes it look wiggy.

I immediately washed it, let it dry naturally, then flat ironed it. I'm more of a straight hair girl. The hair is very soft and took to straightening well.

I didn't experience much shedding; a strand here and there. It's only been a week and 1 wash, so we'll see. Some shedding is always to be expected eventually though with any wig; just not crazy shedding. I also haven't experienced any tangling. I'm always looking for that, especially at the nape area, and it has been hot. So the wig is winning there.

The knots are slightly bleached. I just added a little foundation powder and it worked well. Best part is that the hairline was plucked to perfection. That saved me a lot of time in customizing.

One thing that can be improved is the choppiness of the ombre. But it isn't the worse thing in the wig world.

Overall I am pleased with the unit and will buy another. Recommended!!!

title: Great for Bell's Palsy
text: I purchased this to help shield my eye while suffering from Bell's Palsy.  I highly recommend having one if you are going through the same.  On windy days it allows you to go outside without having to hold your eye closed.  It also, as the name suggests, holds in some moisture.  Though it fogs up a bit, this is well worth the clouded view to know that not all the moisture is lost from an eye that can't blink or make tears.  In the early weeks this allowed me to drive as taping an eye shut made my depth of field a joke.  The elastic was a bit too long for me, but I simply tied a knot in the back to make it tighter.

title: Unflattering stock card; Beautiful Unit!
text: Absolutely gorgeous wig! The stock card picture is so scary but please know that out the box, this wig is much better looking than it's marketing photo! Plenty of good parting space, the hairline only needed a small amount of plucking, soft bouncy hair with no smell. Beautiful! My natural hair is closer to a 4/30 so the 1b was a bit too dark for me. I bleached the knots and lifted the 1b to a brown and tried to bring the 30 further up for more ombre effect; like my hair. My only con so far is that the colors didn't flow. You have black and then blonde; no gradiation. I was able to customize to my liking. I did experience shedding after I washed it but very little and virtually none while styling. I blow dried it, flat ironed and wand curled it. Took heat very well! I'm so impressed. This is my first human hair wig and now that I've experienced Bigsophy, I'll be buying more! Bought the 1b/27 for my daughter. Can't wait to see hers! I know she'll lift it and dye it some crayon color!  Will update photos once I install it.

title: Great product
text:
I Liked this product, those that did not like it, probably didnt use it correctly. I received this bar as a gift from a student. So I am not a verified buyer, as it was gifted.

If one read directions and you don’t apply it like regular shampoo, it must be applied at the scalp directly first then run down the strands, this is probably why some people complain about greasy hair, they probably didnt part their hair and apply at scalp.

My Tip for using this product, is to be sure you apply at scalp. I applied before getting in the shower at the mirror, to save water, and parted my hair at finger width intervals, wetting the bar as I went, rubbing it my scalp, before showering, took less than 10 minutes, then once in shower I wet my hair a little bit, and it really lathered up.

When I rinsed my hair, I could tell it was clean, felt different from bottle shampoo. You could feel the clean. It felt lighter than usual too..

I would give it 5 stars, but I dont like the peppermint scent, but then I don’t like food scents in my toiletry products. The bar is also really slippery and hard to handle when wet. I was thinking Shampoo bars need a gripper, I might invent one if no one has beat me to it.

title: Great value - and great features
text: I bought this to support my artist acrylic painting hobby - it is helpful to use a hand-held hair dryer to dry the paint on the canvas quickly so you don't have to sit around for 15 to 30 minutes waiting/watching paint dry.  But you need a dryer that won't be shoot out air that is too hot or has insufficient power to shoot out warm air at a distance of about 12 to 18 inches from the canvas.  And this one is perfect!!  It sports a good range of temperature and fan controls, and the attachments work well (especially the diffuser), attaching securely with a quick twist.  And, as a nice bonus, there is a blue or violet colored spot of light that is emitted when operating, showing me exactly where the dryer nozzle is pointed on my canvas.  I just love love love this dryer.  (My wife sneaks to my studio space to borrow the dryer to dry her hair - apparently it is better and dries her hair faster than the $75 blow dryer she has stored in her bathroom vanity.)

text: This order replaced an identical one which was tossed on a box and arrived in pieces. This time it was packed with airbags and it's usable. I would caution against dropping this on any floor, as it's brittle, but it's quite handy for all the little things easily misplaced on a trip - tweezers, hair elastics, bandaids, nail files, make-up brushes - not bulky or tall items. If you leave out nail polish and anything 1/2" tall/thick, this is a very handy box that takes up little space. Of course everything shifts in packing, and unless you set the box on something eye-level or hold it up to your face (awkward), the mirror isn't too handy. title: Best de-frizzer I've ever used

It's also the first heating tool (including straighteners, drying brushes and hairdryers) I've ever seen with a cord appropriately heavy-duty for what it does. text:
I've used the following:

American Crew Fiber
TIGI Bedhead Matte Separation Wax
Gatsby Moving Spiky Edge (Pink Container)

It's lighter than Fiber so my hair doesn't go flat. It's softer and cheaper than Mr. Pompadour. Easier to work with and style (comb or hand) than TIGI Bedhead. Not greasy at all like Gatsby and also easy to wash off, also unlike Gatsby. It's the best I've found!

title: OK
text: I tried this on thick curly 3c hair. The results were quite decent. You first wash your hair with the pre-treatment shampoo to clarify the hair and remove dirt and oils. At this point, make sure to detangle the hair well and section it into smaller parts so that you can apply the keratin treatment. The hair should be 80% towel dried. You then comb in the keratin treatment to each section of hair. I recommend wearing gloves. Allow it time to process and then blow dry and finish with a flat iron. The hair came out quite silky and smooth, but it began to revert into fluffiness as the day went on. Adding a bit of hair oil helped to restrain the humidity. For an at home kit, it is decent, but it is not as strong as salon treatments.

I get a quick release from dry cracked hands with this cream and I consider it to be towards the medical grade. I still consider wearing plastic gloves when cleaning and winter gloves outside, drinking lots of water, exfoliating and using moisturizer daily to be the way to go usually but this cream is a good try.
Given the price and the size of the tube, I do not believe I will be repurchasing. I do recommend it for people with similar problems.

title: Can't do without
text: I received these gratis in exchange for an impartial review.  Hadn't heard of them before.  What a great idea- one of those products you don't know how you ever did without.  I hate to admit it but I'm old enough to have used Maybelline mascara when it came in a little red box- you moistened a brush (looked like a little hairbrush), stroked it across the dry mascara, making a paste, and applied it.  It took a lot of work.  Everyone I knew kept an extra dry brush for thinning clumps and distributing the mascara evenly.  Later, I kept an old empty mascara tube/brush for brushing lashes and evening out mascara applications.  These work SO much better!  Lashes are much longer and not clumpy with these wonderful brushes.  Also great for using after applying false eyelashes for blending/interspersing the false lashes with your own.  I gave some to my niece and my aunt to try, they like them as much as I.  The magenta color is nice too.  Fantastic!

title: Organized all my daily wear makeup into on easy to use area.
text:
This acrylic makeup organizer by MelodySusie is part of my ongoing effort to get myself more organized. Until recently my makeup was an absolutely disaster. I finally got sick of that and decided something needed to be done, so after gathering everything up (and culling a huge amount that I just do not use any more) I started sorting and putting things into this organizer. With several drawers and compartments it was easy to arrange everything in a compact space so I could still see everything. I also really liked the flexibility that this organizer offers. I currently have the dividers in place in the bottom drawer since I am using it to keep my most often worn pairs of earrings easily accessible, but if I were to ever get more makeup I could remove the dividers and use the drawer as it, and setthe divider on the counter on its own to hold additional items.

The organizer itself seems to be well made - nice and sturdy with parts that fit together well and are well finished so there are no rough jagged edges. The included drawer liners are a nice touch and they help to keep things from rolling or rattling around each time I open and close a drawer. I like that the top section is a separate unit that can be removed as this makes cleaning much easier. I wear powdered foundation (that famous brand that you swirl and tap) and particles of it seem to get into everything. With a removable top tray, when it needs a deep cleaning I can just remove all my makeup from it and rinse it under the faucet without messing up the items that are in the drawers. That's not possible to do with an all in one unit where the top tray is attached to the base drawers.

All in all, I am very happy wih this organizer. It works very well for my makeup, though I can also see it working well for other uses. As an artist I can see it working very well in my studio to organize art supplies as well.

I did receive this item at no cost for the purposes of testing and review. All opinions are based on my personal experiences using the item.

title: A favorite childhood snack!
text:
I grew up eating Taro Fish Snacks in Thailand, and they're still one of my favorite snacks. For someone not used to them, they can seem a bit strange. Maybe it's a bit of an acquired taste, but I really enjoy the chewy leathery texture of them as well. Something I discovered with these years ago is to spread them in a thin layer on a cookie sheet and stick them under the broiler for just a few minutes.. no more than it takes for them to just barely start to get a hint of brown. The texture completely changes to something crispy instead of chewy. Watch it though, they go from brown to black in the blink of an eye! Toasted up this way they also make for an unusual topping to a salad or a bowl of noodle soup.

The original while package taro are my favorites, flavor wise, though sometimes I like the yellow and orange package ones too - they tend to be spicier, which I have to be in the mood for.

title: Great gentle facial tool for dogs that don't like having faces washed. May be lightening tear stains too--will update review.
text:
This is an interesting way to market a Konjac Sponge, i.e. for your pets. I have to say though, it's pretty brilliant. I've only worked on my white chihuahua-blend's tear stains once with the All About Health Network Charcoal konjac sponge, but it did seem like it lightened his tear stains a bit. They're pretty significant now since he doesn't like his face washed. What was most important to me is that he actually seemed to like me cleaning his face with the sponge. It's very soft once hydrated, and the shape meant I could be careful not to get too near to his eyes. I also have a white frenchie who absolutely HATES having her face washed, but needs to have the folds of her face cleaned regularly. I'm going to order a second one because this has made that process much easier as well. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I don't yet know if it can remove tear stains, but given how hard they are to get rid of I somehow doubt it. I'll update the review if it works well over time though!

Please note I most likely purchased this at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. In order to save time, I do as much of my shopping online as is humanly possible. I rely heavily on other customers reviews when making purchasing decisions, so as such, I take the honest and unbiased bit very seriously. While I enjoy testing products, I don't hesitate to write a critical review or rate items low when warranted and all opinions and words are my own. If you find the review helpful it would be great if you would click the "yes" button below. Thanks!

title: This Mask Is Awesome
text: So I've tried A LOT of sheet masks and NONE of them worked for me. They either broke me out, or didn't secure on my face right, or they just didn't do anything for my face at all. This is the first sheet mask where I actually felt my face responding to it in a good way. It smelled just like citrus without it being too overpowering, nor was the tingly sensation, it told me that it was working! I also liked how this wasn't dripping with ampoule, it had the perfect amount to soak the face without it making a mess on your countertop or where the stuff would be rolling down your face and to your chest or creeping towards your eyes. So that in turn made wearing this more relaxing and not so irritating and awkward like most if not all the other sheet masks I tried. I almost didn't want to remove it, that's how much I enjoyed and loved it! I couldn't believe how baby soft smooth my skin was after using it. It wasn't a life-changer or game-changer for my hyperpigmentation, but it's unrealistic and next to impossible for any product to do that after only one use. My skin loved this though, I can tell that this is perfect for my skin type (combination/oily acne prone skin). I thought I'd swore off sheet masks. Granted, I'm still not blown away by sheet masks in general, this mask hasn't made me a fan of them, BUT...I'd totally buy this again. It was awesome.

title: Pretty Good Cleansing Balm
text: I wasn't sure what to expect because this is a new product on Amazon. It looked similar to other Korean cleansing balms I have tried, so I gave this a whirl. I wish there were more product info listed here, like a complete list of ingredients. This is in a semi-solid form and melts on the face upon contact. It has a delicate fragrance that reminds me of roses but it's not cloying. It removes my face makeup, eye makeup, liquid lipstick, etc., very efficiently. I use a muslin cloth soaked in hot water to steam my face and remove the product, then cool water rinse. There's virtually no trace of the product left but I follow with a swipe of toner. This leaves my face super fresh and soft. It's a "Like" in my book.

title: Wish the socks fit better for larger (American) feet
text:
No directions, but here's how to do it.
1. Soak feet in hot water for 15 minutes
2. Cut open plastic sock as indicated.
3. Tape shut near the front, on the top
4. Slip foot into a gallon size Ziplock bag to avoid spills
5. Sit with feet on the ground to avoid spills or tearing the bags for 1 to 2 hours
6. Rinse liberally with cool water
7. To speed up the peeling process, do not moisturize feet the first day
8. Feet will start to peel within a week. You can speed up the process by using a diamond file when you're in the shower.
-------Don't ever do this over carpet and clean up spills immediately.

title: Literally have sweet lucid dreams & wake up w/ no anxiety
text: Got this as an Christmas gift, and was so thankful when opening. I could smell it though the package and was full of joy! This is seriously a great gift for anyone; I am a vegan, yogini, hippie girl but seriously anyone will love this! I mostly use it for nights where I can't sleep or in mornings when I wake up with anxiety. It has helped with both. title: Under the Heading of - Why Did I Wait So long to Try This
text: And also - where has this been all my life? I have long, very thick, wavy, mostly frizzy hair. I hated washing it because it took. So. Long. To wash it, and then rinse it and then condition it and rinse it again. Sigh. Hair washing days means 30 min showers. Anyway, I often got flakes, not dandruff, just flakes that I always chalked up to the tons of products I need to tame my mane. After using this little scrubby I now realize it was because I was never getting my scalp and the hair closest to my scalp completely clean. Lathering up and then using this to massage my scalp, my hair is so much cleaner and TBH behaves a bit better. And I'm now down to washing it only 2x a week because it's now so clean, it takes longer to show build up from all my products. I read some folks don't like this because they say it tangles their hair. Not true. I can speak from experience, they are not getting their hair wet enough. In order to get a good cleaning - with or without this - you must SOAK your head completely and lather completely. This little scrubby will glide through the shampoo. And if you don't want to wash your hair every time you want a little scalp massage, then just soak and put a little conditioner in your hair. This works and it works well.

title: Very pleased with this product
text: This is a very nice cleanser, especially for my, shall we say, experienced skin. Fifty years ago I seem to remember being told that it's never too early to start taking care of your skin. Well, I hope it's never too late either! I like the Neem facial cleanser very much. It smells organic, a bit fruity with a tinge of avocado scent. It is creamy and feels nourishing as I apply it to my face. The ingredients are all listed on the back label. This facial cleanser is soothing. It just feels very nice and cleans effectively also. One of the nicest things about this cleanser that I didn't realize until after I had purchased it is that with each purchase you are helping orphaned children get clean water and a safe home. See africaheartwoodproject.org. How cool is that! Oh, also I bought the 2 ounce size and I didn't plan this but it came in handy as I had to travel last weekend and the 2 ounce bottle fit perfect in my travel case along with all the other stuff that us older beauty's need to pack. Anyway, I really think this cleanser is a fine product. I like using it because it cleanses as it should and feels nourishing upon my skin. For me it's a keeper and I think anyone who wants a good for you cleanser should give this one a try. I don't have to worry about my skin too much because I'm naturally beautiful, pretty much flawless... I know I am because my husband tells me so  all the time, (never mind that he can't see more than 2 inches in front of him and doesn't remember my name!) but for all you young ones out there remember, "it's never too early to start taking care of your skin!".

title: Leaves hair shiny & with body.
text: I have been using the Hair lab conditioner for about three and a half weeks now and I am very pleased with the product. I was wondering what effect it would have on my hair as I color my hair regularly and thought it might fade out my hair. But it has not faded my hair color at all and it feels wonderful as I apply this conditioner to my hair. The conditioner leaves my hair shiny and with a lot of body. I love the way my hair looks and feels with this product. As for hair loss I do not have excessive hair loss but I do often notice strands of hair in my comb or brush and I'm glad to have this product as it helps my hair to be very easy to comb gently so I don't have to yank tangles and fight with trying to comb my hair which does lead to strands of hair coming out. I like this conditioner alot and in my opinion it is a fine product but it is not a miracle product for anyone who has severe hair loss. It is a great conditioner and support for your hair.

title: Exquisite and rich
text: This Cardea Luxe skin care eye renewal therapy 1.8oz jar would make a wonderful gift for someone you care about like your mom, your sister, or a close friend. The jar and package shout "quality" and this product does not disappoint. The three inch high, eight inch around glass container boasts two shiny silver metal rings around top bringing a sense of timelessness and class. The white top pump mechanism is a wonderful touch ...so handy and sensible. You push down and just the right amount of the lovely, anti -oxidant eye cream is released. Let me tell you, the feel of that crème as it touches your hands is so exquisite and rich, it soaks right into your skin, leaving your hands feeling like they have been truly pampered at last. I know this is eye crème but it is doing wonders for my hands! It is no less magnificent when I use it on my face. It is hydrating and nourishing around my eyes, all over my face, and on my neck and Décolleté area. You can throw out all your neck creams, face creams, etc. and just use this Cardea Luxe skin care eye renewal therapy crème for everything! I have not yet tried it on my feet but I will ! I hope you try it and enjoy. It's very soothing and a delight for all your skin.

title: Great for dry skin
text: I am very impressed with this Organic Moringa Oil. It has a very slight but engaging smell which is earthy, enticing, and invigorating. I became intrigued after reading about the many benefits of Moringa oil so I decided it might be worth trying. I ordered from Inn & Co because their Moringa oil is 100 % organic. Also because I am always on the look out for value and good prices, and this Moringa oil comes in a good sized bottle about 4 inches tall which holds 4 fluid ounces of oil. That is a good size as a lot of oils come in much smaller bottles and cost just as much. So Moringa oil is filled with antioxidants and phytonutrients along with supposedly reducing wrinkles and sagging fatigued skin. It also boasts anti inflammatory benefits. So here I am to report that the oil, along with being a delight to smell, is refreshing, relaxing, and hydrating to my face and hands. No, my wrinkles have not wondrously disappeared but I can report that my dry skin on my face is being diminished. As for my hands a little bit of the Moringa oil rubbed in both of my hands leaves them feeling so luxuriously hydrated I just want to hold hands with everybody! I'm really enjoying this oil. I think it's a great asset to my unending quest in preserving what small amount of beauty I have left. Plus it makes me feel good and it sure does pamper my skin. I'm enjoying making it a staple of my health and beauty routine.

title: Natural Bath Bars
text: I am pleased that the Patchouili Hemp Bar Soap is all natural and cruelty free. I am always at ease ordering from Cornucopia Brands. I have never been disappointed by a product of theirs.  The Hemp soap comes in a labeled box and there are four full sized bath bars of soap in the box. Each one of the soap bars emits a soft, sweet odor which is very pleasant. The lovely earthy aroma comes from the organic oils of Palm, Coconut, Olive, Palm Kernel, Patchouli essential oil blend, Organic hemp seed oil and Rosemary extract preservative. The soap produces a mild lather and leaves my skin feeling clean, soft and nourished. It is a good soap for my normally dry skin. Along with using as a bath soap I also use this soap on my face and it leaves my face clean and soft. The soap bars arrive in a brown cardboard box clearly marked with the name of the product and is eligible for Amazon Prime delivery. I think this soap is wonderful. I’m pleased that the bars of the Patchouili Hemp soap are full sized and long lasting. I’m taking note that this soap would be a great birthday or Christmas present.

title: Made in U.S.A.
text: I am very pleased with the Lavender Castile Soap from Cornucopia Brands Natural Soap. It came in a plastic bottle which was a much larger bottle than I expected! I do wish it had come with a pump fixture on top but it has a simple cap. A pump would help to make it easier to dispense the product.  The Lavender castile soap is safe for all skin types. This Castile soap has all natural ingredients and is non toxic. I am so far using this soap a regular soap in the shower, etc.  The lavender castile soap is infused with a natural lavender essential oil blend, and also has organic aloe Vera and other oils. The Lavender oil scent does not overcome the slight medicinal smell, just so you know. I appreciate the Lavender Castile Soap from Cornucopia Brands as it is a natural soap, no Lauryl Sulfates or petroleum derivatives. Also it is made in the United States of America. This soap is gentle enough to use on hair and body yet effective enough to also use as an all natural household cleaner. If you have never used castile soap the scent may take some getting used to as it is not filled with all kinds of artificial scents as so many products are. I am impressed with the quality of this product and the great service received also.

This has many natural ingredients, which is what I have been trying to use more.  This actually made me loose hair!  This also made my scalp burn, not a slight tingle, but burn.  I have never experienced that with any other natural shampoos or conditioners.  When I rinsed my hair, I got a small pea sized clump of hair come out.  I tried this conditioner a few more days, but had the same burning sensation and pea sized clumps come out.  I went back to using the other shampoo/conditioner I was previously using and I did not get any clumps of hair, nor did my scalp burn.  I guess this is just me since the other reviews seem good, but I cannot use this.  The only thing I did like was the way it smelled.

title: Both Work Great
text:
I saw this and really wanted to try it since it came with both shampoo and conditioner. You always have to purchase them separately. The price is actually pretty good for what you get. A little goes a long way. I haven't been using this very long, but I have already noticed a difference in my hair shedding in the shower. Both have a good scent without being too overpowering. These actually leave my hair feeling and looking healthier. My hair has started to thin out and I wanted to stop it before it got too bad. It really leaves my hair feeling clean and restored. I do wash my hair daily with this shampoo and conditioner, but the bottle has lasted a long time. I put the shampoo on my wet hair in the shower and massage into my scalp, leave on for a minute, and then wash out with the warm shower water. I then do the same with the conditioner. I love all of the natural ingredients and that they do not test on animals. I would recommend this to anyone.

title: Excellent hand cream
text:
UPDATE - 09/30/16 ========================================
Still loving this moisturizer and just ordered another package. This stuff goes on well, absorbs quickly into the skin and doesn't leave a greasy feeling! My skin feels truly moisturized. I love using it on my hands and feet before bedtime, this way it really absorbs into my skin overnight.
Love it, love it, love it!

========================================================
Not many people know this, or give it another thought sometimes - anything you put on your skin gets absorbed through the skin and ends up in the blood stream. This is why I am rather careful when picking my skin care products. I have been staying away from most hand creams for a while now just because for the most part there's at least a few potential carcinogens lurking among the ingredients. Even though the big famous brand creams make your skin feel wonderful the question is if the trade off is worth it.

Unfortunately, even so called organic products aren't always that safe. Provided, manufacturers of this goodness are disclosing all the ingredients on the label (and not hiding anything) this cream looks safe enough to eat. Therefore, I have been happily slathering it all over my hands (and any other body parts needing additional moisture) in the past few weeks and I am quite pleased with the results.

This white fluffy goodness feels surprisingly light and absorbs quickly into the skin. I must admit, it is a tad thinner in texture than I had expected but on the other hand this lightness ensures there's no oily residue left on your hands. The cream has no scent whatsoever which is a definite positive for those who are sensitive or don't particularly appreciate scented products. I'm adding a drop of essential oil of my choice (whatever I feel like that day) when I apply the cream if I feel like smelling something nice. Basically this cream is your blank canvas and leaves much room for creativity.

One thing I would probably change about this product is the packaging. (At least maybe as an option for buyers to choose from) I really think that tubes are better for hand creams - way easier to dispense and so much more hygienic (sticking your fingers into the container doesn't really help keep it germ free). Other than that I am happy to give this product my approval.

I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review, all opinions are based on my own personal experience with the product.

title: Decent for it's price point.
text:
[[VIDEOID:5e37579b01c9e26d7c0d83a26f8153a7]] *as a licensed cosmetologist, I'm reviewing this item from a personal as well as professional standpoint*

I am almost 30 years old, and still suffer from breakouts. I have seen dermatologist and tried a lot of things but they often dry out my skin too much, causing my skin to produce MORE sebum (oil) combining with the medicines side effect of dry dead skin sells. This is a fast way to disaster skin-wise and often causes my skin to worsen. Because of this, I have tried many different facial cleansing devices, and here are the points that I like about this one.

1) Rechargable! Nothing is worse than needing to use a facial scrubber only to find that the batteries are dead. I cannot tell you how many times that the batteries have died (in other models) and then to make it worse, I often discover a mess of rust when I open up the compartment to change the batteries. The fact that this unit can be easily charged through a micro USB is not only convenient but also costs less and is safer.

2) Variety- all the different attachments that come with this unit is a nice little bonus. I can't genuinely say that I would use all of them (remember, trained in skin Haha) but as a consumer I still appreciate the additional options.

3) Quality- at this price point, it's surprisingly well made. I was a little concerned with the rubber cap that protects the USB port, but other than that, it's sturdy. The plastic does not flex at all, and it feels solid.

4) Sound- I never thought that something like sound would bother me, but I definitely noticed how quiet this unit is compared to other models I've owned. I have two small children, so I'd often have to go to a bathroom further away from their bedrooms to cleanse my face at night, but with the noise level of this cleaner, i'm just genuinely not concerned with waking them.

The only 'con' that I've found personally is the speed of rotation vs the softness of the bristles. I feel like it would be more productive to either have the head rotate faster or have harder bristles. Having said that, skin is very thin, especially when it's sensitive like mine. I DO prefer the softer bristles, because they are much kinder to my skin and I don't have to worry about causing more damage to inflamed areas. However, the brush's rotation was just too slow for me, (please see my review video for a short view of the rotation) and I felt impatient at how long it took to get a thorough round of cleansing and sloughing to my face. Because of this, I cannot rate at 5 stars because it's just simply not as good as it could be. But, all things considered it's still a good sturdy competitor at its price point in today's market.

I did receive this product at a discount or free in exchange for an honest review. I strive to provide fellow consumers with the most detailed, unbiased and (hopefully) helpful reviews that I can, believing that allowing a discount to influence a review is a disservice to other shoppers. Therefore, anything contained in this review can be considered my own independent and unbiased thoughts and opinions, that have not been influenced in any way.

title: Results In 1 Week - See Before & After Pics
text:
[[VIDEOID:f2b369e0d51ead5b1e259f05074a0f65]] I was actually shocked when I looked at the pictures I took of my face of "before" and 7 days "after" using this miracle massage tool. I have been using this tool once per day at night for 7 days (I missed 1 day out of the 7 days) in combination with my normal nightly face routine. Prior to using the face tool, I apply a liberal amount of my eye cream so that there is still some that is not completely rubbed into my skin (the instructions recommend using an eye gel or similar product). I then use the wider, blunted tip on the tool and slowly move the tip around my face and pause in each area for about 5-10 seconds per the instruction manual.

The tool itself is about 6.5" long and feels like a wide marker when held in your hand. It is powered by 1 AAA battery (not included) and has a power button with 2 intensity levels. When turned on, the tool emits bionic waves via the tool's tip when it makes contact with your skin (see demonstration in video). The lower wave intensity is supposed to be used for slight to moderate wrinkle reduction and the higher intensity is meant for deeper wrinkles. However, during my testing, I used the higher intensity level exclusively (all of my wrinkles looked deep to me lol). The instructions state that the tool can be used up to twice per day (with at least 6hrs between each treatment time) and should be used on clean skin. Treatments do not cause any pain/discomfort and do not leave any marks or redness on your face.

This wrinkle eraser is incredibly easy to use, though does take some time dedication if you follow the recommended 5-10sec per skin surface area. I have already begun to see results (thanks to remembering to take "before" pictures) and will 110% continue to use this tool indefinitely. Now that I know the tool works, I'm going to start using the smaller tip on the wrinkles just under my lash lines in addition to using the broader tip around my eyes. I am looking forward to seeing more results, and I would highly recommend this product to others.

*Discounted product received for testing and review purposes. I have no affiliate with the seller or manufacturing company, and I did not receive any compensation for testing or reviewing the product. All opinions are my own and were not influenced by the seller in any manner.

title: Simple to Use & Perfect Results Every Time!!
text:
I LOVE these bun makers!! I have an old bun maker that I've been using for years, but that one just got tossed in the trash because these new ones are SO much easier to use and the finished product looks much better!! These bun makers are unique in that they are foam, which helps to grip your hair to better hold it in place. They also have a very strong inner wire that holds them in place in a perfect circle. I have relatively long (just past my bust line) hair with long layers - the trick to getting all of the end pieces of the layers to stay tucked in place is to pull the bun maker down the length of your ponytail just before you reach the end of the shortest layer. Then, fold all of the rest of the ends upward over the hair piece and tuck them inward towards the center of the ponytail. As you roll the hair piece upwards, continue to tuck any loose ends in so that they are held in place by the rolled hair. The other trick to getting a perfectly round bun is that once you have rolled the hair piece all the way up with your hair, fold the ends inward towards each other to form a circle, but make sure to tighten this circle as much as possible by pushing the ends as close together as you can. Otherwise, these hair pieces are fairly self-explanatory to use, and there are step-by-step instructions included with each of the four bun maker pieces. In addition to these four pieces, this product also includes 2 sets of 8 bobby pins -- 1 set is about 2" long each and the other set is about 3" long.
*I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest, unbiased review.

title: Works for Eye Puffiness & Amazing Off-Label Headache Relief!!
text:
This eye cream was far different than I was expecting -- but in a GREAT way. I'm 29-years-old, so the lines around my eyes aren't terribly deep, although they are probably deeper than many other females my age due to my sun-worshiping in earlier years. I do suffer, however, from severe seasonal allergies and am constantly plagued with dark circles ("allergic shiners" as they call them) and extreme puffiness of both my upper eyelids and just under my eyes (the infamous "bags").

To be honest, my impression of this cream at first glance wasn't too great. For starters, the jar of cream was much smaller than I had imagined, but I guess that's my fault for not noticing the (very) small-printed "0.5 fl oz" on the label in the picture. (I do think that this was a little deceitful though, because the size/amount of this cream is not listed anywhere on the product description.) In addition, while trying to read the teeny tiny print on the jar, I also almost immediately noticed a spelling typo on the front of the label that reads "Nautral & Healthy" rather than "Natural & Healthy." I know this seems like a rather minuscule and knit-picky detail to point out, but it did make me at least wonder about this company's quality control standards.

Despite my initial impression, I gave the company/cream the benefit of the doubt and have been using it for the last few days. With my first application under my eyes, the cream felt more on the "thin" side (similar to a lotion rather than thick cream), but while rubbing the cream into my skin in a circular motion, the moisture that the cream delivered was far better than I anticipated. It takes at least 3-4 minutes before your skin feels like the cream is completely absorbed, which gave me ample time to slowly massage the area during absorption (and felt very soothing and relaxing). I had absolutely no issues with any side effects or skin reactions such as burning, tingling, redness, or irritation. I noticed a small "immediate" reduction in the pores and fine lines of the areas I applied the cream, though not as impressive as some of the Retinol and Vitamin C serums that I've used in the past. There was no obvious difference in the dark circles or puffiness right after application, however, within about 30-45min, the puffiness started to visibly decrease and the area all around my eyes felt less tender/achy in general.

With each subsequent application, I noticed the same resulting decrease in puffiness as was observed initially. My puffiness did return each morning, but I expected because I'm still constantly being exposed to my allergens. (After all, the cream is meant to relieve a symptom of my allergies, not be a miracle cure for my chronic systemic condition.) I've noticed that if I apply the cream immediately before bed and spend more time rubbing it into my skin in the circular motions, I do have a noticeable decrease in the morning when I wake up compared to before I started using the cream. As far as the under-eye dark circles, I can't tell a difference so far - but in all fairness, I've only been using the cream for 4 days (twice daily) so there's still hope.

Now for the best part (in my opinion, at least). On the second night of using this cream, I had yet another one of my throbbing headaches (allergies are the worst!!) About 15-20min after my evening cream application, I noticed that my headache felt a little better -- I'm not saying that there was some miraculous change here, but it did feel less severe. This was very unusual for me, as I hadn't taken any ibuprofen or Zyrtec at that point (my usual go-to medications when my headaches are severe). The only thing I could think that I had done differently this time than any other time was that I applied the cream -- it was a strange connection, but stranger things have certainly happened to me. I went back to look at the ingredients listed on the jar and saw that it had rooibos in it. I had absolutely no idea what this was (and probably didn't notice it the first time I looked because I don't have a magnifying glass), but I looked it up online and read that it's an herb from South Africa with a laundry-list of health benefits -- including antioxidant properties and... headache relief?!?! Although still relatively skeptical that this was just a coincidence and that I had gotten "lucky" on my google search, I was still optimistic and proceeded to rub the eye cream on my temples and at the base of my skull to see what would happen. After a good 30-45min, my headache was almost completely gone. I know this headache thing sounds ridiculous and obscure, but I encourage anyone to research this mysterious Rooibos for themselves. I haven't had a headache as severe as that one since, but I have had a few headaches start to come on, and with each headache, I applied the cream to my temples, under my eyes, and to the base of my skull and the feeling has gone away each time within about an hour.

With all of this said, I couldn't rate this "eye" cream turned headache remedy anything less than 5 stars despite my initial less-than-thrilled first impression. Because the cream is light and only requires a very small amount with each application, I think the small jar will actually last me a reasonably long time, too. Between the headache relief and the disappearing eye bags, I would be confident in recommending this product to others. I was also fortunate to receive my first jar of this cream at a discounted price or free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

title: Great heat protection, somewhat difficult to clean
text:
I ordered this silicone pad to place on my vanity so that I could rest my curling/straightening irons on it while getting ready without having to worry about scorching the wood vanity top. Overall, it works well and it just small enough to squeeze between the two drawers that come up on either side of my vanity. I have a love/hate feeling for the little raised "dots" that cover each side of the mat. I like them because they raise the hot tool when resting on the mat to give extra heat protection to my vanity top underneath it. However, I also put my makeup on at my vanity and because of the silicone surface, every little drop of makeup powder is attracted to and clings to the silicone mat surface. The silicone isn't that difficult to clean (I use either pledge spray or a lysol wipe), but the little raised dots make it difficult to get into all the little grooves in order to get the mat perfectly clean. I could move the mat while I put my makeup on, but I don't have many places to put it on where I get ready, so this would be a huge inconvenience. Plus, regardless of where i put the mat, it will still collect dust overtime and have the same cleaning issue.
As a solution to cleaning the mat, I started running it under warm water and using a dish brush with bristles to scrub the mat and get in those difficult grooves, which has been successful as far as perfectly cleaning the mat - it's just a little more tedious than I'd like it to be.

title: natural remover that actually works.. yes it's true!
text: So when you hear "natural" nail polish remover what comes to mind? For me I thought "there is no way this is going to work". So what do I do I order it anyways because hey I love the earth, but I want to be pretty too. I've had this stuff for like a week already and even though my toes look like they have been through war I still just keep staring at it. Well today I finally decide to take the plunge. I read all of the instructions and see that you have to let it "sit" on your nails for 2-5 minutes. It's very difficult for me to stay still that long, so I figure I'll try it out and see what happens. Mind you I am not trying this on any regular nail polish, no. I have the polish from my last pedicure which is a light pink glitter polish AKA the worst type of polish to try to remove. I feel like I'm setting this stuff up to fail, right. So I grab the dropper and fill it up. I place a few drops on each toe (for those of you keeping track this is a watery formula and will not stay well if you move at all). I did keep moving about my business for 5-6 minutes. I then return with some cotton pads. I wipe the big toe not expecting much and almost the entire polish wipes away in one swipe. I kid you not more than 3/4 of the polish was gone in one swipe. I'm in disbelief at this point, so I stare and pick at it like it's going to talk to me. After a few minutes in awe I finish the rest of my toes. I did have to go back and do it one more time because my toes are very curved and like I said I cannot sit still, however it didn't bother me at all. This stuff removed disgusting glitter polish in less time and less smell than any other product I've ever used. I am so impressed that I keep staring at the pad I used to remove the polish. It's like it just melted it into a sheet and it just slides off of my nail. It's really cool. I am impressed also that I do not need a ton of this stuff to remove all the polish for my toes so I'm thinking it will last a while. I will re-order this stuff once mine runs out. I highly recommend this product to anyone who wears nail polish ever. I do need to mention that I did receive this product for free to review. Please understand that my review is based only on my own experience with this product and the cost has no impact on my review.

I would recommend this product if you are looking for a wrinkle cream that applies nicely, soaks in quickly and reduces wrinkles, without any side effects.
