title: This is that perfect item I was looking for
text:
I got these after watching this YouTube video from this Youtuber who tested this out.
[...] my hair is a little shorter than hers and I'm working on growing it out from a pixie cut, so I have a bunch of crazy weird layers in my hair. I needed an alternative to the typical elastic hair tie to throw my hair up. I'm afraid I wear my hair up so often that I probably have a big line of breakage across my hair from where the hair tie goes. This is that perfect item I was looking for. It's easy and I get multiple looks out of it. It's even fancier than just popping my hair up in a pony tail, so I don't feel obligated to fix my hair before I go out if I've had it up with this device. Sometimes some of my shorter strands do fall out of this, but that is because those strands are barely long enough for an elastic- not this products fault! I'm so glad one of these recommended beauty tools actually works!!!

title: I loooooooooooove this gel mask. The first time I ...
text: I loooooooooooove this gel mask. The first time I used it my husband asked me, "what did you use on your skin?! It's so soft!!" After that, I was obviously hooked. I do experience some redness after I have used this mask, and I don't have very sensitive skin. So for those who do have sensitive skin, you might want to try a test patch first! My redness went away fairly quick and my skin felt so tight after, I couldn't ignore moisturizing before I went to bed. The next morning my skin was glowing and just as smooth as the night before. I have officially found the missing piece to my skin routine!!

title: Not for me
text: I hadn't had much experience with waxing, however I have tried wax pearls before and that definitely wasn't working for me, and though I usually just stick with good old fashioned razors but I thought I would try these easy to use wax strips. They are pretty easy to use too! The instructions are on the back of the box and they even have pictures for you to follow. To heat up the wax strips all you have to do is use your hands and rub them and the heat from your body allows the wax to warm up enough for you to pull the paper apart. You simply stick the wax strips on the area that you want the hair removal. It didn't really say how long you should leave it on before removing it but I feel like it needs to cool a bit to get a bit harder before you pull it off. One of my issues is that I didn't feel like it pulled off all the hair that I wanted to be gone within that area that I put the strip. If I am going to go through some pain for this hair removal I don't want to have to do it multiple times on the same area of skin. To finish up you are supposed to open the post cleaning wipes, however they left my skin oily and feeling kind of greasy and I didn't like those. I preferred to finish up with some of my own CBD lotion. Overall I think it worked, but not well enough for my liking.

title: Easy to use and wash out, not for long hair
text: This product is actually really cool and just as easy to use in real life as it seems like in the pictures. Comes with a silvery tone putty type substance in a little container all you have to do is put your hands in kind of rub it around your hands and then run it through your hair. It was really the easy to do on someone else but takes a little bit more time to do on yourself though if you get some on your skin or ears or wherever you can just take a wet damp towel or a white or something like that and wipe it right off. In the picture that shows you doing it too long hair but I tried it on my long hair and absolutely did not work I could not pull a comb through it and it was hard and strange and it definitely works better on men's hair that is short. When it was dry it got kind of hard like a gel or something like that. It's really easy to make it look nice you just have to continue working it through the hair until you get the desired color and style that you want. We tried it on a beard as well and it didn't look as good on the beard it kind of looked better on the medium to short hair but not super super short like a beard. We even used it and my boyfriend's hair who is African-American and it came out pretty cool. Kind of makes you look like you have silver gray hair. It was really easy to wash out renting it out just with water gets a lot of it off but a little bit of shampoo get it out in just a second. I don't recommend going to bed with this in your hair as it will leave silver glimmery stuff on your pillowcase to make sure you wash before going to sleep or laying down on anything.

title: Honestly couldnt get it into my routine long enough to see if it truely works.
text:
So far I couldn't get this product in my routine for long enough to see how well it works at all. I don't want to give it a bad review because of my lack of ambition with it, but I don't want to lie and say that its an amazing product either. This Biotin Infused Zenlash Eyelash Growth Serum is definitely easy to use. It comes in a little wrapped bottle similar to a mascara bottle, except the brush looks more like a detail nail polish brush. The idea is simple, you brush it on your lash line everyday and wait and watch. It was a bit hard for me to get my lid closed all the way and brush this one, but I am not one who uses make up much either. If you do use make up it will probably come a lot faster for ya. I did accidentally get a bit in my eye before and I was happy to see, though it doesn't feel good, it didn't irritate me much either. I really wish I could say that I saw a huge transformation, but after only managing to use it for one straight week, I didn't see much difference.

~Thanx~

title: Fit me well even though I am  plus size with a large head.
text:
This ShungHO Hairband Cap Woolen Braiding Knitted Headband is much better quality than I was even expecting. It came in just a clear plastic cover. The braiding and knit of the yarn is very nice, with no frayed or loose hanging ends that I could see. The braiding looks super cute, and would go well with some braided boot socks. It does feel like wool, so it is a bit scratchy but not uncomfortably so. It was thicker than I expected it to be and keeps your head nice and warm. I did notice it seems to ride up on the back of my head a bit which I do not like, but that is no problem of the product, just the nature of the design. It looks a bit strange with your hair down but looks pretty cute with it up in a messy bun. I think I would have liked it a bit more if it was a bit less wide, because it covers so much that it looks a bit strange. I do however, like the fact that it covers pretty much half of my ears as well, to keep them nice and cozy during cold evenings and frosty mornings. Quality product.

~Thanx~

title: Great smell, I only wish it lasted longer.
text:
This Black Intense For Men is so refreshing. A bit intense when first sprayed on, but very mellow shortly afterwards. It reminds me of a lot of scents that say "refreshing" or "water." I absolutely love the smell. Its not even super manly either and could almost be worn by a woman without much notice. I definitely love this smell on my fiance and I think it is my most favorite of all the polo inspired scents by Watermark Beauty. Of course like most of the other ones my biggest issue is that they not not last all day long. They start puttering out about halfway through the day and will need to be re-applied, and also like most others it comes in a large 3.0 Fl. Oz./ 90 ml bottle, so it should last a while even with a second application every day. It is inspired by Black Cologne but I have not had the chance to smell it so I cant tell you how close they are, nor do I care because this scent is amazing. Recommended! I received this product at a discounted rate

Thanks <3

title: Manly sexy scent!
text:
The biggest issue with all of the colognes by Watermark Beauty is the fact that they do not last strong or long. You need to reapply to make sure you still smell good by the end of the night. That being said this leopard For Men, Eau De Parfum smells amazing. Its very manly and I love the scent of it on my fiance! It reminds me of a water fresh shaving cream or aftershave and is very nice smelling, sort of aspin-like, light and not too strong. The bottle is relatively large and at 3.3 Fl. Oz. / 100 ml even if you have to reapply during the afternoon it should last a while. The bottle is sleek and modern looking with its flat black matte surface. The black clear lid does not snap on well however and comes off easily. The spray pump makes it easy to apply, and its definitely one of my top 5 scents that my fiance owns. I received this product at a discounted rate.

Thanks <3

title: Not for me.
text: Wow. This Super Star For Women, Eau de Toilette by Watermark Beauty is strong. Not my favorite by far, but lasts well throughout the day. That being said when I spray myself it is so strong I have the need to want to wave away some of the scent it really invades your nostrils. The first whiff is overwhelming of alcohol, and needs some time to disperse to make it smell better. One spray should do just fine, so this 2.7 Fl. Oz. / 80 ml will last for a long time. The bottle is very cute, and the pink liquid in the clear glass makes it look very feminine. It even has a plastic top that looks like crystal, very cute. Inspired By Juicy Couture Perfume, but I cant imagine Juicy would smell like this.Overwhelmingly floral, its okay, but its more like something my grandmother would wear. I received this product at a discounted rate

title: Very nice scent.
text:
At first I did not know if I really liked this Diva Scent For Women, Eau De Parfum, but after a few days of wear it is really starting to grow on me. It is supposed to be inspired by Juicy, however I have not ever tried Juicy before so I cant tell you how close it is unfortunately. I can tell you, however, that it smells very fruity with a milk floral scent. Very sweet and refreshing and very hip for the younger women. Almost like a fruity dryer sheet, but in a good way. It comes in a rectangular clear bottle and the perfume itself is pink and very girly, it even has a pink bow around the spray nozzle. I think this 2.8 Fl. Oz. / 80 ml bottle should last quite a while, and after 3 good sprays in the morning I cold still smell it on my shirt at the end of the night. The only thing I did not like was that the golden cap was on so tight that I actually pulled off the bottom piece when trying to get the lid off, other than that I really like this perfume. I received this product at a discounted rate

Thanks <3

title: Fruity
text:
This Lady Passion For Women, Eau De Parfum is supposed to be inspired By Paris Hilton perfume, however i do not have that perfume so I really can not describe the difference. However, I can tell you that this Lady Passion perfume smells nice. It has a very distinct citrus smell, almost grapefruity type smell. Its nice on the nose but not really my favorite kind of scent when I want to wear a perfume. It comes in a very large 3.3 Fl. Oz./100 ml glass bottle that should last you a while, however I did notice that the scent dissipated quite dramatically from me as the day went on and if I wanted to keep the good smell to be continuously noticeable I would have to reapply, but its price is very affordable. It comes with an easy push squirt application nozzle. I received this product at a discounted rate

Thanks <3

title: Be careful with these tools if you dont know how to use them.
text:
Its one of the grossest things in the world, blackheads. But lets face it, some of us women are so fascinated by them! We love to pop and pull and squeeze and get all the gunk out of not only our faces, but our spouses. Eeeewww. Until not long ago I did not realize how much popping pimples is so bad for your skin! Leaves holes and scarring and no wonder I have such big pores... So after learning that I was so excited to try out this Deluxe Premium Blackhead & Blemish Remover Kit by Mac Professional. This set comes with so many different tools its hard to know where to start. There is one tool in particular that is the coolest, though a bit dangerous. It has two heads that screw into each side for safety and can be removed and screwed on the sides, and has a lancet and another head. Its extremely sharp and you must be careful with it, this is a "professional" set so I really don't use more than the ones just to remove blackheads, very nice set, and I love that it comes with a case that has inserts to safely store every piece. I received this product at a discounted rate

Thanks <3

text: I have been seeing this stuff around for a out a year. I decided to finally get some. First, it took a few weeks to come. I knew they going in so that wasn't bad. Second, this lip gloss is STICKY. Like be cautious when applying because it is sticky and it will stain your clothes. I tried it on with an old t-shirt on so it wouldn't matter. To get a good application, squeeze a nice amount out then smear it on. You then get the luxury of waiting at least 10 minutes. I waited 30 for it to dry. Then you get to peel. Before peeling, pat your lips to make sure it's dry. You can try to peek it off in one swoop but I didn't. Once it comes off, your lips are lighter than the original application. It looks nice.. Well some colors look nice. I am African American so not all colors look great on me. Pretty much the lighter the color, the less likely to really show up. It does last though. It's more matte to me. I like it.

title: The "Dirty Brown" is good match for Ash Brown. If you like a messy look, this is a good choice
text: My natural hair color is light to medium Ash Brown, depending on how manufacturers label their colors.  (Unfortunately, there's not alot of uniformity in the industry when it comes to color labels).  I look for #8 if the color number is given.  Even then, you can NEVER be sure unless you see it in person, and Ash Brown is particulary hard to find.  The picture of the "Dirty Brown" bun looked to be a close match to my hair, but the pictures often lie, too,....and "Dirty Brown"??  In all my searches for ash brown hair pieces, this is the first "Dirty Brown" color label I've come across. I took a chance, and it is ALMOST a perfect match to my hair color.  Even though it doesn't say that the Dirty Brown piece is ombre dyed, IT IS, and the lighter ends would not be my choice. Still, the darker "roots" of the piece are almost perfectly matched to mine, so I think I can pass it off as real.  I have very fine hair, and I do NOT like thick hair pieces. That's another hard thing to find,....hair pieces that aren't unrealistically thick and "weighty"!  This piece is full, but not TOO full, not so thick that it looks fakey or heavy.  The "messy" feature is definitely very messy, the hair is completely straight and a bit spiky looking, yet very soft to the touch.  The center opening is too big, the elastic to loose for me to wear it over my own ponytail or bun without additional fasteners.  I use a couple hidden bobby pins at the top of the piece to secure it to my own hair.  It's easy to do and unnoticeable but can sometimes get a little heavy and "pulling" if worn for hours.  I change the position of the bobby pins, move them off to the sides, if it starts to bother me, so it's not a deal breaker.  This messy bun (more like a mess pony) is very well suited for around home, when running errands, or for any casual event with casual dress.  I don't think it would work well (and I would not choose it) for more formal events or dressier attire.  I really, really like this piece!  95% of my life is "casual", and I know I'll get alot of wear out it.  These things don't last forever, so when I find an affordable piece that matches my natural hair color and my life style, I usually go back and get a "spare".  That's a winner in my world, and this one got a medal, so I'm back to buy the spare!

title: What a piece of garbage!
text:
I was highly skeptical about this gadget, but when I ruptured a disk in my back, I decided to take a chance. I should have listened to my instincts.

Let me put it bluntly. This contraption does not work in ANY way as advertised. Anyone saying otherwise HAS to be a lying SHILL!

The suction cups don't stick to the floor of tub or stone shower. At all. This makes every other feature kinda worthless. The point of this toy is to not have to bend over to scrub the dirt or smooth out the calluses on your feet. But since it won't stay put, there is nothing easy about cleaning your feet with this thing.

Since the suction cups didn't stick to the floor, I tried jamming the thing in a corner and holding it there with my other foot. But even if you can get it to stay still enough to rub your foot on the brush, the bristles are weak and cheap. They flattened out with the third attempted use. The stone is small and even more useless than the brush.

This is the perfect example of a sucker product! Wouldn't it be great if this worked? But it doesn't. SAVE YOUR MONEY!

A long handled bath brush/pumice stone combo actually does work. If you use it while seated, there is very little bending involved, saving your back.

title: Great value but silicone breaks
text: These clips are great!  I used to never section my hair - didn't know about it and wasn't sure of the point.  But then I realized that (1) I tended to do a good job at first and then rush though when I got tired and (2) unruly hair is easier to manage in small sections.  So, I use these clips daily to help keep my hair looking like I love myself.  Having so many is nice because I don't have to worry about losing some.  I also use them to keep my hair drying bonnet from opening up due to the air pressure.  And, I use them to hold my towel closed.  BUT, oftentimes, the silicone breaks.  So, I wanted a large quantity to help make up for this.  So, I deducted a star due to the lack of durability of the silicone - once it breaks, the hold feels much, much firmer.  I wish that there was a way to reattach it.  But, all in all, this is a great value in terms of quantity but could be better in durability.

I prefer the version advertised by Avashine - https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WG448FM/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1.

title: Does not feel like it can straighten hair at the roots but love the low heating temp.
text:
I have tried a number of these brushes. What I like about this one is that it goes down to 80C (176F). It was so cool that I was not sure it was on. I have fine hair, high porosity that is 5 months post-straightening relaxer. And, I find that light heat with a silicone-based glosser helps to gently close the cuticle and to keep my roots from tangling. What I don’t like is that this brush design does not have the round guiding bristles around the edges that help to pull your hair into the hearing plate. So, it feels like you are brushing your hair with your elbow and that it is not penetrating to the roots. You have to grip the hair with your other hand so it feels like you are only getting the shaft of your hair. So, the brush is best for people with longer hair who do not have curly roots or those who need the super low heat setting as an option.

If you would like to be able to rake the brush over your roots to tame curls at 250 F and up, other bushes to consider are https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07FGV9NQG/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&th=1 or https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B071HFQGJX/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1. Note - My glamfields brush malfunctioned after first use which is why I ended up trying this one, but I decided to give Glamfields another chance because it is great when it works - never had results like that before. The BuTure mini is like the Glamfields brush but smaller. Both feel better (more like a real brushZ) than this one.

title: Faintly pigmented, dusty, and chalky.  Not recommended for women of color - or anyone else frankly.
text: Not recommended for women of color. It is only lightly pigmented and chalky; the colors very pastel. It will hardly show up on your skin. The three colors on the lower right look nearly identical in the pan and all three look like faint dark streaks on skin. The 3 colors on the left side (lilac and 2 light browns) do not even show up on my palm. The purples in the middle of the top show do show faintly, but all of the shadows are dusty and brush off in a few swipes. I threw mine away.  I recommend choosing a 5 star rated palette instead.  For example,  Ucanbe, De’lanci, and Prism palettes are good examples of $11 eyeshadows that are -highly- pigmented, long lasting, and blend well.

title: Very Effective in Healing and Clearing Skin
text: I cannot say enough good things about this Retinol Serum. I have tried several things from the Baebody line of products, and they have all been very high quality and very effective. I am a huge fan of Retinol and how it benefits the skin. I am at a crappy age where I still get breakouts, and I am starting to get wrinkles. I hate having the same gross skin as I did as a teenager. And I have tried everything! Prescription meds, prescription creams, ProActiv, micro-dermabrasion, chemical peels, etc,etc. Nothing seemed to help until I started using this Retinol Serum. Retinol is just a fancy word for Vitamin A and apparently me skin is in desperate need of it. It acts on DNA to promote healthy epidermal skin cells. It does a great job of moisturizing my skin, which helps with wrinkles. And it also does a great job of preventing breakouts. If I do break out because of hormones, it helps clear them up without drying out my skin. Sometimes it clears up my skin within a day or overnight. Vitamin A is a really potent antioxidant that protects your skin from free radicals, generates cell growth, and repairs damaged cells. Retinol belongs to a family called retinoids, and is one of the only substances that is small enough to penetrate the outer epidermal layer to the layer where collagen and elastin reside. It is really strong at first. It is really effective and it is tempting to want to use too much too often, but it can end up irritating the skin. I started using it every other day at first and then built up to using it every day. I also like to use a Vitamin C serum, but using Vitamin C and Retinol together tends to decrease their effectiveness. And sunlight decreased the effectiveness of Retinol, so I use the Vitaming C serum in the morning and the Retinol Serum at night. I let it work it's magic while I sleep. It has helped clear up my skin and help heal sun spots and acne scars. My only regret about it is that I didn't start using this years ago! I was able to try this Retinol Serum at a promotional discount for testing and reviewing purposes and in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

title: Deceptive, and cheap.
text:
I am so very disappointed with this product line by Amorepacific. I love their other brands, IOPE and sulwhasoo. But I was in the search for a more affordable toner/emulsion/serum and was excited when they introduced this line and gave a discount. They really sold this beta-hyaluronic whatever that works 1.5x better and I thought it was a new patented technology. But no. Contrary to their marketing claim, there is no such thing as beta hyaluronic acid. Yes I looked up patent registry and trademark registry and Amorepacific didn’t register anything new in the past few years related to hyaluronic acid. They just put a new spin on beta glucan, which according to some studies works 20% better, not 150% like they claim. Also beta glucan is toward the end of the ingredient list, meaning we have no idea how much of it is even in there. It’s so disappointing that Amorepacific decides to just flat out lie to customers about it. Makes me go wonder what else they are lying about.

Now I would not have done all the research if the serum worked well in the first place. But it came with no safety seal which made me go um. The packaging felt cheap. The liquid felt cheap and diluted. My skin smelled like plastic. My skin didn’t stay hydrated like other serums and that’s when I knew something was up. I bought toner, emulsion and serum. The emulsion was sealed but the toner and serum was not. I didn’t even bother trying the emulsion. I’ll be returning these all. I will also be seeking new skincare products that are not made by Amorepacific. Goodbye.

title: Hydrating but burning eyes

title: No difference after three weeks of consistent use, and product won't dispense through pump.
text:
ANOTHER UPDATE:

My dermatologist told me that unless a Vitamin C serum contained the L-ascorbic acid form of Vitamin C, I was wasting my money and doing little to improve my skin. I found a serum here on Amazon that contains 17% L-ascorbic acid, and I've been using it for approx. 3 weeks. What a difference! I can definitely feel it working for one thing (it burns for about 5 seconds), but more importantly, I can SEE the difference in my skin already. At first I thought my eyesight was going downhill, but then I realized my skin really did look smoother and had a new glow. Do an Amazon search for L-ascorbic Vitamin C serum to get the good stuff.

Having said all this, I have added a LOT more spinach to my daily regimen lately, so I'm sure that's contributing to my skin's appearance too.

UPDATE:

I finished the bottle which gave me about 5 weeks of use. If it made any difference in my skin, it's at a microscopic level. I'm buying another bottle - mainly because there's got to be SOME truth to all the 5-star reviews. But if, after another month or so of use, I still don't see improvement in my skin, I'm asking a dermatologist for a Rx for Retin-A.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

I've been using this product for three weeks, and I have yet to see any improvement in my skin. I'm amazed (and not a little skeptical) about some people seeing results in two weeks. I also wonder how many 5-star reviews were written by people who were given the product to try.

I'm very methodical about using new products on my skin. I use a 10x magnifying mirror, establish a "baseline" area of my skin to observe over time, and take close-up "selfies" of my skin to compare with photos taken a few weeks later. No difference so far, but I'll continue to use this product until it's gone.

I DO like that this retinol doesn't irritate my skin, which is highly unusual. So unusual, it makes me wonder if it indeed contains any retinol.

In conclusion, and not a critique of the product itself, but the product won't dispense through the pump. It's too thick. I'm having to pull the cap off and shake the serum on to my fingertips. I wish it came with a dropper instead. I changed out out the pump with a dropper from another bottle of serum. I'm surprised I haven't read about this problem in other reviews. Another reason I'm leery of all the glowing comments.

I'll update with my progress, or lack thereof, at a later date.

The touch screen works great, make sure you 🔌 plug the mirror into a secure wall outlet and that it is in there nice and tight. I am telling you this because one bulb seemed to be on a different setting at one point. I am so glad they included a dust cloth and bonus magnifying mirror. I can go on forever about my love for this beautiful Hollywood style mirror, but I will end this post with. It is so glam, it is so worth the money and I am so happy. 😀

title: Doesn’t fit smaller heads well
text:
Theses shower caps do what they are supposed to do keep your hair dry . I do have a smaller head .. So I did have a bit of a hard time keeping the shower cap in place when showering which made it kinda irritating to wear . I did untie the bow to make it tighter but it didn’t help much .

Whatever hair is tucked into it will stay dry but if any hair at all is out it will get wet , so do your best to keep all hair tucked into the shower caps .

The hair caps are made with good quality water resistant material which is a plus as well as they are pretty cute on . You can wear them in the shower or to wash your face without getting your hair wet as well . Over all this is a product that every woman needs to have for those days when you don’t want to wash your hair or don’t want it to get wet .

title: Makes Cute Curls
text:
I had a little bit of a hard time at first braiding my hair onto this heatless curling rod headband . The head band is very soft and feels like good quality that it will last for a good amount of time . It does feel a little slippery since it is satin so make sure that the hair clip that secures the headband is well placed .

I used it after blowing drying my hair to mostly dry and had to re-wet it a little bit to make sure it would be wet enough to lock the curls in . As you can see my hair looks a bit frizzy because it was a bit wet but the curls look really beautiful and that was after 4 hours of wearing the curling rod .

I didn’t try to sleep with it in my hair since I can’t sleep damp hair nor hair pulled back at all .

This is a cool heatless curling rod which I do recommend since it is a handy product for women who don’t want to damage their hair with heat and still get beautiful curls .

title: Great for those with athletes foot!
text:
Using this product and Defense Shower Gel (link here: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01BICMJ16/ref=twister_B01E0GSW8Q?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 ) I have been able to completely get rid of Athletes Foot (after having Athletes foot for 6 years). The defense soap is the cure, this thing just makes it easy to use it every day. I mix one bottle of defense gel up with water in a spray bottle which I spray onto my feet and then scrub with this thing.
The main complaint I have with this item is that the top part hits me on the top of my foot even when trying to be careful not to, and it hurts pretty bad when it does. If the top part (the arch holding the bristles above the foot) was at an angle, the edge wouldn't hit your foot and it would make the whole thing allot easier/comfortable to use. The only other (minor) change that I would like is for it to have more bristles in the back instead of the stone and the bristles in general could be a bit firmer as they are very soft.

Overall it's a nice inexpensive product that works great for me.

title: Junk.  The nozzle has a spray tip that can come loose and end up lodged in your nose.
text:
I tolerated these poor performing devices because of the good price, but when I had part of the nozzle come loose and lodge in my nose, that was enough. It took a lot to blow it back out, was almost stuck in my nasal cavity. No nasal mister is worth that risk.

On top of that, these leak if they are not upright. Carry them in a bag or a pocket? They leak. They also don't last long enough to dispense the fluid in them - the nozzle literally wears out and becomes non-misting pump that barely works. Spend the extra 30 cents and get something that works.

title: Nice set that clears up counter space while keeping teeth healthy.
text:
I am a Sonicare user for a long time and have had three different models over the years.
The tooth brush here is pretty standard for Sonicare. 2 minute timer with 30 second interval alert.

Its a little fatter than most of their latest models but not at all a hindrance This means its a nickel metal hydryde battery vs the lithium ion in the newest versions.

The real news is in the flosser. I've used Waterpiks off and on over the years and always had good results. The downside was always the container that had to be stored on the counter top.

After using this for several weeks I can say that it is very handy and works well. The handle is fairly large and much bigger and heavier than a Waterpik handle which took a bit of getting used to. In general I would say its a bit of a draw between the two with the edge going to the Sonicare for the ability to clean it and store it quickly without taking up any counter space.

All in this kit is also less expensive than buying the pieces separately. However the trade off there is the bigger handle and weight of the tooth brush.

title: Fantastic competitor for clean chemical free hygiene!
text:
5 stars! Fantastic competitor for clean chemical free hygiene!

Works great for me!

The only gripe is the container/tube can be a little tricky to operate, but apparently i was doing it wrong so squeezing on the inner sleeve and pushing up better than inverting it and pushing it through the hole in the bottom of the outer sleeve (which I was doing). My incorrect way, could potentially make things easier if the packaging was slightly redesigned so the lip of the outer sleeve could fully encompass the product as it's pushed out if like me it's kinda stiff to squeeze out without using the rest of the packaging as a tool. Secondly, the cap is not deep enough, just another 5mm would do.

I now use this alternating with my [[ASIN:B000F8K8AE Earth Science Deodorant - Liken Plant Unscented 2.45 oz.]]. The best fragrance free deodorants I can find! There are some other pretty awesome brands out there, but they don't offer fragrance free / chemical free last I checked. Cleanest thing I could find! Thank you!

Apparently, the the sunflower oil IS expeller pressed (sweet!), and the product is no longer made with castor oil! Some packages apparently still have it on there however.

I just looked it up and apparently castor not safe for the workers... unless of course you're sourcing it from somewhere with massive labor / workplace safety regulations and the manufacturer is supplying the necessary equipment... which of course not the way most castor oil is made in the world... so it's fantastic that Gaia Guy decided not to put it in here anymore!

Cheers!

Starting off with the packaging, it is well made, and it does bring many sheet masks you can pick up with some tweezers it brings. The masks in themselves are moist but not overly wet. That is, they will stick to your face (I've had these while walking around), but won't have product dripping down your neck. The solution is scented but not overly, and is not slimy as most masks, but will definitely tone/tighten your skin. I use these for 10min and they will remain there for that amount of time, but the edges will start to peel off after about 5 to 7min. I use these every other day. I would recommend these if you wanted to get the most masks out of your money, but honestly, I think there are better masks out there. That said, I will continue to use these.

title: Awesome Shampoo
text:
Be sure to check the size of the product in the listing. These were smaller than I expected for the price!

It’s challenging to dispense the product, especially when wet. I have to really shake and SQUEEZE again and again.

That said, the shampoo is AMAZING. I have a ton of fine hair, which I wash 3 times a week. I feel it needs sulfates to feel clean and stay feeling clean, and this shampoo keeps it feeling fresh for days. It also lathers beautifully, unlike a lot of other “free-from” shampoos!

The scent is downright nonexistent. No “no scent” scent, like soy-based products often have (this is soy free).

The dry shampoo does not have a white cast, but I need a LOT of it to get any cleaning or degreasing effect. So meh.

Some people apparently find the shampoo fairly drying, but I’m a greasy scalped gal, so it works really nicely for me.

I used this product as a tester, and wound up purchasing a full size of the shampoo.

title: Stays on much longer than I thought
text: I bought this for my 3 year old after researching nail paint.  I don't paint my nails and I didn't want my daughter painting her nails but reading that there were no harsh chemicals sold me.  This nail polish has no smell.  My husband likes putting it on my daughter and even my 5 year old son likes putting it on her.  Yes, it does chip after a day because she's 3 and she sticks her fingers into toys, play-doh and food.  However, her toenails have lasted 2 or 3 days.  The polish is easily washed off of skin and I can also easily scrape it off with my finger nail.  I have not tried to take it off with alcohol like they have recommended.  After seeing the reviews about the cap and wand coming apart, I do make an effort to clean around the polish top and around the wand after each use.  The polish top can be cleaned just by picking off the old polish with your fingernail and the wand I just wipe a wet paper towel around it.  So far we've had no problems taking the cap on and off with this method.  After 3 days my daughter has already polished her fingernails 5 times with the same pink polish and so far so good!

title: Love this razer, just like I loved the previous model (same razer)
text:
Summary: Nothing not to like!

Background: Previously, I owned the earlier model of this razer. It was the same exact razer except it used to be blue. I loved this razer, but it was eaten by a dog! I didnt want to cough up the full cost of this direct replacement, so I used a lower-end Norelco. As you may know, the lower models do not feature the "Speed-XL" shaving heads (which have 3 concentric rings of blades (per head)). Instead it had the single outer row of blades, which is pretty typical of any non-high-end razer.

Why this razer is good:
The point of my background story is that there is a SIGNIFICANT difference between the Speed-XL models, and older style heads. In fact THERE IS NO COMPARISON! With the cheaper razer I had to go over my face at least twice as much, and usually more like 3x as much as with this razer. As with all electric's, you're not going to be able to make a single pass and get everything, but as electric's go, this razer (and all the Norelco's with Speed-XL) works great. Both myself and my dad (who is used to foil razers) agree that Speed-XL is the best electric we've used!

Some niceties of this razer are that its VERY easy to clean. Usually you can just pop the top and tap most of the hair out, maybe use the brush real quick. I dont feel like I have to do a deep cleaning (taking the heads out and apart) very often because it doesnt seem to trap a lot of hair in the heads. But if you want to, its very easy to access everything.
The body is waterproof, so you can clean it out with water as a middle ground between just tapping hair out and dissassembly.
The charger is now VERY small, and takes up only a single plug (even on a strip), and the base is also small.
Battery life: lets me shave for multiple days (at least 4) before it needs charging.

That said there are some minor quibbles. Like most Norelco razers, the charger doesnt shut off automatically, so you need to be careful with leaving it plugged in all the time. My solution: leave the charger in a draw, keep the stand on my countertop to hold the razer all the time, and then just get the charger out (and plug it into the stand) when the razer actually needs charged, which for me is only ever handful of days. this also has the added benefit of saving some small amount of energy by not having the wall wart plugged in while you're not charging.
This razer now comes with a form fitting travel case, and you cant put the razer in it with the hair gaurd on it :( so make sure you clean it before you travel with it. You also cant fit the charger in the case...its really a case JUST for the razer, to protect it in your regular toiletries bag.

All in all any of the speed-xl razers will cut the same, so just buy the model that has the accessories you want. I think this model represents the best value because its the cheapest :) personally i dont care about a multi-step battery readout, or a cleaning station...but if you do buy those versions.

title: So happy!
text: We just recently moved into a very small city that doesn't have an Asian market or anything.  I totally forgot to stock up on this before we moved but I am so glad to have found it online.  I have really long and dry hair, so when I use a thick/creamy conditioner it makes my back breakout (backne, yuck!)  So for 2 months, I had to use a regular pouf that you get at Target/Wal-mart.  It sucked!!!  My breakouts were bad (no tank tops for me in this hot desert) but once I received this, in one week all of it is gone.  It's really rough, so it can be hard to get use to.  If you scrub too hard, you will make your skin hurt like a sunburn. Use this softly on gentle areas but put a little more pressure on places you want to exfoliate (knees, elbow, back and chest).  My husband likes to use it on his face but I can't.  Totally awesome!!!

title: So much better than 5 magnet eyelashes
text:
After trying several of the 5 magnet type, I found these and I'm so glad I did! The 5 magnet type never worked after I tried to cut them to the right size because there was never a magnet on the end, which made it impossible to get them to stay on without using glue. I found these with 10 smaller magnets and thought I would give them a try! I was able to cut them to the right size and still have magnets on both ends, so they would stay on. I am not very good at applying liquid liner, but I was able to get this liner to work just fine. I used these for my wedding and they stayed on all day/evening and weren't too heavy feeling like some lashes. They really made my eyes pop and stand out beautifully in pictures! In the photos, the close ups were before the wedding to try them out, and although the one end wouldn't stay on that time, I was able to get it to stay on the wedding day.

The only thing I didn't like (which is the same with all of these magnetic liners) is that the liner is difficult to remove. The lashes themselves came off fine, but the liner was not easy to remove (from my skin or the lashes). I don't like to use makeup removers, so I used coconut oil. It took some time to get it off. But I don't think that's anything specific to this liner, it's the magnetic liners in general.

I recommend these lashes over all of those 5 magnet ones!

title: Best trimmer yet, but one irritating flaw
text:

I exchanged the crappy one for this one and found its capabilities supersede my needs, and then some. I could probably trim the hedges with this thing. The vacuum is also very impressive. I assumed I'd be sweeping half my body hair off the floor (yeah, "bodyhair" trimmers don't actually do what I want them to, so I use beard trimmers. Most people that I know do, too).

So, what's the drawback? The setting doesn't stay put. Unless you old it by the setting dial, it'll slip down with even the slightest pressure. It's pathetic. The box says something about setting "lock", but that's just a norelco company inside joke.

title: Allowed me to stop using styling products
text:
I have fine hair and I've always had trouble with it getting frizzy and poofy. In the past I've used a variety of pomades, water wax, etc., to tame and weigh down my hair. But after switching to Wen I don't need to use anything. My hair is soft, not frizzy, and easy to control. Since I don't need to add any products it feels and looks better. The Tea Tree blend worked better on soothing my dry scalp than the Cucumber Aloe that I originally tried (got it as a gift).

It's definitely worth the price, but I would give it 5 stars if it were a little more affordable. The gallon size helps make it more economical.

title: light, floral lavender
text:
Lavender is my #1 go-to essential oil. I think I use it in 90% of my blends, whether in the diffuser or in topical blends (or sprays, etc). The only thing I definitely don’t use it for is my home-made cleaning products where citrus oils are the only essential oils.

This particular oil is a very delicate scent – some lavender oils can pack quite a punch in terms of the scent. This is certainly floral and has a ‘high note’ to it. You can easily pick it out of a blend. It’s my first oil from New York Biology and I’m very pleased.

I love blending lavender in particular with chamomile, as it has an almost instantaneous calming effect. Also love to blend it with bergamot, ylang ylang, mandarin, and a drop of lime.

The bottle is very large, a dark brown color to protect the oil from UV rays which can damage the oils and decrease the shelf life. My favorite way to dispense oils is with the eye dropper (the euro droppers found in smaller bottles tend to gush several drops at once, so that’s definitely not my preference) – you can really control how many drops you dispense with these eye droppers.

Arrived well protected in bubble wrap and there was no leaks.

* I received the oil for evaluation and review

title: enjoying this - great in tandem with a thick skin cream
text:
My mother asked me to find her a moisturizer with matrixxyl and peptides. Very specific and she didn’t want anything that did not have at least those two ingredients.

The reason is a conversation with her dermatologist. Matrixxyl is made of 2 peptides, palmitoyl-tripeptide and palmitoyl-oligopeptide, which stimulate collagen and elastin production in the skin. And peptides form a long chain of amino acids to become proteins, penetrating the top layer of skin cells and signaling the cells including collagen.

The Cazbe serum works really nicely in tandem with my mom’s Ponds cream (she has used Ponds as long as I remember). The serum absorbs pretty rapidly and unlike other serums, doesn’t seem to leave her skin feeling sort of ‘tight’ or dry. After a few minutes (she will put the serum on before brushing her teeth, and then follow with moisturizer after teeth), she will apply the Ponds cream to completely moisturize her face. I’ve tried this a few times and find I can only really use it around my eyes – it dries out my cheeks and chin. If used just around my eyes, it feels a lot better.

Her skin is looking beautiful. I think in combination with a really solid cream to sort of ‘seal in’ the benefits, after washing your face, and just before bed, it’s a great part of your beauty routine.

* we received the serum for evaluation and review

title: Another winner from Majestic Pure
text:
I have many Majestic Pure products (from skin care products, to hair care, to essential oils), and have always been very satisfied. I am also pleased with the retinol cream. Having very sensitive skin, I tend to use products containing retinol quite sparingly (aka, every few days, vs. daily) as they tend to cause my skin to become quite irritated or scaly after a few days of daily use. I’ve been using this around just my eyes every evening (about 1 hour after applying a hyaluronic acid serum), as my skin is so sensitive that using anything with retinol on my entire face seems to really cause a lot of scaliness. And, this is where the fine lines are really beginning to show.

The results – after using a cream with retinol in combination with hyaluronic acid serum for 3 weeks, I’ve been noticing a definite reduction in the fine lines. They are still there but they were becoming really noticeable.

The cream has ingredients that are highly moisturizing (again, which I like to follow up on a serum with). The consistency is pretty thin (not thick and creamy like a lotion), and there is no noticeable fragrance. It seems to absorb quickly and is not oily.

Some note on the ingredients:

Retinol 2.5% - Retinol is another name for Vitamin A, which is an antioxidant (helps reverse the damage caused by free radicals, apparent in wrinkles and aging), encourages the production of collagen, and elastin.
Jojoba Oil - closely resembles sebum (a waxy substance produced by our skin glands), packed with vitamins and minerals - Vitamin E, B, copper, zinc, selenium, iodine and chromium.
Green Tea - Tea is high in anti-oxidant and anti-inflammatory properties, whether ingested or applied topically. Green tea contains tannins which can reduce puffiness and inflammation of the skin. It also contains polyphenols, which can combat free radicals (which contribute to aging). The catechins in tea can combat the bacteria that contribute to acne.
Propolis - Propolis, “bee glue or bee penicillin” is the resinous material gathered by honeybees from flowers and leaf buds of various plants. It contains dozens of anti-oxidants,
Shea Butter - The moisturizers in shea butter are similar to those produced by the skin’s sebaceous glands, making it one of the best choices for super-dry or cracked skin. Shea butter also contains anti-inflammatory compounds – great for applying to inflamed or irritated skin (think eczema, chapped skin, bug bites)
Vitamin B5 - A humectant (a water-binding substance that attracts and retains water). Particularly good for the skin as it stabilizes the skin barrier, increasing hydration and improving softness and elasticity.
Vitamin E - A powerful antioxidant, that neutralizes the oxidant effect of free radicals, which are molecules that damage collagen and cause skin dryness, fine lines and wrinkles

*I received the retinol cream for evaluation and review

title: My skin feels good - not greasy. It's easy to dispense from the bottle. And 2 compliments from friends after using it for 1 week
text:
I bought this to begin (and win!) the fight against the wrinkles that are appearing around my eyes (crow's feet). I guess the best solution is not to laugh, but then what fun would life be...

What is Hyaluronic acid? According to WebMD, "Hyaluronic acid works by acting as a cushion and lubricant in the joints and other tissues. In addition, it might affect the way the body responds to injury."

(+) Does it work? I've used the Hyaluronic serum every night for a week now. Not sure if I can say 100% that I have noticed no fine lines around my eyes, but I've had 2 friends remark that my skin is looking great. As we women know, that's a good endorsement right there.

(+) Texture: As you can see in the photo, the Derma-nu serum is a clear, slightly viscous consistency that goes on clear. You can feel it on your skin for quite a few minutes afterwards. It does NOT leave your skin feeling greasy (big pet peeve of mine) when you wake up in the morning.

(+) Smell: This is not a scented beauty product. There is a very slight almost medicinal scent - that's the best way to describe it. It is not unpleasant, it is extremely mild, but it smells like it has some ingredients that 'have a purpose', vs. beauty products that have fragrances added.

(+) Packaging and ease of use: The pump is well made - it dispenses a small amount of serum, which I am finding is enough for applying to the corners of both eyes. I'm having to "prime" the pump about 2-3 times before it dispenses the serum, so be careful, you don't want to double pump the serum unless you are OK putting possibly 2x the amount on your face than you might have intended.

(+) A little goes a long way. I travel a lot, so the compact bottle and efficient dispensing from the pump are bonuses for me.

(/) Organic. The bottle indicates that 72% of the ingredients are organic. It doesn't clarify which of the ingredients are/are not organic. It would be nice to see this get to 100%.

Bottom line: So far, my skin has felt good, I've had a few compliments, and I'm pleased with the way Derma-nu packaged the Hyaluronic serum so that it is easy to dispense.

*I received the serum for evaluation and review

title: Great shave, great value - use with Letric Shave
text:
I tried electric razors ten years ago with a Braun model but my skin was too sensitive and I received nicks and cuts and a poor shave. Three years ago, I tried again with a Remington, and it worked great for my head -- not so great for my face. Lots of nicks, and spread a rash. I was especially disappointed that it didn't get my neck very well. Both shavers were straight foil shavers, as I thought they would shave closer than round heads.

Then, I purchased this Norelco over 2 months ago, and it has worked like a dream for me. While the first week wasn't especially close, it was convenient as I was traveling for work. By the third week, however, the shave was CLOSER than my regular Mach 3 blade shave!

One huge difference: I bought some Letric Shave pre-shave liquid, which makes the whiskers stand up, and also disinfects the shaving heads. I haven't had one cut, and no rash, in over 60 shaves with this unit. Since then, I have used the Norelco every morning, along with the Letric Shave, and have been thrilled with the results. I have also wondered whether my previous experience with an electric would have been better had I $3.49 to get the pre-shave splash!

I have to agree with one poster who complained about the plastic parts - the only reason I didn't give the product 5 stars. I don't really know how long this unit will run. I do know in 2 months, I have already saved more on this unit than disposable blades would have cost. And, travel is a snap. Charges quickly, runs quietly, and usually holds its charge for the entire week. I'm a VERY happy customer!

title: Literal Nightmare
text:
To preface my review this is my first attempt with at-home waxing & I'm Trans MTF. I've waxed plenty in my lifetime, but always at a salon by a professional. Now I'm sitting here typing this review with an incredibly thin layer of wax all way down my still very hairy left leg.

I purchased the wax roughly 3 months ago, so I don't think the wax is expired, and it was stored in the original packaging in the meantime. I think the main issue is with the roller unit in general. I was literally pulling more hairs out just rolling the wax onto my leg than I was will the couple of strips I did manage to try. I don't have an issue with pulling hairs or anything. Tweezing nose hairs, or threading is WAY more painful and I don't have an issue with either of those.

It took the unit forever to just warm up enough, instructions are laughable at best (broken unclear English), the included wax cleanup wipes are useless & dry (I'm about to google how to remove all this excess wax off my leg in a moment here). I feel if I could break open the unit and heat the wax over the stove it would work 100% better, but I don't want to risk my cookware.

Update: #1: I was able to successfully microwave the cartridge for 3 mins in a bowl of water. 5 minutes would likely work better for you as my cartridge was still warm when I started. The wax rolled much nicer this time around, but still required some pulling, however it started to pool on one side of the roller resulting in the whole roller stopping again and even got a spot onto my bathroom rug that I had been carefully avoiding... The irritation from the wax is worse than using a depilatory cream (such as Nair)

Update #2: After oven an hour of attempting to remove the wax with various products. (baby oil, oil-free makeup remover, acetone, rubbing alcohol, body wash, and finally olive oil in that order). The olive oil and now trashed white washcloth finally did the trick. I really can't recommend avoiding this product enough. I'd be willing to try hard wax, but I'm not about to attempt anything from home until I consult with my local salon at my next nail / hair apt.

title: 17 months and still going strong
text:
This is definitely the most inexpensive entry into the Sonicare line. Well worth the price.

Likes:
-Uses AA batteries, either disposable or rechargeable. Works great with Sanyo Eneloop or similar "pre-charged" rechargeable batteries.
-Very inexpensive
-Uses same technology and brush heads as the far more expensive models.

Dislikes:
-Lacks some of the features of the higher-end models, such as the little beep that prompts you to move on to a different quadrant of your mouth.
-No indication of low battery. When the batteries are done, they're DONE. Leaves me running around with a mouthfull of toothpaste while fumbling to replace the batteries.

I've had mine for about 17 months with no issues other than periodic brush and battery replacement. Recently added two more to the household for the kids.

title: Dont Judge the Cream by the Packaging
text:
The original Guerisson 9 Complex costs truly fraction of high-end department store brands but the packaging belies this. Its glass jar, embossed metal lid, applicator, and elaborate round box in Hermes orange gives the appearance of a much more expensive product. And the cream fulfills that promise.

The new Guerisson Delight cream comes in an atteactive plastic jar in a thin cardboard box, more reminiscent of the better drug store brands. (I've included a picture of both.) However, the high quality of the product is the same.

This is a rich but substantially lighter version of the original, perfect for the summer months. Very lightly scented, this new contains the botanicals and hydrating ingredients of the 9 Complex, including the controversial one that earned it the amusing nickname "creme de la mare."

In this case, dont pre-judge the treatment by the jar. Great results this far; will update the review as needed.

title: True Dermacol - Product Brokedown
text:
I want to start by saying this is "Authentic" Dermacol. I verified the product code & packaging. My issues are not with the seller. Product was as described & shipped
quickly. I have used this product 3 x since receiving. Basically this is traditional pan make up in a tube. It's very thick & quite greasy on its own. I have tried to make good use of Dermacol, unfortunately no matter how I prep/prime/set/apply this make up broke down within in 3 hrs. My skin is normal with an occasional break out. I have not experienced any break outs. I feel this product is truly for stage/photo use. The amount needed for "full" coverage would be akin to literally wearing a mask. The product did not blend & basically sat on top of the skin. As it breaks down it becomes a thin, speckled look. Primer, setting powder nor spray made a difference. Then it settles in ALL your fine lines & imperfections. It's a hard pass for me. I would like to also add, the promos with product covering tatoos etc is just hype. It May be water proof but be advised it's not smudge/rub proof.

title: Good Value for Your Money With Pleasing Results
text:
I bought this product, the Neutrogena Wave because I wanted to take my skincare regimin to the next level. I looked at the competetors but settled on this product due to the price of $12.97 at Walmart. It comes with the massager, pop-out attachment for the cleansing pad,(14) and a AA battery along with 14 cleansing pads. First, let me say I'm in my fifty's so skincare is important to me but I don't have the luxury of spending hundreds on skincare products. My skin is now starting to show signs of aging by fine lines and deep wrinkles and circles under my eyes. My main goal from this product is for my skin to improve in the following areas:

more even skin texture
more radiance
more firmness
more softer, subtle feel
help with deep skin cleansing and exfoliation

I used this product today for the first time following the instructions carefully. The product is very well made so far as the size as it comfortably fits in your palm. The attachment which holds the cleanser pad comes of easily and the cleansing pad attachs to it with no problems. Simply wet the pad with some water and push the button to start.You can also re- wet the pad if more is needed later. The vibration is both somewhat quiet but not irritating on the skin at all. You don't need to push on the product while holding it as it does the massaging for you!! The cleansing pads have a nice smell to them- nothing too perfumy, just a nice clean smell. Simply guide the skin massager over your face concentrating on the areas that you feel need the most attention. You control how long you feel each area needs to be cleansed.
I found my skin afterward to be more soft and brighter than before I used the Neutrogena Wave. It was easy to use and control and can ber used in the shower. The cleansing pads are available for about $6.49 for about 1-2 months worth depending on how often you use the product. It is gentle enough I feel you could use it every day depending on yourt skin type.
Bottom line is, if you don't want to spend alot for a "skin rejuvenator" than consider the Neutrogena Wave! I think you'll like the results and for alot less too!!

title: This is by far the best eyebrow pencil I've used
text: This is by far the best eyebrow pencil I've used. Just waxy enough to apply and blend out, but not so much that it clumps up. The first pencil I bought from this brand lasted about 6 months, so the price is easy for me justify. I also love that this is so fine that it doesn't need to be sharpened, but also holds up to daily application without falling apart. For reference, I use the "tantalizing taupe" color, and have light brown hair and very fair skin. It matches my brows perfectly without being too dark, even when I accidentally go overboard when rushing in the morning. This is the lowest price I've found, and will definitely buy again when I run out.

title: Love this wand!
text: I'm not going to lie and say using this particular wand was not time consuming...it definitely was, but the results are worth it.  I have very long hair, so wrapping was a bit of a struggle because the wand is only so long.  I was able to wrap around both the balls and the indents, giving a unique curl effect.  Works best to physically unwrap the strand of hair you're curling rather than pulling downward as with a traditional clipless wand.  Any reviews stating this wand does not give curl either has too short of hair, isn't using a high enough heat setting, or is completely doing it wrong.  You really need to use your right hand over your head to curl the left and vice versa for the right.  The black cool tip should be pointing downward as you curl.  There are some informative videos on YouTube for how to curl with this wand.  Anyhow, I'm pleased with this wand and look forward to many great looks from it.

title: Should have read the measurements more closely
text: This will not fit a standard sized shadow palette (think Too Faced Chocolate Bar, Sweet Peach, ABH Modern Renaissance etc...).  Also not deep enough for the square ELF face palettes -- they stick out way too far when the organizer is standing up.  Also not wide enough for the smaller Too Faced tin shadow palettes (Cat Eyes, PBJ, Boudoir Eyes etc...) to fit between the dividers.  So, with that being said, it's not much use to me but I didn't want to go through any return hassles, so it's holding some single blush and highlighter compacts right now.  I don't recommend unless you have something very specific that will fit the dimensions.  It is a nice quality item...just wish it would actually fit a palette.

title: Not great...
text: I really wish I didn't fall for every beauty gimmick that appears and I should have skipped this one!  While the product itself is well made, it just doesn't deliver a flawless application like a sponge or brush.  Seems to just smear the foundation and leaves it looking streaky...I end up having to blend with a sponge anyway.  Seemed to work a bit better for concealer on my skin.  This is definitely not a replacement for your favorite sponge blender or foundation brush.  The only real pro is that it's very easy to clean...otherwise it  just makes a mess of foundation application.

title: Three Stars

title: Overpriced but performed well
text:
I've used this to curl my hair a few times already and while the automatic feature is cool and convenient to give some relief to your poor arm, I can't justify the cost. You can create beach waves with any entry level low cost curling iron.

I wasn't able to great "beach waves", nope, just regular curls. But since it has dual rotation, you can make both sides of your hair match!

It is easy to figure out so I didn't have any trouble with that. It seems like high quality and was presented in the package well. But I wouldn't buy it for full price. Maybe if it was on sale. But I'm not going to give stars off since it's not outrageously overpriced and it did perform well. Someone may be able to justify the cost, but I can't and will not.

title: very good product
text:
I bought this product in order to treat some sun damage ( brown spots ) on my face and to avoid hydroquinone.

I have been using it for only four days and already the spots look lighter and my skin looks better and more translucent. Even my doctor of 12 years told me today that I must be feeling better because my skin and eyes looked "clearer " than he remembers in years ! ( I am 46 )

The only downside ( and this could be a coincidence ) is that my skin feels a bit dry ( it doesn't look dry ) but it feels dry....it was also too harsh for my undereyes so I pat it around the eye socket but not on the under eye area itself.

title: The name should be changed to "Orgasmic Nourishing Coconut Milk Shampoo & Conditioner"
text: I am so pleased with this shampoo and conditioner that I want to shout it out from the rooftop!  A relative from Hawaii brought this product into my shower during an overnight stay this summer and I was enticed by the scrumptious smell coming from my bathroom and recently decided on a lark to buy some and try it. I have used various expensive salon products for over 30 years and I have never experienced the results that I get from using this coconut combo.  I have very fine, color treated, long hair and my hair is now shinier, softer, tangle-free, healthier, and fuller than its ever been in my entire adult life, plus my hair smells natural, incredible, and edible.  Since I've been using this combo, every time I hug someone, they tell me I smell fantastic (men and women) and it's the only change in products that I've made.  A bonus is that this combo is at least half the cost of other quality products!  This is hands-down my all time favorite new shampoo and conditioner and puts all the other expensive products in my shower to shame.

title: I had read great things about Tamanu oil and I was desperate to ...
text:
I have been struggling with severe acne, and though I have made many other changes I've made to my skin care routine, I had read great things about Tamanu oil and I was desperate to try it, especially for my scars and dark spots. Since I added it to my skin care routine as a moisturizer, (not changing any of the other new things I had been doing for about six months) I have been getting a lot of comments about how much better my skin looks. My scars are healing, dark spots are getting significantly lighter, and the overall quality of my complexion is smoother and on the way to being healed. I am so pleased with this reasonably priced and 100% organic product. I will absolutely be buying again and recommending to friends.

title: Finally a solution!
text: This is great. Over the past 30 years I have tried everything on my poor dry feet. I have hypothyroidism which causes dry skin, poor circulation and hot/cold feet. This plus Earth to Skin Heel-Tastic has finally cured the deep cracks in my feet. This is better than Sally Hanson rasp, any sanding block, battery operated "diamond" rotary sander, pumice stone, sanding paddle... You get the idea. It has a variable speed which I have only used on high. It plugs into the wall so no worries about batteries and low power. The sanding pads are inexpensive and replaceable. I get at least a week of daily use out of each one. In the morning I gently sand my feet before I shower. I make sure to soap my feet good. Then I apply the Heel-Tastic just before I put on socks. I notice a change in a couple of days. The cracks were gone in a week. Oh, I swim for an hour several times a week, walk at least two miles a day and it still works!

The product is good and smells good. It’s more like a lotion than a butter though.
On the other hand, I paid $11.49 for it. When it just arrived, it had a tag of $3.99. I understand making a profit but ripping off people is just another level and not right!!

title: Nice in theory, not in practice
text: I really wanted to like this. It has a light, lemony scent. However, it does not distribtue to hair in the shower, instead it beads up. It does not melt in the hand and distribute onto hair post -shower - it beads up again, and leaves little dobs of the material on the hair instead of smoothing onto it. Basically, it beads up in your hands into little pellets and doesn't warm and melt into an oil or cream. Maybe it works better on dry hair? But I cannot use it at all, and it's not my hair, it's the product itself.

title: This is one of my staples!
text:
I feel like the negative reviewers may have received an expired product.
I have had no issues with the texture, integrity, or the smell (it smells like a sweet pastry).
It feels just like lipstick with a bit of sugar mixed in, that's all.
I barely twist it up and don't grind it into my lips - I make small back and forth motions all the way around my mouth using all sides of the crayon to get the maximum amount of the "grit", and then rub my lips together.
If that sounds weird, you don't have to do it that way. Sugar is a natural exfoliant without having to scrub it in, because of the glycolic acid. It also is a humectant.

title: Oh my gaaawwd these are amazing! And for the price
text: Oh my gaaawwd these are amazing! And for the price, it's like wow. The color was a bit red for chocolate brown but it worked well with my current hair color. I've used clip in extensions for years and in comparison this halo extension is so much more light and comfortable to wear. I can't believe I waited so long to try these! The hair had the perfect amount of curl and was bouncy. The thickness was just right too. It was a little too shiny for my liking so I sprayed some dry shampoo on it (I read that advice from another reviewer) and it dulled it perfectly. The hair is silky smooth so if you have really curly and frizzy hair like me you really need to straighten your hair well to get it smooth enough to blend in with the silky texture of the extensions. I'm super happy with these and will definitely try the other colors!

text: I've used Medicine Mama's Bee Magic, Egyptian Magic, and NOW Cocoa Butter creams. For a quarter of the price of the first two products, this stuff is great!! You'll need to put it in the heat to soften it up but I am very impressed with this creme. It's very greasy so when I apply it also wet my face after the application. I use it often and the results are wonderful especially with dry skin. The price is incredible!!!!!  I still buy Bee Magic and Egyptian Magic but I really love this creme, especially in the dry hot desert summer. I apply several times a day on several parts of my body especially around my eyes...I think this cream has more of a healing effect and I may prefer it over all of the above mentioned creams and its smells much better!!! It just needs to be in the heat to soften.

title: Skeptical
text:
Ok sooo I don’t know about this one. Clear vitamin C means it is 100% potent, but having an ingredient list that potency is no longer 100%. So upon seeing clear thick serum I was skeptical. Soon as I opened the bottle I added several drops to a small old bottle I own and left it open exposing to air, lights and anything else that causes oxidizing to the vitamin c. It stayed clear. After one week straight no changes. I even popped into the microwave for 8 seconds still clear. Had it contained ferulic acid I would have been less skeptic because FA is a Vitamin C stabilizer. On its own Vitamin C (L-absorbic acid) is unstable and begins to oxidize once the seal is broken. Yes even pure vitamin C in water it will turn a slight yellow and begin to darken.

But my skin did not break out a good thing. Even if it doesn’t contain vitamin c the other ingredients are a plus especially glycerin as the second ingredient ... which is a natural humectant, anti microbial and antiviral all meaning moisturized skin that won’t get clogged and controls acne. I do get acne (thank the skin gurus) but I do chemical exfoliate with acids and use a retinol. Two things that cause dry skin. If I should break out from a product then it is pure trash and the PH is way off.

So it has it pluses and minuses.

title: Great colors

Two people of the same complexion don’t always look good in the same color. So these cam work for fair or dark depending on your cool or warm undertone.
FOR REFERENCE; Lucky for me I’m neutral, but what works for me does not always work for my mother who is a cool undertone. Dark lipstick she looks great, lighter is a no-no.

title: I'll buy again
text:
I love it. My daughter suffers from dry skin, so I regularly make her body scrubs, and I just love it for myself. Melted coconut oil and sea salt are my main ingredients, so naturally I wanted something that would match that. This does.
For those saying it was dry, perhaps mixing the product would have helped (settling is real) or check your expiration date. Could have been a bad one. On first glance my bottle did lack "liquidity" turned upside down and there was the oils. Using product alone... no I don't smell coconut oil all day. With my body wash and shower lotion... yes! Yes I do.

I'm an experienced on line shopper; amazon, eBay, and various others shops. I've paid more money for big names and received the same results.

title: A Very Good Electric Shaver for Sensitive Skin
text:
As someone with very sensitive skin, I have always had problems with razor burn after shaving. Dry electric shavers tend to butcher my skin. Traditional multi-blade razors (like the Mach 3) are easier on my skin, but as sensitive as my skin is, cuts are not uncommon. A few months ago I received a Norelco 7735X Cool Skin Additive In/Out of Shower Shaver as a gift and gave it a try. Thanks to the shaving gel that can be applied to the skin at the touch of a button while shaving, it provides a very close shave that doesn't cut my skin like a traditional razor, and there's very little skin irritation afterwards. As for closeness, I'd say that it's almost as good as a Mach 3 razor.

One aspect about this shaver that I like is that it operates from a rechargeable battery so that there's no electric cord to get in the way while shaving. Also, the shaving gel packets are easy to replace, it comes with a charger stand, it's easy to clean the rotating blades and it takes up little bathroom counter space. Further, it takes less time to shave and clean-up afterwards than with a traditional razor & shaving cream.

Overall, I regard the Norelco 7735X Cool Skin Additive In/Out of Shower Shaver as a very good shaver and rate it with 5 out of 5 stars. Granted, it is somewhat expensive, but if you have very sensitive skin like me, you might be as pleasantly surprised as I was with its performance.

title: The Real "Miracle In A Jar" For Me!
text:
I've been a user of the Alpha Hydrox products for several years. I'm 38 going on 39, and some people still mistake me for 25 to early 30's. I especially love the 12% Souffle cream. Trust me, if you purchase this product, it will work SO well that you may take it for granted someday. Don't! I made that mistake, and it almost cost me my skin!

I had run out of the souffle and was lazy one day when repurchasing my skin care products, so I bought a drugstore brand of a popular new "Simply Radiant" skin care system with fancy "Soy Proteins" in it. I wanted to even out my skin tone (African-American, with a couple of dark dots left over from a few small pimples). After using the moisturizer for a week, I started developing cystic acne-type bumps on my face!! BIG pus-filled lumps that developed in clusters on my cheeks and forehead. I was horrified. I immediately stopped using the moisturizer, and the cysts stopped developing, but the damage was done; I had slowly-healing cystic acne bumps on my face. When I returned the cream to the drug store, the clerk took one look at me and quickly gave me my money back; the bad skin reaction was that obvious.

I ordered the Alpha Hydrox 12% Souffle as soon as I could, along with the Alpha Hydrox 14% AHA swipes to help accelerate my skin exfoliation. I used the swipes 3 times a week, and the souffle morning and night. After a month, I finally got the acne under control. After two months, my skin was smooth again. After six months, I was able to take the most gorgeous headshots I've ever had done, and the graphic artist only had to retouch "shine" on my forehead and chin. There's only a pinhead-sized indentation left over from the acne scars, and all the deep-colored hyperpigmented spots have completely healed and disappeared. My skin is baby-smooth, even toned, and if I had told you that approximately eight months ago I had deep acne scars on my face, you would never believe me.

I'm back to just the Souffle morning and evening for maintenance, but I'll NEVER take using my Alpha Hydrox products for granted ever again!
