title: take good care of the internal battery
text:
I bought this trimmer two months ago. I use it to keep my hair very short. I have not gone to a barber ever since I bought this. I simply turn the dial to set the guard to level 5 and cut all of my hair the same lenght. Definitely easy to use. On my short hair, I can probably get four complete haircuts in one charge. This is a good trimmer for those men who like to keep their hair very short all the way around. Use it two times and it would have paid for itself due to the fact that you were able to avoid going to a barber.
This is my second Norelco trimmer. My first one was a T6000 that I bought back in February of 2001. The battery stopped taking a charge four months ago, after almost 3 years of use. I called Norelco to have the battery replaced, and I was then informed that they do not replace the batteries on these trimmers since replacing the battery would cost as much as buying a newer unit. So, I ordered the newer T860 from Amazon. The T860 functions just like the older T6000. In addition, the T860 can also function as a corded trimmer, in the event the battery stops taking a charge. The service life of the trimmer can extend beyond the life of the rechargeable battery by using the cord. I am satisfied with it.
By the way, the reason why the battery got damaged in my older T6000 was that I kept the unit plugged in the charger stand for very long periods of time. I later learned not to do that, as that practice will damage the battery over time. Overcharging even a little seems to damage the battery over time. It's best to read the directions so you will know how to properly care for the battery. The battery basically will determine the life of the unit. The cutters do not wear out, from what I can tell. The motor seems durable. So the life of the unit is really how long you can keep the internal rechargeable battery working. Norelco's internal rechargeable Ni-Cad batteries can last a long time, if given proper care. They seem to be of good quality.
I had a Norelco 885 razor, and the battery was still taking a charge after nine years. The razor had the advantage of having a five level battery meter that tells you how much charge is left in the internal batteries. Basically, you want to wait until there is only a little charge left before you put the unit in the charger. It seems this trimmer is a bit different though. The instructions on the T860 unit say to completely drain the battery. Which would be a bit inconvenient. With the T860 trimmer, it takes 10 hours for a full charge. Recharge fully. That way, you can minimize the dreaded "memory effect" or voltage depression and extend the useful life of the rechargeable batteries. The rechargeable batteries are permanently soldered inside the unit. This trimmer unit, T860, does not have a charge meter. I refrained from getting the pricier unit with a charge meter in order to economize. However, my advice to you, if you're not too cost-sensitive, is to get a unit with a charge meter. That way, you will know when to charge the unit and when to remove the unit from the charger. That precise practice should help extend the life of the battery, and hence, the unit.

title: A Good Shaver from Norelco
text:
This is the latest shaver in Norelco's Quadra system. The shaving heads are mounted in such a way that gives them the freedom to depress independently of one another, to better adapt to the unique contours of your face. Another advantage to this razor is that the shaving heads can be washed under the faucet. This is a feature that the Quadra system razors share with the more expensive Spectra system razors.
This razor is light-years better than my previous Norelco. My last Norelco was the 885, bought back in 1991. That razor always irritated my skin, especially the neck area. Although it did last nine years. Three years ago, I switched to the Braun Syncro system. The Braun worked very well for me. Anyway, I decided to give Norelco another try. I was very surprised, and impressed, to say the least. This Quadra shaves just as close and just as comfortable as the Braun Syncro. And, it is very quiet. So far, I am only getting 35 minutes of shaving time per charge. But, I believe that the battery will reach its full capacity after a few more discharge and charge cycles.
For me, it is an even choice between this Norelco and the Braun. I can readily recommend either one. I suppose you just might have to try both and see which one will work better for you. One thing is obvious though. Either one will save you money in the long run, compared to using a blade shaver like the Mach 3, for example. The long-term cost of periodically buying replacement blades for a Mach 3 or Sensor Excel can easily exceed the price of either one of the electrics. I will admit, however, that neither of the electric razors can match the closeness of the Mach 3.

title: A Bit Difficult to Use but Produces Very Pretty Curls!
text:
For many years I've always straightened my hair because I cannot seem to get the hang of using curling irons to make pretty spiral curls. Wearing the same hairstyle all the time with long hair can get a bit boring so I decided to search on Amazon for styling tools that are easy to use. I initially ordered the [[ASIN:B003FBI9LS Bed Head Deep Waver]] and really loved the results so much that I also purchased this Rock 'n' Roller styling iron, which I affectionately call my "bubble curler."

The Bed Head Rock 'n' Roller Ceramic Styling Iron comes with the iron itself along with a black protective glove to protect your hand from the heat of this iron since there is no clamp. The iron measures almost 15 inches in length, with the heating barrel measuring about 5 3/4 inches. The balls measure about one inch in diameter. The cord measures almost six feet so there is plenty of length to move around with it. The iron has a black ball at the top so you can hold it while using it, a safety stand that works well, an on/off switch, a temperature dial that allows you to choose among the low, medium, and high settings as well as the temperatures in between all of them, and a swivel cord so you can easily move the iron around as you use it. I found that it heats up quickly and cools off rapidly as well in case you need to pack it up in your suitcase soon after using it. The glove fits well but I didn't end up using it since it feels a bit awkward to use while trying to grip strands of hair so I took a chance and kept my hand bare, with no problems as long as I styled my hair in front of a mirror so I could watch closely what I was doing.

I found this styling iron a bit difficult to use at first but it gets easier with practice. I just winged it and have included some pictures of my end result. There is a chart in the instructions as to what heat setting is most likely appropriate for your hair type but they recommend you start with the lowest setting and increase the heat as needed. I have wavy to medium hair so I started off using the low setting but ended up using the medium setting. I have long hair and it was fairly simple to wrap my hair around the barrel. When I got toward the end of the strands of hair, I carefully wrap them around the barrel, holding my fingers as close as I can to the styling iron without actually touching it. Then I roll the styling iron towards my head as close as I can so my hair gets curled as much as possible. I hold my hair in that position for about 40 seconds and then release it and curl my whole head. It probably took about a half hour to style all of my hair and then I finished by spraying it with hairspray. I didn't add any product to my hair before I started although you probably could if your hair works better that way.

Overall, I am happy with this styling iron and really like the end result. Hopefully it will get easier to use with time. I found it a bit difficult to use because, without having a clamp on the iron, I had to hold both arms up in the air and my muscles got tired pretty quickly. I'm in fairly good shape but perhaps this will get easier with time. I actually prefer the [[ASIN:B003FBI9LS Bed Head Deep Waver]] because I feel it's easier to use and I love the beach waves I get from it so I will most likely use that one more but this one is still good to have. If you want spiral curls, I'd purchase the Rock 'n' Roller Styling Iron but if you prefer beach waves, I'd purchase the Deep Waver. The price is just what I wanted to spend and I like the fact that I can have more hairstyles than just straightened hair! I recommend purchasing this styling iron if you want to add some variety to your hairstyle and aren't comfortable using a regular curling iron to get spiral curls.

title: Great color but allergy alert!
text: Pros: Beautiful, vibrant color, pleasant fragrance, and easy to use.  Cruelty free and vegan friendly.  I used this in a rainbow hair look (see pic).  Cons: minus one star because all of their dyes contain Methylchloroisothiazolinone and Methylisothiazolinone, which are added as an antimicrobial/anti-fungal.  These are known to be common allergens and repeated and/or extended exposure can increase risk of reaction.  Imagine the feeling of sunburned poison ivy on your scalp.  I am personally VERY allergic to this chemical, so I can never use these dyes on myself  :'(

title: Dry Brushing for Leaky Gut Detox
text:
I read, on a leaky gut blog, about dry brushing while doing detoxes so I ordered this brush to give it a try. This thing is pretty cool to be honest and I am so glad I opted for the brush that can be modified as such. I hate having “stuff” so anytime I can consolidate a product to be multi-use, especially living in a small space, it really helps. So using the brush does not feel entirely unpleasant but I am sure it will be something to get used to. It came wrapped in cellophane and really pretty tulle that it actually looked like a gift (a note for anyone ordering as a gift there is really no need to pay the extra fee for gift wrapping services). Also there is a velour draw string bag that fits the brush when it is assembled. The purple is gorgeous kind of reminds me of a Crown bag. I tested the brush out on one arm at work (I have packages delivered to me at work) and my coworker said my arm feels softer than the other. Oh and the TMI factor-I am calling it fairy dust for now but the white dust that flew off my arm, presumably dead skin, is kind of gross to see. Makes me want to go home and brush every bit! And so I will! I rarely give all 5 stars but I already love this thing

I have been through three of these. I like them enough to purchase another, but, have some complaints about their durability.

My first two units refused to operate after about 3 months. After the second one decided to stop working; I decided to take it apart..... What I found was pretty gross.......... Cr^p was growing inside and seemed to be........ well......it was not an attractive habitat inside the toothbrush.....not for me anyway....

With my most recent battery operated toothbrush, I have decided to remove the brush head (right word?)and shake all the water out every time I use it. This one has been going strong, with every day use for over 6 months!

It would be nice if the manufacturer gave instructions as to how to prolong the life of your purchase... but then again, they probably wouldn't make as many sales.

They have sold me three in the course of a year.

title: Eco friendly, healthier for baby, and fantastic?  Win, win, win!
text:
As the mother of two young children, I have become increasingly concern about environmental chemicals and their effects on children. I've spent hours reading about pesticides and commonly-used chemical components in cosmetics, and have ultimately decided to do whatever I can to eliminate chemicals from my home. After doing a lot of research on The Good Guide, I decided to try Method's product, as it received one of the best scores on the site.

First off, I want to say that I absolutely love the pump! I've had two babies, and wrestling with the tube of cream has always annoyed me. The pump is far neater and easier to handle. Now that I've tried it, I don't intend to ever go back to one of those nasty tubes.

The other thing I noticed is how this cream is the only one I've tried that actually stays where it is put. I've used Desitin and California Baby's cream, and this is the only one that sticks to the red areas on my son's bottom. The other two had a tendency to slide right off the really red parts and onto the skin surrounding them. Needless to say, that was very annoying, considering the point of using the cream was to try to eliminate the read sores. This cream has a nice, thick consistency and spreads far more easily than the other two brands I've mentioned.

The big advantage to buying this in bulk on Amazon is that it no costs me no more than the tubes of Desitin that I used to buy. I've already used many other Method products for the home (French lavender all-purpose cleanser, hand soap, etc.), and this product has only strengthened my love for the Method brand. I'd definitely recommend it to all parents.

title: Perk up the girls naturally.
text:
This is one product that really intrigued me. To be honest, I was a bit skeptical, but this cream really did deliver positive results! Now, this cream is in no way intended to take you from a A cup to a DD cup. That being said, it really did enhance my C cup breasts and give me cleavage that I never had before unless I used one of those super padded push up bras. I'd also like to mention that I have very sensitive skin and because this cream is made out of 100% all natural herbs, I had no adverse reaction or side effects at all!

I used this cream, which basically has no scent, twice a day and within a few days, I was seeing positive results. My 45 year old breasts are no longer on the saggy side. It really perked up the girls! All it took was 5 minutes to thoroughly massage this cream onto my breasts, being careful to avoid my nipples. This cream comes with a very detailed set of instructions on how to massage it onto your breasts, which actually felt very relaxing.

I was offered this product at a slightly reduced price in exchange for honest evaluation and review. It is my honest opinion that this cream does indeed deliver the desired results that women my age want. I would most definitely recommend it to a friend and plan on continuing to use this cream myself. The results speak for themselves.

title: Excellent Serum for all skin types
text:
I am a Product Tester and was offered this Anti-Aging Serum by Sublime at a special price during a promotion the company was having; in exchange, I would test their product and give you my honest feedback. I can honestly say that I love this product. It's a serum, which I love, because serums tend to have a more concentrated dose of active ingredients than do creams. (But that's just my personal opinion) I also love the fact that it is a pump dispenser, this way I always get just the right amount without waste or contamination.

I have been using this wonderful serum 3 times a week and the results are astounding! It's nice and light and glides on like silk and has a soft, subtle scent. It's worked wonders on minimizing those fine lines I've started to notice. It has also helped clear up my skin by unclogging my pores. Sublime contains glycolic acid and salicylic acid which are natural fruit ingredients with exfoliating properties that encourages the sloughing of dead skin cells improving the tone and texture of my skin. My skin looks radiant and more youthful.

It is my honest opinion that this anti-aging serum by Sublime works very well and has become part of my skin care routine. If you haven't tried it yet, what are you waiting for? Your skin will thank you!

title: Get a spa quality treatment in 20 minutes.
text:
I love to pamper myself with deep hydrating/anti-aging facial masks. After all, why do I need to spend a fortune on spa treatments when I can have that spa experience in the comfort and privacy of my own home. I received this particular mask at a special price for the purposes of product testing and reviewing. Everything contained in this review is my own personal experience using this mask.
First I made sure my face was freshly washed and found a quiet area where I could apply the mask and lay back and relax for 20 minutes. By quiet area, I mean I made sure I was home alone so no one would bother me, I turned the television off and played some soft soothing music to relax myself and to really give myself that spa experience.
Applying the mask was super simple and it completely fit all the contours of my face evenly. Thereby giving my face all the wonderful benefits of this rich hydrating formula. Then I just relaxed and let the mask do all the work. I have sensitive skin and was pleased that the all natural ingredients in this mask did not irritate my sensitive skin what so ever. In fact, it actually helped improve the look and feel of my skin after just one use. After the 20 minutes were up, I was amazed at how soft and hydrated my skin felt. I had no idea I had let my skin get that dry. I plan on taking time out for myself at least once a week to give myself a deep hydrating, anti-aging mask. After all, the key to younger looking skin, is keeping it well hydrated. I love these masks and would also recommend them. They make you feel great afterward!

title: I really enjoy using Ove Beauty products
text: I really enjoy using Ove Beauty products, they have a wonderful fresh, light scent and work great on my sensitive skin. Retinol has been used for years to reduce to appearance of lines and wrinkles and Hyaluronic Acid nourishes and replenishes the moisture of your skin. It's really a great product.

title: Leaves my skin feeling soft and smooth
text: I like that this exfoliates, but doesn't have a lot of micro beads that scratch my skin. I have used exfoliators that are very gritty, which I guess is how they exfoliate. This one doesn't have that at all and it still takes off all of my dead skin cells. It is a clear gel that goes on smoothly when applied. I made sure to rub my skin in a circular motion for 60 seconds before rinsing it off. It has a cooling sensation when on my skin and has a nice fresh scent. My skin felt very, very soft when I rinsed off this gel. It also made the skin on my hands look renewed. I was considering giving it 4 stars because of the price, but it is the most gentle exfoliator that I have ever used and it does work very well. I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

title: Works well on my sun spots!
text: I really like using this serum to help with my sun spots. Being older, and after many years of tanning, my sun spots are very noticeable. I never paid much attention to them before, but it seems like they really stand out now when I look in the mirror. I am very pleased with the way this vitamin C serum has made them fade and evened out my skin tone. It has also helped diminish my fine lines and wrinkles. My skin appears youthful again. I was glad to see that this serum also contained hyaluronic acid because I love the way it makes my face look so hydrated. This serum is thin and it goes on quickly and smoothly. It absorbs quickly and doesn't leave any kind of residue. It does not have any scent. I have sensitive skin and this serum did not irritate it at all. I received this serum at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

title: This is the best serum for my acne prone, sensitive skin!
text: This is one of the best serums that I have ever used. I would give it more than 5 stars, if I could. I have loved all of the Sublime Beauty products that I have used. All of their products are made with high quality ingredients. That is very important to me because I have sensitive skin that will break out easily. I really have to be careful with any products that I use on my face. I have used products with glycolic acid before with great results. I have also used salicylic acid, but it was always in my acne products. I have never used a serum containing both. This serum is truly amazing and I just can't get over how well it works on my face. My acne totally dried up and my pores looked so small and clear, especially all of the pores around my nose. I have very oily skin, so I started using it everyday. I noticed though, that my skin really started to get dry when using it everyday, so I started using it every other day. I still get the same great results, but now I don't have any dryness on my face. This serum is pretty thin and goes on easily. I didn't need to use much to cover my entire face. It absorbed very quickly and I was left with no residue on my face. I was very happy to be able to try this serum for my honest review.

title: Great hydrating serum!
text: I love using Hyaluronic Acid on my skin, so I was very happy to be able to this serum for my honest review. I have noticed that as I get older (I am now in my late 40s), my face looks old and dry. I have many more fine lines and wrinkles also, especially around my eyes. I have very sensitive skin and break out easily, so I have be careful what products I use. I had no breakouts or irritation with this serum. I really like the consistency of this serum. It's not too thick or too thin and it's nice that it has a pump instead of an eye dropper. I find that easier to use. One pump was more than enough to cover my entire face. I love how hydrated and youthful my face looks after using this for 2 weeks. It also makes my face feel so smooth. I did not put a moisturizer on after the serum, because I wanted to see how my skin reacted to the serum alone. As I said, my skin looked so hydrated and felt so smooth, that I didn't want to put anything on top of the serum, so I know that this is really working.

title: you do not want to take it out of your mouth!

Do not hesitate to spend this money on this product! You are going to love it and at is worth every penny!

title: Powerful Age Fighting Eye Gel...
text: I've been using this eye gel for over three weeks now. I've tried and tested several eye gels in the past. I'd rate this one some where in the middle of the pack. I'm glad to see that the price has come down from the $40 price tag it was when I was initially sent a bottle at a discounted price simply to provide my experience and opinion about this product. It does have some wonderful ingredients and I appreciate the generous size bottle and the fact that the print isn't too small to read both on the box and the bottle. Thank you for that. I also like that it's paraben free, not tested on animals, contains no dyes or fragrances and is made in America. I don't like that it contains Alcohol. It is on the bottom of the ingredient list but I'm thinking that it's needed to combat the stickiness. It does a great job at waking up tired eyes. Within minutes, fine lines fill in as this product seems to plump up your skin. Where I find it to be a problem is that I have to follow it up with another eye cream to lose the stickiness before applying makeup. On days when I don't wear makeup, it's not a problem. Probably because it has more time to penetrate the skin. Overall, it's a nice product that is now priced right.

title: Great for your legs!
text:
They say the cure for cancer will be found in the sea. I've long been a fan of Dead Sea Mineral products so I was excited when LeliaSea sent me a sample to try and test as a consumer for the purpose of this review. Here's my opinion:

It's packaged quite nicely. I don't detect much of a scent at all which is nice so it won't compete with my fragrances. However, I think it's quite small for a body lotion. It's the size of a hand cream. So given it's size, I feel like it's a bit pricey but it is a nice lotion. It soaks in quickly to dry skin and is highly moisturizing. It works well on my legs but on my hands it feels a little greasy. It's best to use on the driest parts of your body. Overall, I think it's a great lotion for extremely dry skin.

title: Quality Serum Reasonably Priced
text: This is a wonderful serum. When it first arrived, I was most impressed with it's packaging. It was sealed. So many are not largely because it's not required by law so I was pleasantly surprised to see that the box was sealed. When I opened the box, you're immediately greeted with a beautiful bottle. The cap snaps on and off firmly like it should. There's a pretty rose design on it as well. The serum has a pleasant scent, it's clear and just the right consistency. Some others are runnier than I like. Best of all, this serum is non drying yet firming. I put it all over my face and neck twice a day and followup with a quality moisturizer. I've been using a variety of Vitamin C Serums as a avid product tester for the past 6 months with excellent results. This one ranks in my top five and not as pricey as others I've tried. A great value. Sample provided to test as a consumer for review purposes regardless of my honest opinion.

title: Genius Design, Highly Concentrated Hard Working Serum
text: This is a very unique product. Not only by design but how it works. The bottle is packaged for on the go. I've never seen anything like it. A 1/4 turn of the bottle and the pump pops up. Turn it back and it goes down.  It's the coolest and most genius thing I've ever seen. The serum is highly concentrated. You only need a few drops. It literally melts into your skin and gets right to work. And work it does. I have combination skin and it caters to whatever your skin needs. I've only been using it for a couple of weeks and my age spots are faded, my lines are minimized and it doesn't my forehead oily like others do. It's worth the price and will last longer than other traditional serums. A great buy! I was fortunate enough to purchase it at a reduced price for testing, evaluation and review purposes. These are my findings and honest opinion.

title: I don't know what Peptides are but I LOVE them!
text: I'm in love with this moisturizer. First off, I have to talk about the quality of the bottle. Not only is it gorgeous but it's soft like a baby's butt. Before you even open the bottle, you know their claim of Luxury is true. The pump is quality as well. I've had some that are all over the place. I use one pump for my neck and one for my face. I tend to have oily areas on my face but this seems to be reducing that problem. The scent is faint which I like but I love that it's made in America and not tested on animals. Great product!

title: HOT PINK!!!!!
text: I actually purchased the Aneomne Wind Flower Hair Dryer by XTAVA but was sent the Peony by mistake. However when I opened the package I just fell in love with the bright pink dryer!  Pink is after all my favorite color!  The Peony is compact and will fit in a suitcase with ease for traveling. I love the multiple speeds and the different heat settings. I have fairly short hair and this dried my hair in a matter of minutes on medium speed. It would have taken less time if I didn't have to use brushes to style with.  It does come with two concentrator nozzles one for long hair and one for short.  I love these because I use a round brush and this allows me to direct heat to the area I'm working on and the rest of my hair isn't blowing around all over the place. It is a bit loud but that doesn't bother me and I don't find any any heavier than other dryers I've had that are made by XTAVA. All in all I love the dryer and expect to have years of use from it as long as my nieces don't steal it just because of the girly color. I was offered the Aneomme Wind Flower Dryer at a substantial discount for testing and providing feedback. Please know that Amazon offered me a mailing label to return the dryer so I wouldn't be out any money for returning. I'm happy that I kept it!

title: I love being WARM!

I opened one to use while doing so outside chores around the house as I hate to be cold.  I usually have to force myself to do these chores but braved the cold just to get to try out my warmers.  Well they worked!  My hands were toasty warm the whole time. I even moved them from my gloves to my stomach under my coat and it was just awesome to warm other body parts.  Did I mention...I HATE TO BE COLD! Will definitely keep these in mind for my dad and nephews as they hunt...will make a great gift to them!

title: Almost no scent
text:
Guys buying this stuff are doing it as much for the great scent as for their skin after shaving. The cream, soap and splash in the Venture set are not sillage monsters but they have far greater scent strength than the balm.

Since balm is the final step of the shave, it should have a bit more fragrance I should think.

So same great Captain’s Choice balm properties as all their flavors. But the beautiful Venture scent is unfortunately too weak to warrant a repeat purchase.

If, however, you plan to use a cologne, the upside is this stuff won’t get in the way, and your face will feel terrific.

title: Fragrance and Performance Both Surprising
text:
I admit I’m a shaving hobbyist. Soaps are like Pokémon, gotta catch ‘me all.

But we hobby shavers end up using these soaps once or twice and if they aren’t in our top 20 we put them up on the Reddit shaver trading boards. This way we can try ten soaps for the price of two, keep the ones we like and trade the rest looking for more winners.

Ladies and germs, this is a winner. My first Ogallalla product, I tried it on the recommendation of a guy I frequently trade with whose tastes are similar in many ways and who likes and demands the same performance characteristics of his shaving soaps. When he recommends one I sit up and listen.

So let’s talk performance. This soap, with my 26mm synthetic shaving brush, makes a ton of lather. A surprising amount. I kept adding water to get it down from “cake batter” to “pancake batter” to the soft whipped peaks and glossy sheen that lets me know it’s hydrated enough for maximum slickness. A nice thirsty shaving stick. Hooray. The ingredient list is vegan. I generally prefer soaps with tallow bases and added lanolin but I’m open minded about it. There are some vegan soaps in my keeper drawer.

Slickness was very good. Not quite what you can get from B&M’s “Reserve” line or good old Mitchell’s Wool Fat but very close. Lather, once worked to a good sheen and soft peaks, did not dissipate on the brush or dry on my skin. Maintains hydration well. Once again, B&M does it better, but for over $4 an ounce it ought to. For $1.50/oz. this stuff performs very well indeed. And as a bonus they include the plastic stick dispenser you won’t get from Arko or Speick. I just found my go-to travel shaving soap.

Scent: clovey but not as clovey as Ogallala’s matching aftershave, particularly the double strength. I found following my shave with Ogallala Bay Rum + Sweet Orange aftershave, regular strength, left my face smooth, disinfected, hydrated, and smelling like a Christmas tree but in a good way. The traditional clove top note fades on the dry down, leaving you with a really good scent for the rest of the day.

Some guys hate cloves. They get their bay rum fix from B&M, which uses no clove in its bay rum products. I like that too.

But this is a fantastic shaving experience for a shockingly low price, with added travel benefits. I’ll especially use it as the weather cools. I’m not keeping it because it performs well relative to price. I’m keeping it because it performs well regardless of price. The low price and portability are bonuses.

If you are a spice aficionado like me I recommend you try this shaving stick and don’t skimp on the water.

title: One Of My Favorite Shave Soaps.
text:
Of the traditional great shaving soaps, MWF is the postshave king. Barrister & Mann, L&L, Wholly Kaw, A&E, Italian Extro, there are wonderful soaps out there. They all have great scents and most can match MWF in slickness, cushion and glide. And they’re really close on the post shave. But good old MWF still rules the post shave roost. I love Mitchell’s Wool Fat. I have a Simpson’s Emperor badger brush that was very expensive. Tried and tried to get it to work with MWF, couldn’t get a lather no matter what I tried. I liked the stuff anyway. Then I got a $20 synthetic Plisson knockoff brush. It is the missing link. Loads in 30 seconds, face lathers wonderfully.

If you are having trouble lathering MWF do what I did and get a fat synthetic brush. It transforms the Mitchell’s experience.

Combined with my favorite razor, the Rockwell 6s set to “3” with a Feather blade, a good aftershave lotion and cologne, I’ve got an awesome shave here.

Provides plenty of slickness and cushion like any traditional tallow soap. But the addition of unsaponified lanolin (which also makes it hard to lather) gives this stuff its unparalleled post-shave feel. You will love your soft face after shaving with Mitchell’s and so will your wife, girlfriend or both.

Clean off with a hot damp washcloth, then pat dry and hit with a generous amount of Speick aftershave splash. Your pores will immediately tighten up, whiskers will retract, and you will have a perfectly smooth face.

If you are going to use Feathers, the samurai sword of DE blades, you need a slick soap like Mitchell’s to keep from cutting yourself. Mitchell’s does its job well.

Get some. It might be your favorite too. I will always keep it in my rotation.

title: There's good news & bad news....
text:
I looked again at the photo of the product and had to laugh because I think they may have cut it a bit to fit correctly? The product is fine, it does what I want. BUT I do need to take scissors and snip the outer edge of eye openings and the edges of the mouth opening (which is WAY smaller than my very average mouth) The first time I used it "as is" it felt slightly claustrophobic because the eye and mouth spaces just aren't quite right. Forehead to chin length is fine, the width falls slightly short for my face (again v average size face!) I dampen the mask before use, so it doesn't suck up all the product I put on my face, and that seems to work well.
So it gets 4 stars bc the product does what I need and it is impossible to make a size that fits everyone? I would say that the pre-treated face masks I've bought fit me much better and I looked high and low to buy those plain, but couldn't find them. Oh, and I bought these myself and got NO DISCOUNT or any freebie for doing so!

title: Fine for Special Occasions
text: Overall, this works okay. I cannot do winged eyeliner for the life of me, so this pen was very appealing. I liked that it had eyeliner on the other end, so the two colors/sheens of the eyeliner and stamp are uniform. I did have to try the stamp a few times, as my eyes are big and every now and then, the stamp did not get my whole eye (so there were spaces it did not get to). I'd recommend stamping it with your eye closed. You also have to practice so both sides are at the right angle. I thought the end of the eyeliner brush was pretty thick (making the line more dramatic than usual) but it easily glided on and was very easy to apply. The stamp also was fairly light at times, so I had to go over it again (but it was helpful to have an outline). It looks nice overall and will be good to use during fancier events where I want my eyeliner to be more dramatic. Still helpful overall and makes the winged look more attainable, just not ideal for my everyday look.

title: Wow. This is really nice stuff.
text: Two things drew me to ordering this product. The rose scent and the name "Manilla." I assumed it was made in the Philippines, and I'm half Filipino. To my surprise, it's made in Lithuania! It is, however, really quite nice. It's a moisturizer with a scent - not something too often seen these days - but the primary aroma is definitely rose. And I just can't resist that. The scent doesn't linger and follow you around. I really only noticed it until after the cream had been absorbed. The cream itself is very sheer and feels lovely going on. It's absorbed quickly and leaves no greasy residue behind. My skin is quite sensitive and I've experienced no breakout issues. All in all, using this product has been a genuine pleasure, both tactile and sensory. I really just enjoy using it, and my skin feels soft and moist, even in our dry winter air. I can recommend this product with enthusiasm!

title: My new favorite thing! I'm obsessed with it.
text: This is really wonderful stuff. The application directions are unusual. Following them, I put four drops (that's what works for me) in my palm, then rub my palms together until they feel warm. Then I pat my face with them, applying the serum all over. I spread it gently afterwards to make sure I haven't missed any areas. The solution is very quickly absorbed and leaves my skin feeling as soft as a baby's bottom, as the old expression says. I'm mean it's reeeealy soft, and not oily or greasy at all. It's AMAZING. What really has me addicted is the smell. It's not floral or citrus, or really like anything I can put my finger on. If I had to, I'd say it's faintly sweet… possibly herbal? Well, whatever it is, it's intoxicating to me. It lingers just a while after the serum dries and I thoroughly enjoy it. I'd wear this scent as a perfume if it were available. It's not strong or offensive; it's just unique and pleasant. I recommend this with enthusiasm!!

title: Better than the loofa one I have.
text:
I recently started using one of these with loofa on it. It works for me, even if loofa does take a while to break in. However, it also absorbs quite a bit of soap. I like this one much better.

I was a little hesitant to order it. How would silicone feel against my back? It turns out that it feels fine and works well. I like that it needs much less soap since it doesn't absorb it. Instead of spreading it all over the thing - I like the side with little bristles like a brush - all you need is to put some in the center. Moving the brush over your back spreads the soap out nicely and does the job without a lot of waste. It squeaks a bit on un-soaped skin, but that's pretty easy to get over and doesn't last long. It was just a surprise, initially. It feels like a gentle scrub, and that's the important part. It also rinses off easily and dries quickly, an important point here in our humid climate. The interior relative humidity in our house hovers around 55% in the summer, so things can get moldy fast. That's what usually happens if a loofa or any other kind of absorbent surface isn't dried properly. I just hang this up on the thoughtfully provided suction hooks and forget about it. It's great, and I'm really glad I gave this a try!

title: Large, stiff, awkward to hold and overstuffed.
text: I know that loofahs take a while to break in, but I think this product has other issues. I'm a woman with smaller hands. This is just too oversized for me. It's difficult to hold and control. It's also overstuffed with a very convex surface, so only the center of the raised area actually touches my body. It doesn't mold itself to the surface of my skin, so I feel like I'm scrubbing in thin lines, and it doesn't really do the job in the dips and grooves a human body has because of that. It does dries quickly, even though I don't have anything to hang it off of. I'm pretty disappointed with this order and I can't recommend this product.

title: Quite happy with this! A great find.
text:
I had some reservations... I’ve seen the round wood ones around, but never made the leap. I was afraid the ceramic would make this too heavy and bulky, but it does not. It’s quite lightweight and because it’s vertical, saves some space. It comes with extensive directions - a nice change - but is really very easy to use and set up. It’s very hot and humid where I live, so I was also worried that adding more humidity to the air would be a bad thing, however, the air that comes out is quite cool, which seems to cool down the area around it (and by “it”, I mean me). I found it very comfortable.

I wasn’t sure how I felt about the colored lights option, but I love it! You can choose red, or a brighter red, and also green and a soft lavender blue with their corresponding brighter shades. You can choose to have your color, or opt to have the unit cycle through them all. It’s quite restful. You can, of course, just use the white light. You can set the steam for a continuous output or intermittent.

The until must be cleaned after 10 hours of use. It doesn’t hold a great deal of water, so I was wondering if that was going to be inconvenient. I ran it for two continuous hours and I could tell that filling the tank twice would be about 10 hours. So THAT’S easy to keep track of!

All in all, I couldn’t be happier with this unit! It checks all the boxes and I can enjoy my essential oils in an peaceful, comforting environment. Highly recommended!!

title: Good quality wig, more blonde than light brown
text:
The quality of the wig is outstanding and the style is very similar to the picture with a little trimming/thinning/styling. There is a lot of hair, evenly distributed through the lace cap and has sewn in clips to attach with ease. It was a little large at the top of the wig and it was very easy to sew a few tucks to take out some of the bulk.

The write up clearly states the color may be different than what is in the picture due to the monitor or lighting. The wig I see on my screen looks like a light brown with blonde highlights. The wig I received is the color of the highlights in the picture and is more blonde than light brown. If you are looking for light brown with blonde highlights, you may be disappointed. title: Great results from this wax!
text: I had a leg and bikini wax with this product and liked it a great deal.  In the past, I've used soy wax (Nufree) in salons and this is also a great product because it doesn't bond to the skin making it much less painful and more to the point doesn't cause near the amount of skin irritation.  The Plum Smooth wax does the same thing but with the added bonus of having a more pleasant smell.  I also found that I had even less post-wax irritation with this than with any other wax I've used.  For my at-home waxing I've used consumer available wax strips like Veet, etc.  but these universally are low quality and, in addition to being more painful (even to an experienced waxer like me), cause irritation and sometimes even bruising/broken skin in the more sensitive areas where the skin it thinner.  This product is better than anything else I've tried and here's hoping that the results continue to be as good as the first couple times of use.  As a side note - the other reviewer had negative results and correctly stated that what works for some people may not work with others - in my experience people that have not had good results with soy wax or the Plum Smooth due to irritation it has been because of allergies or incorrect use of the product, but these are generally considered to be much gentler on the skin than any sugar waxes or products you can purchase as a consumer.

title: Good moisturizing gel without a strong scent
text: These days, with constant washing and sanitizing of hands throughout the day, I like having an aloe vera moisturizing gel handy.  What I like about this gel is that it's all natural and it doesn't have the strong odor of some other aloe vera gels I've tried.  I actually like that stronger aloe vera scent at times but I'd rather not have it in the office so I keep this dispenser in my office and use it throughout the day after cleaning my hands.  It counters some of the harshness of the alcohol-based sanitizers.  At 8.8 fl. oz. it should last a long time too.

title: Works great, lots of features and really holds a charge!
text: I've used electric razors for years and yet I've never considered Wahl as an option. I have to say I've been pleasantly surprised.  I've been using a much more expensive rotary shaver and this one beats it on so many fronts.  This one shaves as close as the more expensive model and has a built-in trimmer. That seems like it should be standard feature and yet my other razor requires me to pop on a different head.  This shaver lasts much longer on a charge and, if the spec is to be believed, can last 90 minutes on continuous use. That's incredible and means you'll likely never need to charge it away from home.  One less charger to carry and one fewer thing to worry about while packing are good things!  And if it does run out on you, there's a quick charge feature that let's you get one shave in with only a min. or two charge. Impressive. Lastly, like many electrics, it's a wet/dry shaver so for those needing that feature it's as versatile as competitive brands.  I doubt that any electric razor really will shave as close as a (good) blade and no product is every going to please everyone but I'm impressed that I don't see any reviews below three stars.  I'm happy with it and I would try another Wahl product at any time.

title: It works but only on dry hair and with HEAT
text: It's advertised as a no heat hair curler clips but for me it did not work without heat.  Using without heat resulted in kinks.  NEVER use on wet hair or the kinks will be set in your hair until you wash and restyle.  These clips are not a replacement for double prong root clips used in the curly girl method.  I watched every video I could find on how to use these clips and they all used the following steps:  (1) Start with clean dry hair.  Move the top layer of hair out of the way and take a section of hair from underneath.  Put the clips in with some looseness against the scalp.  They should not be tight against your scalp.  Make sure the clip part is turned to the outside and the hair is pulled straight away from scalp.  (2) apply heat gently to hair using medium to high heat and low air flow (3) apply cold air using hair dryer or wait for hair to cool naturally.  Do not leave the clip in too long if you are letting it cool naturally or it may leave kinks.  (3) Take out the clips and comb through with fingers, ruffling slightly to break up any visible kinks.  Blend in top layer so any kinks still visible will be hidden underneath.  Good luck!

title: Definitely recommend for the beard in your life!
text: My husband and I are so in love with his Wild Willie’s Beard Elixir, so we were incredibly excited for his Wild Willie’s Beard Wash and Beard Rinse.  My husband was reluctant at first to add another step to his morning routine, until he tried the product.  First off, the wash and rinse smell so much better than the generic men’s 3 in 1 he had been using from Target.  Oftentimes men’s products have a tendency to smell overpoweringly chemically, but these just smell fresh and clean, while still imparting a masculine scent in general.  The essential oils used are peppermint, eucalyptus, and lemongrass, and do not smell like a cheap cologne, which is usually typical for a mens wash.  I, as the wife, have noticed a change in the positive in my husband’s beard since using the Wild Willie’s products.  I have always loved his beard, but it smells better and is more manageable with the introduction of these products into his regular wash routine.  Before it was super rough and unruly, and now it feels softer and lays flatter.  I love that the Beard Wash and Beard Rinse are sulfate free, as this is a priority in our household.  They are also 75% and 80% certified organic, which is important to me, and I feel they are affordable as far as organic toiletries go.  I definitely recommend any Wild WIllie’s product!

title: So far, so good! Ordered these extras to keep in two cars because we have 5 girls. Seems like they'll withstand the test of time
text: I have a slightly larger brush than this that I keep in the pocket of the door in my car. We have five daughter...need I say more? Always having a brush on hand (and ponytail holders in my console) is crucial, and because the children in the second/third row don't have a visor with a mirror, I love that they have a mirror on the back of these brushes. Because they look so different from all of the other brushes in our home, they are easy to identify as the "car" brush if anyone were to take them out, and I especially love the pink handle so I can spot them from far away! I bought these two (slightly smaller) brushes for my husband and oldest daughter to keep in their own cars as well, because they are also often running our other girls to activities and have been asked many times for a brush. (As if they didn't think about the brush being in MY car when riding in another's car...lol! Bristles have stayed in place, mirrors are not distorted, this is the exact brush I was looking for.

title: Not especially pretty.

title: Easy to apply.  No irritation.  Great price.
text: So far, so good.  I have used many different lash serums, including Rodan & Fields.  I've only used this product for three days and so far there is no irritation.  If you've never used a lash serum before, it is very easy to put on.  It's almost like applying clear eye liner.  Most lash serums suggest putting on before bed at night.  I can never remember when I go to bed, so I put mine on in the morning when I'm applying my makeup.  For me, this works fine.  I just let it dry for a minute and put my eye liner over it.  I have done that routine with this product and it has done fine.  As with the other ones I've tried, I will also be using it in my eye brows.  In three days I have not noticed a huge difference in the length (I have long lashes anyway), but I have also not noticed any irritation or loss of lashes like I've seen in some.  This is also a great price for eye lash serum.

title: Worked great, loved all the sparkle

title: Smells to High Heaven

title: Beautiful Lashes
text: It took me a while to find an occasion to use these lashes. They are too beautiful to use for an every day look. They have a thick band and are easy to apply. I had to use a lot of Kiss lash glue, but they stayed on all day and weren't even heavy. They look incredibly heavy, but the only issue I had with them was that I could see them. I didn't have to trim them to fit my eyes, I didn't have to move them around to get the right 'sit.' I just popped them on and they stayed all day. They weren't uncomfortable, and they were easy to take off. I haven't checked to see how well they clean yet, but  will be wearing them again. I absolutely love them and highly recommend them.

title: Actual Holy Grail
text:
I read a review that said everyone would hug you with this stuff on. Since there’s a quarantine on, I haven’t tested that theory but it does smell really good. It goes on woody/herbaceous but mellows to this indescribable creamy yumminess. Full disclosure: it may be the combination of this deodorant and the “unscented” aloe/goat soap by same brand (it has a slight scent tho). I don’t know. But since using this, I never stink. Even after a workout and/or a long sweaty day. My pits smell as yummy at bedtime as the did out of the shower (a FIRST for my adult life). Oh! And I have sensitive skin and this is the BEST I’ve used: Zero irritation even though it has a slight grainy texture.
I started rubbing it on my scalp it smells so good (Sorry TMI). BTW, I’ve tried DOZENS of natural paraben-free deodorants so, I know of what I speak. Holy grail.

text: I have yet to find a nail polish or nail polish / base coat / top coat combination that actually works on my nails. Maybe it's just me, because my nails seem to be thinner and more flexible than lots of people's, but no matter what polish I wear, it always chips within a day. This base coat did not extend the life of my manicure any more than polish alone. Perhaps it's a coincidence, but my nails also took longer to recover after I removed this product. They usually get flaky at the tips after I wear nail polish, but after using this base coat, my nails continued to flake for over a month. I only wore it once.

title: No detailed instructions, suction cups kept sliding down
text:
No detailed instructions.

After ridding porcelain bathtub & bathroom tiles of soap, bath gel, etc, I thought it would be easy to apply the suction cups & keep them in place. It took several tries to find out the most comfortable height to place them. (I had to re-wet the cups.)

When I finally found the perfect height to place them and pushed each "dimple" in the front of the pad, representing a suction cup, it felt good... until all the cups slid downward to an uncomfortable positions. Because of the lack of Q & A on this website item, I didn't know what I was doing wrong. Very frustrating!

I"ll try again tomorrow, but won't waste another 45 mins. If it keeps sliding, I'll return it.

text: It is not smudge proof on me, but needs a slight bit of extra effort to remove. I have always had the problem of mascara and eyeliner smudging under my eyes. It really has to do with the eye structure that causes the eye to ‘warm up’ the make-up resulting in smudging. I also wasn’t crazy about the pencil tip. I didn’t like the line it made, thus requiring smudging of the line with a q-tip. Sometimes, I couldn’t even tell if the tip was exposed enough.

title: Very good organizer

There are plenty of pockets to separate and organize makeup. The problem with it is that 2 of the 3 exterior bags fall off. The tissue holder stays on because it is velcroed with two strips but the small bags need more than one piece of Velcroe to stay on. Overall, it’s a very good set bag.

title: Only deodorant that works for me.
text:
Love this. This is the only deodorant I've found in all my life (I'm only 27 though) that works. Before this, deodorants did not work for me. My natural scent and the fake fragrance makes me smell horrible and would accentuate any BO I might have. My best bet was to go deodorant-less and just wash my armpits when they got stinky. Then I started using natural salt products. Those irritated my skin due to the dryness (so I basically had itchy armpits). Then I came across a coupon for Soft & Dri, it would come out to $2 so I figured what the heck, I'll try something new. Well it works. I'm still surprised it works. It's been three months and I think I still have half a can left.
I only spray it very shortly. I don't spray it enough to leave any white residue. Do be careful when putting on clothes right after spraying it. Also, the scent is kind of strong - a powdery smell. It's not the kind of scent I'd prefer, but at this point, I don't mind smelling a little grandma-y when no deodorant has ever worked for me.

title: Great detangling brush
text:
Where have you been all my life?! I have really long, thin hair and it gets tangled easily. Every day, I'd have to get a comb and untangle my hair from the bottom up, but that's not the case with this brush. I can brush from my hair from the scalp down to the ends and the brush goes through smoothly. I'm amazed.

Edit:
After having used the brush for a little while now, I'll admit that there are times when I'll have to brush my hair out from the bottom and work my way up because my hair is really tangled up. Still, overall, I'm happy with the brush because I can use it when my hair's wet or dry and it doesn't tug at my hair the way many other combs and brushes do.

title: I have BO while using it

Simple review- I applied it this morning, re-applied when I got to work because I felt sweaty. I got home and asked my husband if I had BO and he said I did, he wasn't even smelling too close to my arm. I also noticed I had BO yesterday while using it.

It won't prevent the stink.

title: Cute scrunchi!
text:
I’m a long time scrunchi gal and I always have one in my hair or around my wrist. The invisibobbi scrunchi isn’t your ordinary elastic band covered in fabric; it is one of those swirly-do/keyring spirally things inside of the fabric. Is there much difference? In my opinion no not really but I like the fabrics these come in as they’re all super cute. I personally LOVE the black velvet as it matches most everything. I like using these over standard rubber bands as they don’t kink my hair like a rubber band would. I have thick and long hair (hangs to the middle of my bra) and these hold my hair up in a top knot or ponytail pretty well. I have tested using it while doing Pilates and I had to adjust it a couple of times but for normal activity it holds up great. Finally it does stretch out to accommodate thick hair and wrap a couple times around but it returns to
its original shape and doesn’t stay stretched out (I’ve had that issue with elastic band scrunchi where they get stretched out and unusable). Also the scrunchi Ed comes in a nice little box and this would make a cute part of a gift basket or stocking stuffer!

text:
Strange. I've loved the quality of all of the Fresh Sugar lipsticks--except this one. Could this one be either a bad batch, or fake(?) This color barely shows; color is weak, too "thin" and very uneven; mottled and spotty. The pale pink *may perhaps* be pretty... or it might be a bit too pale and washed out for my coloring, but I can't even tell that because it doesn't coat the lip with a consistent color at all!
It looks like I've skipped a few places when applying this lip gloss to my lips. Doesn't have color coverage. It still moisturizes, but the pink color skips or is otherwise spotty. This has NEVER happened to any of my previous Fresh Sugar lipgloss lipsticks before. I question its authenticity. I detest its poor quality.

title: High Quality, Low Cost
text:
This is what I love about these, versus other, more expensive makeup sponges:

Not overly big (about 20% smaller than most) so easy to get all areas of the face.
Soft to the touch, they do not pull on the skin. Also, the light colors help determine when to clean them.
Just squishy enough. Not too hard like a lot of them but not so soft they are not effective.
Application is very nice, surprisingly, better than expensive ones.
I used dry and damp. Either way, doesn't soak up all the makeup.
Because they are squishy, most of the water is wrung out, making a truly "just damp" sponge.
Application of foundation superior to expensive sponges...what a surprise.
No dyes coming out when cleaning, no funky smells, dries very fast.
I honestly cannot find a thing wrong with these. I have been on the hunt for the perfect makeup sponge for 2 years now. I think I found them!

title: Beautiful work on a stunning piece!
text: I am in a historical play every year and every few years, I get the role of a flapper. I love the iconic roaribg 20's flapper look, but it can be so hard to find era-appropriate items of quality that won't break the bank. I received my headband today and tried it on for the director and rest of the crew. They love it nearly as much as I do! It's stunning and made very well. The only thing I would change is, it slips very easily. I would recommend adding a thin strip of hot glue or silicon on the inside of the band to help it stay in place. 5 🌟s from me and my crew!

title: The perfect mirror at the perfect price!
text: This thing is AMAZING! It's super bright, the charge lasts forever. There's a 5X mirror that sticks on the back via a magnet. The mirror itself snaps into the platform in just one second. The brightness is super easy to adjust, by just touching our finger to the circle on the bottom of the mirror and holding it there until you achieve your desired brightness. It's also easy one-touch on and off. This is by far the best mirror I've ever had, especially for the price! I know of at least 3 people who I will be purchasing this for, for Christmas. I love it!

title: The power of peppermint! (And other natural stuff thats cool i guess)
text:
I've had a beard for 3 years. It's pretty thick and heavy and tends to grow in thickness/volume and not length. It's more like a face afro, if you will. Overall it's a pretty healthy beard but I decided to give Wild Willie's a shot since I like their beard butter so much.

First off I when the bottle arrived i really thought they werr small. So for $30 i wasnt sure if it was money well spent. Time will tell.
Second I love the peppermint smell. I don't feel it's overpowering at all and find it refreshing in the morning. The shampoo lathers really well and a dime size goes a long way, even in my thick beard. We do have soft water FYI, so that usually helps any soap/shampoo lathers better. It feels like it cleans really well with out drying my beard out.

The conditioner goes a long way as well. About a dime to penny size drop is all I need depending on how thick my beard has gotten. I let the conditioner sit for about 5 minutes to let it really work in. It leaves a nice cool tingling feeling on my face and has the great peppermint smell. When I rinse it, it doesn't leave a heavy conditioner feel and rinses cleanly.

Overall I think it does a good job. It leaves my beard moisturized and not dried out and somewhat soft. Definitely keeps my beard looking healthy and shiny. In fact, while I actually get a lot of compliments on having a really great beard; once I started using these products I got so many more compliments. Now, that may just be a coincidence.

Overall I'm so far satisfied. Both shampoo and conditioner have lasted about a month with less than half used. Both of which I use on a daily basis.

title: Better than shaving/nair
text:
I have very long legs and very sensitive skin. I hate shaving because it takes to much time in the shower and I always cut myself. All the nair like products that basicaly burn your hair off make my skin really irritated and I develope a painful rash because you can never wash off all the chemical residue.
Nads is a great alternitive to other hair removal methods, altough it does take some practice to get it right. It takes me maybe 15 min to do both legs and clean up, rinsing the strips etc. You have to apply the gel SUPER THIN (the thiner the better) to get the best results. I know it seems a bit backwards but the thinner you make the gel the more hair it can remove. My legs stay smooth and stubble free for at least 2 weeks and I dont have the annoyance of razorburn and I get far fewer ingrown hairs. Love this stuff, it really works. :*)

title: Works really well, although don't delude yourself that it won't hurt.
text:
I'm a tweezing/waxing maniac. Although it does hurt to wax, it doesn't suck as much as having to shave all the time, so I prefer it over shaving. The downside to that is that it is so expensive. In my town, an underarm wax can cost $22 plus tip, and since the hair will grow back at different times you may end up wishing for another wax just a week later. You also have to wait until it's long enough too. Since I was tired of the cost of waxing and I don't mind the pain of waxing or plucking, I thought an epilator would be a good buy. I did a lot of research on each type and finally settled on this one about 6 months ago based on the positive reviews. I made the right choice, for sure, and it has paid for itself at least 5 times over by now.
Pros:
*It is actually better not to let the hair grow long, so that means you don't have to be hairy for long periods of time
*You can do it at any given time, if there is anything to pull, which is way better than a once-per month trip to the waxer's shop.
*It doesn't hurt as bad once you are consistent with it, just like with waxing.
*It is fairly easy to clean and easy to recharge
*The flashlight is a great tool to help see those hairs you would miss just off the ceiling lights.
*You can use it almost anywhere, or anywhere you have help from another pair of unwary hands. Bikini line, chin, upper lip, underarm, leg, arm, you name it. My underarms and bikini line are my favorite places to use it.
*You can use it in the shower
*The battery lasts pretty long, like an hour
Cons:
*If you try to give yourself a brazilian wax with it by yourself, you are gonna have a bad time. I tried and failed. Luckily, the top part came off before it could do any damage, so it was really just a bit scary. It jammed when that happened, and wouldn't turn back on, but I just plugged it in for a charge and it was back to normal.
*It hurts pretty bad. As opposed to waxing, which takes it all off in one go, it pulls hairs one at a time like tweezing, but at a fast pace. That means there is a lot of breath holding and holding of skin to keep it all tight because you don't know when or how many hairs it will find and pull out. I suggest taking 600mg of Ibuprofen a half hour before you intend to do it... or maybe a few glasses of wine if you'd rather not use traditional drugs.
*The hair will fly EVERYWHERE, but where else would it go, I guess?

title: Very easy way to add volume and bold color
text:
Very Juicy and very easy to create thick beautiful brows. I eyebrows with a nice shape but they are very thin from years of plucking, and very light from sun exposure and my natural coloring. So I am always paying to have them dyed and even that only helps darken them a little, it does not bring up the fullness. This product adds both color and fullness, it goes on with only one or two bold juicy strokes. These must be properly placed, it takes a couple tries to get the right angle. I found that the first stroke should be the very outside third of my brow, where I need the most volume. Next I do one more half brush on the middle of my brow and it is done. Once it dries, I have thick, dark and dramatic brows.
This product create volume once it dries, so if you get it on properly, you end up with more eyebrow. It can be tricky and the first couple applications were messy for me, because I had never worked with such a juicy product. The dry time is slow, not the kind of thing you can do just before you run out the door.
Using this brow gel eliminates the need for me to get my brows dyed at the salon, so I am very happy with it. It is very solid and does not smudge or run. It washes off with cleanser and I recommend it for anyone who wants more volume.

title: First (almost) electric razor
text:
Just had my first shave with this. I've used two electric razors in my life. One was an already ancient one that my dad had, about 40 years ago. Ripped each of the few hairs in my face out one by one. Then an early Norelco 3-head circular job, about 30 years ago that either sucked or I didn't know how to use. Very even stubble was the result of that. Hence my refusal to try one until my memories have faded.

This review reflects one shave - not a long term review.

I'm impressed. It's slower than I expected, I half-thought I could activate an app on my phone or something and I would be shaved (I'm joking!). It's pretty darn close to a manual 5-blade fresh razor.

Here are the conditions under which I'm reporting:
- I'm 62, so my skin isn't exactly taut on my face.
- Not a heavy beard, I need to shave every day now, but not until I was about 35.
- This shave was with 2 days of stubble.
- I usually shave in the shower, using Braille to tell when a patch is smooth.

I used the razor dry. The manual said to charge the razor before first use, but it came out of the box showing 100% charge so I went for it. The manual also says not to apply too much pressure, so I was tentative at first. It helps to apply fair pressure while moving the razor SLOWLY through that fungus that seems to grow constantly on our faces.

Stretching my skin with other-handed fingers in most spots helped. I used a mirror just to watch the progress, but you can use your sonic sensors, AKA ears, to tell when the blades are and aren't removing stubble. I don't think a mirror is at all necessary, YMMV.

While I've been writing this, I've used Braille again to check on the usual trouble spots - I can just grab the mower and run it over the rough bits while I'm doing this. You could do this easily while driving somewhere - no risk of a small knick, and the aural attention that it takes doesn't really distract from driving.

I didn't notice when I ordered this razor that it came with an extra foil. Nice detail, since the foil is easy to damage being thin (as it should be). The kit comes with a carrying bag, which is nice to keep everything together while traveling. I would find a small rigid container for the extra foil if I were to travel with that - it could easily get bent in the carrying bag knocking around with all the bits. The foil is too long for the old canisters from film cameras, but a cut-off from a roll of Xmas paper would suffice.

The grip is comfortable and makes the shaving head easy to maneuver. The carrying bag contains everything in a small package - I'm a Cardinal (Archbishops and above don't shave) in the Church of Small Luggage and I will happily carry this instead of a couple of manual razors on any trip.

Finally (applause erupts from the crowd), very nearly close shave as a manual razor, a little slower than a manual razor, works very well dry (absolutely unlike a manual razor, though I've tried that also and it does sort of work).

Buy it. Try it.

title: HUGE WARNING: It Contains DMDM Hydantoin
text:
It contains DMDM Hydantoin. This is a cancer causing ingredient. I encourage you to read about DMDM Hydantoin. It is basically an unnecessary ingredient, which you will find in some shampoos, conditioners, body wash, lotions and other cosmetics. It is added as preservative (as if you need to preserve lotions/creams). It's not necessary to add to cosmetics; hence, not all brands use it. This ingredient turns into FORMALDEHYDE in liquids, which is classified as "known human carcinogen" by the IARC (International Agency for Research on Cancer).
I always check for this ingredient before I buy any cosmetics. Had I known it is used in this facial cream, I wouldn't have bought it. So the cream came out of the shipping package and went right into my trash. This was a waste of money.

title: Did not shave close for me
text:
This unit is well designed, quiet; feels good in the hand and super-easy to clean. The shave was comfortable and did not irritate my face. The price is quite reasonable. Unfortunately it didn't shave close enough for me. If I made many passes I could get a close shave but would find that by 4pm I would need to shave again(not that my beard is so heavy). Like all electrics I've used it does a sub-par job under the chin and on the neck. I've decided to send it back and go back to my Braun. Right now I've used the Norelco and then finished with the Braun, which even with year-old blades is much closer and just as fast.

This is electric shaver number five for me (4 bought thru Amazon). I started ~15 years ago with a norelco 5xxx series, and was satified for a few years. Despite changing the blades (perhaps my beard got tougher)I became dissatisfied with the shave. I switched to a Braun 5000 series which was noticably closer with the exception of the neck which required many passes to shave adequately.

The Braun lost it's edge after about a year or two, and I decided to try one of the Panasonic ultra-high speed, wet-dry units (10,000)strokes/min. I got a good deal on a close-out unit. I liked the build and the wet-dry feature, and the ease of cleaning, but I found that this shaver irritated my skin. I went back to the braun, and later upgraded to a Braun 7526, which I bought refurbished without the cleaning unit. It does a superior job and next time I upgrade I may buy the unit with the cleaner. It needs new blades yearly for best results, and it too doesn't do a great job with on my neck; but everything else is excellent.

title: AMAZING!

title: Be prepared for what you buy
text: I have bought 3 of these over the years and I can attest they work as a charm. I have permanently gotten rid of my middle chest hairs and unwanted hairs in other places. It is also relatively unexpensive. The drawbacks are pain(no problem for me but if you are too sensitive consider using a xylocaine gel) and very very time consuming to do large areas. A trick I have found that helps lessen time needed and pain and scarring is take some instant glue and tip the tip of the stillet inside. After it dries use some tweezers to remove the glue from the very tip of the stillet. This way the currect will go only to the root and not the rest of the follicle.

text:

title: Pefect well made little bows!
text: I bought these bows to sew on soft cat collars that I purchase for my chihuahua.  They are very well made.  There was not a defective bow in the package.  They were all perfect well made bows.  The bows came in a plastic reusable zip storage bag.  I cut the rubber band portion off or either peel back the center part of the bow to remove the rubber band so that I can then stitch the bow onto the cat collars.  My dog has about 20 different cat collars with bows & flowers that I have sewn onto the collars.  Some of the Blueberry brand cat collars came with bows already on them.  I put cat collars on her because she stalks creatures in the yard like a cat.  The bell will alert birds & also the breakaway collar will prevent her from getting chocked if she becomes tangled in vegetation.  She is a very sweet dog in the house, but she becomes a bloodthirsty killer in the yard.  She must have some terrier in her bloodline.  She creeps across the yard on her belly like a cat stalking prey.  My Jack Russell Terrier killed anything that moved.  I hardly have any lizards or green frogs (they make her ill for 24hrs after she bites them, but she can't resist mauling them again & again) left in my yard.  I try to rescue the creatures, but she is very fast in order to catch a frog or a lizard.  She now has taken to stalking the house geckos (invasive species in the southeast) at night that live in my garage, but they stay up high on the walls where she can't reach them.  Anyway, the bows are perfect & work very well for sewing onto pet collars.  I am sure that they would work just as well in a small child's hair. They are small.  Just under 2 inches in length.  There is pretty much every basic color, but white.

title: Nice smooth glide and large head makes for easy work
text:
The Maybuy Professional Hair Clippers/Beard Trimmers comes with 3 attachments, 1/2 inch, 1 inch and 1.5 inches. These attachments simply clip onto the head of the trimmer. You also get a small brush for cleaning the trimmer and a charging cable which strangely is a USB to Mini-USB even though at the bottom of the trimmer is your standard two prong charging connector.

Being able to charge this via USB however is great for when you need to go on holiday/vacation as you always have some kind of USB charging device with yourself (usually for your phone). On a full charge the clippers will roughly 2 hours and are small enough to just throw in your toiletry bag.

The trimmer itself has a nice shape to it and is comfortable to hold in your hand. It also has a fairly nice heft to it, not too light but not heavy. It feels like you are really holding on to something though.

The head is fairly wide which can be a plus in that it doesn't take long at all to trim an area but can also be a bit of a minus depending on the shape of your face if you are trimming your beard. The action is smooth and has a nice gliding feel to it, even if you don't use any attachments and just use the trimmer head itself.

It would have been nice if the Maybuy came with some sort of carrying case to put it, the attachments and the charging cord in but it doesn't unfortunately. The attachments do come in a small Ziploc bag.

Overall a nice trimmer, nice action and makes quick work whether trimming your beard or hard to reach places like around your ears.

title: Some Of The Best Sauer Kraut There Is !
text: We have strayed from a national name brand of sauer kraut and was that a  big mistake. The store brand was one that almost everyone set aside on their plate and did not eat. We went back to a  name brand and that was Del Monte. The kraut we think is the best on the market. We do nto like that other kinds of kraut such as Bavarian. We want the real stuff, at least to us it is the real stuff. Did you know the whole  14.5 oz can only has 10 calories in it and zero fat. Even for carbs there is only 1g. Now this is where we definitely go wrong as we serve it with smoked sausage, which we know is totally off the chart. Don't do this often---just occasionally. The meal is delicious. I do have a note fro Del Monte. Remember when your cans contained 16 oz of kraut, then you cut back and now it's 14.5 oz. Please quit doing this to us!.Do you realize, and I am sure you do, that I now have about 10% LESS to serve to my family.

title: AWESOME PRODUCT! EASY TO USE! NO BURNS!
text: I just received this KINDOMCARES hair straightening comb today and I was so excited I could not wait to try it. The comb itself is of high quality and comes packaged very nicely. It has an on/off button and six heat settings depending on the weight, curl and thickness of your hair. My hair is color treated, slightly wavy with medium thickness so I used the middle setting (3 to 4). The device heated up in under a minute and is cool to the touch as the heating element is not exposed to the outer edge of the comb. I found that starting from the underside of my hair gave me more control than just combing it down my head. I was able to straighten my whole head in under 5 minutes. I love that I cannot burn myself which is my main complaint about hair straightening irons. Also, I was able to get my hair straight without hearing it sizzle as I did not need as much heat. I am posting picture of the device, my blown dry hair before and my straight hair afterwards. I really like this comb better than the many other methods I have tried. I did receive the KINDOMCARES ceramic heating comb at a discount or at no charge for the purpose of providing the company with my honest and unbiased feedback. I would highly recommend it to you!!!!

title: Have WARM and RELAXING Masks at home!!!! It is my not so GUILTY PLEASURE!
text: I will confess it has been a long time since I have done a facial mask. They certainly were not warm or relaxing! I have been trying to take better care of my skin to age gracefully so I jumped at the chance to try this mask heater. Immediately, I loved how upscale the packaging was as was the unit itself. It also comes with a two year manufacturers warranty, which is amazing.  Certainly, it would make a very thoughtful and elegant gift. The unit heats up any saturated paper mask. You can purchase them on Amazon or very inexpensively buy the unsaturated masks and whip up your own ingredients. I loved how quickly the mask heats up, yet the unit does not get dangerously hot. Not only does a warm mask open your pores and absorb better but it feels amazing! It really made me feel pampered and relaxed, which most of us don't do often enough. I would highly recommend this mask heater. I want to thank the manufacturer, Kindom Cares, for providing me this electric mask heater at a discounted price in exchange for my honest, unbiased review. I highly recommend it as part of beauty and self-care routine.
