title: Perfect wig for Lucy cosplay
text:
I’m so used to ordering wigs from Arda; I was anxious getting one from Amazon. But, my fellow cosplaying peoples- this wig is amazing.

My takeaways:
-the blonde color is a pretty and more natural blend of yellows. It’s a beautiful color, not crazily oversaturated like some blonde cosplay wigs turn out. It has a very natural vibe.
-My picture comes from AFTERa cut and styled it. I should have taken a photo from the get-go but the wig is actually pretty long. The hair fell nearly tiny abdomen and so I had to take about 5-7 inches off. With this wig, I decided to cut it whilst wearing it (rather than put it on a wig head stand) and I used my sharpest pair of scissors to shear it up to where I wanted it. This technique worked PERFECTLY. Since there is already wave in the wig, shearing helped keep the movement and avoided that choppy look you can sometimes get when you lop off length.
-ponytail piece is hair attached to a clip. It is incredibly easy to attach to the wig and isn’t incredibly heavy either. I had to take off quite a bit of length on the ponytail piece because it nearly touched my shoulder. I decided not to take it too too short simply because I wanted to ensure the clip kept good coverage and I wanted to make sure there was enough hair to hide the purple bow piece that I made.
-the bangs are a perfect length; no crazy eye pokeage and they held really easy after a spritz of hair spray
-the wig itself seems sometimes like, “oh no it’s statidlc and maybe tangling” but you can literally just run your fingers through it and it returns to form.

This was a great purchase. Really really good quality for the price; highly recommended.

title: Purchased this item in Marshall's for $6.99
text: So as I have stated in previous skin care  product reviews, I am EXTREMELY vain. That is probably due to the fact that I suffer with Adult Acne. Never had acne until I reached my mid 20's. So as a fair skin woman in her mid 30's my focus is to lessen the severity of my outbreaks, and to keep my skin looking youthful and CLEAR! Like other women in my predicament I have spend loads of money on what seems like millions of products sometimes they work, then after a couple of months they cease to have any effect. So besides incorporating multivitamins into my life (B complex, Flaxseed oil, MSM, DMAE, etc) which I take pretty consistently, I drink plenty of water or as much as I can take, eat fairly healthy (no soda, no juice, no candy, no chips, little to no fast food) and of course I exercise. All these things will play into how healthy your skin will and can be! So on a recent trip to South Carolina, I ran into a Marshall's and I always check out the skincare section. Now within the last couple of months my skin will begin to clear up completely then BAM I will get a medium red nodule, or inflamed whitehead.... UGH! And though you are not suppose too I always pop mine to relieve the pain and pressure. I always do it with clean hands, and typical wash my face with my 10% sulfur soap I purchased here on Amazon. So when I ran into this Brightening product for $6.99 it caught my eye. With all the sulfur and scrubs and acne drying products my skin was looking pretty dull and kinda flaky. I needed something to help diminish my acne scars, moisturize and smooth out my skin... and the fact that this product claimed to help with anti aging was the icing on the cake... so I took it home and gave it a whirl.... its been about 2 1/2 weeks I have used this product 2x a day each day as it is not heavy and provides the extra moisture I need. I have noticed significant difference in the color and size of my scars. my skin feels smooth and soft. I feel good about this product sofar I have had no adverse reactions to this serum. With any product it takes a keen eye and diligence to becoming successful in your skincare goals. I will see how I feel about this product once I finish the bottle. If this product continues to show me positive gradual results I might purchase another product as this is cheap and effective. As we head into a new year I am looking to go more organic in my skincare products and spend alil less than I have this year and previous years.

title: This is the greatest invention I've stumbled upon
text:
Even with various gloves and pads, washing makeup brushes is always a pain. You always get your hands wet and prune-y.

This is the greatest invention I've stumbled upon. It's very easy to choose a boot, insert your brush, and spin wash. I used this to clean ALL of my makeup brushes and it worked well for almost every single one. Each brush needs to be positioned a little differently for optimal cleaning depending on the shape and length of fibers. The only brushes that didn't work well were bulky face brushes with heavy handles that the machine did not spin well and small eyeshadow and detailing brushes that couldn't fan out. I recommend two rounds of rinsing. The first in soapy bubbly water to clean the brushes and the second in clean water only to rinse out any bubbles and residue.

Even with two cycles, the process was quicker and less intensive than washing by hand and the drying time was cut down to almost nothing for nearly all my brushes, including dense synthetics.

I highly recommend!

title: Peel off base coat works!
text:
After years of damage to my natural nails I’ve been trying to rehab them back to health so I went cold turkey with all the dip powder, gel polish even regular polish. Now that they are some what back to normal I wanted to paint them however I hate using regular nail polish. I take the time to polish and then they chip the next day, so annoying. I wanted to try gel polish but didnt want to ruin my nails again (I have super sensitive, thin brittle nails) so I thought maybe a peel off base coat would help.

I decided to try the peel off base coat on 2 of my nails just to be safe. After 2 days I peeled it off and my nails has minimal damage. The top coat however was super thick! Made my nails look unnaturally thick and lumpy, maybe I got an old one.

title: Love this hand sanitizer! Must have
text:
This is another really great and super cute product by L'autre Peau. I was again drawn to this one because of the cute bag to be honest but was so pleasantly surprised by this awesome product,

This is a set of four citrus antibacterial travel hand sanitizers. They are small a great size to put in your purse, book bag, glove box or even your pocket. They are each 3.9" X 1.5" X 0.5". Each bottle is 0.5 oz. They of course came in the super cute burlap looking drawstring sac like bag.

It is very easy to use and self-explanatory you just spray the product into the palm of your hand and then rub your hands together until it is all absorbed. I absolutely love the citrus smell and it was all absorbed into the skin very quickly and did not leave any kind of residue or sticky feeling on my hands like a lot of the other brands do. My hands even felt soft because it is made with Aloe.

I have one of these in my purse, my glovebox, my desk and my work bag so I am always covered :) I am going to order more for my daughter to have at school. I recommend this set of hand sanitizers. Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for unbiased review.

title: Great product! But leave the battery cap off between uses...
text:
Sonicare are great products, as my dentist has noticed.

The only problem with this great replaceable battery version is that the batteries didn't last for more than a week or two. Until I discovered that removing the battery cap between uses made the batteries last 2-3x as long.

I can only guess that there is a small constant current drain on the batteries. Removing the cap disconnects them and stops that constant 24-hour-a-day drain. Then they last fine. I use NiMH rechargeables.

I've had this tooth brush for 2 weeks now and I'm very pleased with it. I'm a "hard-brusher" and I tend to bleed from my guns occasionally. This brush is very gentle on the gums, and I've yet to bleed using it. In fact, my teeth have never felt so clean before.

title: Upgrading from a T900
text:
Ok, here's my summary review of this trimmer.

I've had a T900 trimmer for a few years now and wanted to upgrade to a new and hopefully better trimmer. I've had it now for two weeks and here's what I think...

* The vacuum is great, period. When shaving with my Norelco T900, the shavings would fly all over the place --- in the sink, behind the faucet, in between the handles of the faucet, and on the floor. With the vacuum set on low, I barely see any clippings now! Now, my wife doesn't get mad any more!

* The height adjustment can be easily set, and unlike other reviews mention, I haven't accidentally changed the setting without knowing.

* The clipper works great and easily cuts/trims without any effort. This is an upgrade from my T900.

* Battery holds its charge pretty well. You can use it with a power cord also when the battery is low.

* The smaller trimmer is a now a separate attachment. My T900 has it attached to the trimmer, and it can be popped up or down when needed. To me, this is a downgrade as it is not as convenient.

* The parts seem somewhat delicate. I try to be careful as to not cause damage.

Overall, the price is good, it works well, and I'm glad I purchased it, and would recommend it to all.

title: The 3 largest oval brushes are great. The small ones, not useful
text:
These brushes and handles seem sturdy. They arrived quickly and in good condition. I washed them with face wash, rinsed in cool water, and dried standing up in a coffee cup (because you SHOULD wash new makeup brushes.) They did not lose any bristles and dried overnight in like-new condition.

The second-largest brush was GREAT for applying IT CC Cream (liquid foundation). The bristles are dense and soft. I needed LESS foundation, and it applied easily and very smoothly offering even coverage. This one's a winner.

The largest brush applied Bare Minerals Mineral Veil quickly and easily. It was dense and soft. I'll use this again, too.

I tried one of the smaller, round brushes for eyeshadow. It didn't do a good job laying down pigment, and felt rough and uncomfortable.

I've seen demos of the third largest oval brush used to apply setting powder to the under eye area. This would probably work well.

The linear brush was not useful to apply powder shadow as liner.

title: Too soft to actually scrub

title: Well Constructed and Looks Pretty
text:
After seeing reviews on YouTube as well as reading them here, I decided to go for it.

It is only a little bit smaller than I expected, however, it is larger than one I purchased earlier of similar design but from a different company. I love that you get an extra piece nestled inside the bottom drawer. I'm using the extra piece for my base and top coats as well as small bottles of polish remover and my hand creams. That piece alone holds as much as the Glossybox box I was using but takes up less room and makes it easier to see and get my hands on the things I use most ofter. If I could buy the drawers separately, I would so that I could organize the rest of my manicure stuff.

I also love that the bottom drawer is nearly twice as deep as the middle drawer. I don't have to worry about thicker compacts or powder boxes tripping up the drawer.

This organizer is made of very durable and substantial material. It feels substantial as well and it holds a lot more than the other organizer. Now I can have a drawer for each type of makeup. The only things I can't fit in it are the W7 eyeshadow palettes and the NYX makeup palette I have.

Really happy I took the plunge and got this. I would recommend you get this before the sale price disappears but it is well worth it even at the full price.

title: A Review
text:
I had been using the Norelco Cool Skin Advantaage for 4 years when it finally broke. So I got this.

I have an extremely thick beard and have to shave daily. The 5 o'clock shadow happens around 11 AM.

This razor did a great shaving job. It did the neck better than the Advantage. Most importantly, it does shave faster. I can honestly get a good shave within 3 - 5 minutes, the Advantage took 8 - 10, if not longer.

Drawback - it feels flimsy. Especially after the Advantage, this razor feels light and cheap. But it still works great.

All in all, I recommend it.

I also live in the desert, so on top of the chemical treatment I also have extreme dry weather to counter. This made such a huge difference with just the first use. I can't wait to see how my hair will look after a week!

title: BAD Design, Unusable Trimmer
text:
When my (non-vacuuming) Norelco trimmer would no longer take a charge, I ordered this item, not too concerned over whether the vacuum was effective or not.

What I received was a poorly designed trimmer:

1. To hold the trimmer, one must place one's hands over the vacuum air exit slots, thus throttling the vacuum.

2. The guard was so complex to attach and detach that it took 10 minutes each time to do it.

3. The closeness settings don't actually lock in, and tend to "wander" toward (1), the closest setting. And so I would find myself completing my trim with 3/4" length hair on one side of my face, graduating to stubble on the other.

I finally threw the thing in the garbage after a week and bought a leftover non-vacuum Norelco model like the one I previously had - $19.99.

So, if you see some poor soul walking down the street with long whiskers on one side of his face, and a 5 o'clock shadow on the other, be kind. He's probably not dimented - just the victim of this "new and improved" beard trimmer.

title: For now...Norelco's top of the line model
text: I bought this electric razor about a year ago. I've been very happy with it's performance. I've never had any problems with it. The main reason I bought this was the battery life. It's rated @ 100 minutes, but mine charges to 110! This is also the quietest razor I've ever owned. (This spectra model replaced another norelco I had for about 10 years) Very solid stainless steel housing. You can rinse the heads off under hot tap water. The floating heads fits all of the curves of my face great. I like the cool polymer LED display. This razor is also fairly small in size, yet fits my hand well. It features a recessed steel on/off button. The one thing I don't like here is the pop- up trimmer, doesn't really cut effectively. Doesn't matter to me because I use another norelco cordless trimmer for close touch up work anyways. This model comes w/ a leather travel case.  You can't go wrong w/ the 8894XL, I recommend it. Look mom, no cuts! Safe & Close results. Rock On !

title: Ehhh... they’re pretty good.
text:
There’s a learning curve. I’m relatively good with liquid liner, but the applicator brush for the magnetic eyeliner is junk. Next time I’ll try capping some product on glass and using my own brush to apply. The lashes are pretty good compared to other brands. The 5 magnets as opposed to 4 is nice. I had some trouble with the corners staying down. It’s a little tedious to get the liner timing and placement of the lashes just right. Not the most comfortable, but what falsies are? The eyeliner is really difficult to remove even with eye makeup remover. A dab of coconut oil on a Qtip worked the best but did not entirely remove the product., which is why I took of a star. Last think I want when I remove makeup is any residue stuck on my face.

To be fair, these are decent. They are not as nice as MoxieLashes, but they are also 1/3 of price. Compared to MoxieLash I’d rate them a solid three stars, but based on the price point, I’d say they are four stars.

Sidenote: if you are ever needing a heavy duty waterproof eyeliner, you could use the magnetic liner with or withojr the lashes because it does not budge. Was surprised my to exit the shower after deep cleaning my face to find my eyeliner exactly perfect still. Not what I wanted at the time, but worth noting for when I need that kind of staying power.

title: You get what you pay for
text:
I'd rate these a 5 out of 10. They cheapo clippers aren't very sharp. They get the job done on normal to thinner fingernails, but I think if you have thicker or harder nails, these won't be good. I don't expect they'd be very good on even normal, healthy toenails, just in case you were hoping to use these hand clippers on your feet, too.

This is the 2nd set of clippers I've had to buy here on Amazon because the first ones were too dull. I returned those first ones I got and bought these after reading the decent reviews on these. They'll suffice, I guess, but they are by no means the sharpest or best clippers. I actually wouldn't recommend these to a friend. Unless it was a guy friend; these would be okay for guys, but not for pretty girl nails. And there's NO WAY these are cutting thru acrylic nails.

Go ahead and splurge and just get the higher priced clippers. Save this cheap junk for your 'tween boys and the men who bite their cuticles and don't care if their clippers tear their nails rather than cut them.

title: BEAUTIFUL!
text:
WOWWW!! Why didn't I buy this months ago?! This is by far the prettiest, and now my favourite, out of my 4 wigs! I think I'll be buying several more of these so I'll never be without one! It's not shiny at all, very real looking. Is soft enough to feel like real hair. Will probably get matted at least slightly-moderately while wearing since ALL synthetic wigs do, so keep a pick in your purse and keep the unit conditioned with an appropriate wig spray or maybe a little silicone-based leave-in hair gloss, like Biosilk. Wig experts or YouTube videos can advise you on this best.

Running my fingers through it right out of the package, to detangle and fluff it, I noticed there was absolutely no shedding. When combing it, there was no shedding. I was quite shocked. My other blonde wig from Kryssma sheds LIKE CRAZY and already has huge bald spots in it after brushing it only 5 or 6 times since purchase.

I hope this wig won't be the same!!! To try to ensure against it, and because this wig is so much curlier, I'll try to only finger comb it.

title: must have
text:
I specifically tested 3 weeks to give honest review. so what we have:
1 - a well-packed beautiful box (small)
2 - instructions with pictures - the irrigator is easy to use with just two buttons you are already a "dentist"
3 - brush your teeth with high quality (I can even say that you do not need a usual brush and paste)
4 - you need to get used to it as the procedure remind professional teeth cleaning
5 - 4 nozzles - the whole family can use!
6 - 30-60 seconds and teeth are clean

p.s. My dentist recommended to buy a water flosser as at the moment it is a very useful thing, which saves money, time and supports your teeth health!
Advise - do not use soda or other elements with water, it will clog the tubes and you will have to buy a new irrigator. only water! if you have sensitive gums - be careful and choose the most gentle mode.
I am pleased with the quality of the product and the price!

title: My Favourite Product
text:
The first two or three days I used it all over my face I had a very MILD breakout and corner of my nose was a bit sensitive. For this reason I started to use Niacinamide only the areas with enlarged pores, being my nose and top area of cheeks. I did try using on my entire face and neck after a few days again and had no problem, I believe my skin just needed to get use to this product. After applying Niacinamide over face and neck I apply Cerave Moisturizing Cream. I use every night sometimes during the day,

After a few days of using this product my skin looked the same but felt very soft and smooth. After about a week skin still felt soft and smooth and began looking brighter…just healthier looking. After just over 2 weeks my enlarged pored stared to look a little tighter. After a month I decided I loved this product. My pores never looked better and I don’t have that dry stinging feeling you get with Retionol. A little goes a long way with this product.

The product itself is water bases so it absorbs well and further blurs any blemishes including pores when on the skin. A little goes a long way, you only need a few drops. The reason I purchased this product was to use for my enlarged pores but I am very happy for the additional benefits.

title: Wake up to the sound of a clean, close shave.
text:
I was shopping for replacement cutters and combs for a Norelco Micro Action (formerly Lift & Cut [formerly Rotatract]) shaver and noticed that for less than $10 more I could have a whole new Norelco shaver. I was sold.

Norelco Reflex Plus shavers combine 4 features pioneered by Norelco and improved over time. Rotary heads reduce the vibration common to reciprocating shavers. Floating heads individually hug the skin. Lift and Cut blades gently pull whiskers into the cutter for a closer shave. Everything rides on a set of pivoting platforms that bulge slightly at the center of the head assembly. The bulge allows the heads to maintain contact with the contours of difficult to shave spots like the concave hollows of the neck below the chin.

I've been a Norelco man from my first crop of peachfuzz to my current orchard of gray quills, so the first shave wasn't a surprise for my skin. It was as close and comfy as I'd expect from a Norelco.

The real revelation was the sound. The previous Lift and Cut was like shaving with a Black & Decker DustBuster. The Reflex Plus is so quiet, you can actually hear the cutters slice off the whiskers and then fall silent on the next pass over the same area. This is a real help for those times when a mirror isn't nearby. You could actually shave by the sound alone!

A somewhat poignant note: Models at the economy end of the Norelco line are now made in China and lack carrying bags of any kind. When I travel, I roll my shaver in an article of clothing, usually a T-shirt, so the carrying case is no biggie. Still, I miss seeing the words "MADE IN HOLLAND" on the bottom of every Norelco I've owned.

Times may change but at least the quality of the shave has only improved.

title: Rock n Roller
text:
It’s tricky to use at first and I thought I’d made a mistake getting this curling iron. However, after learning how to use it, I’m happy with my curls.
When curling on the right side of your head, hold the iron with you left hand holding it pointing down. Using the other hand you wrap the hair around it starting with the hair closest to the scalp.
I found it was kind of hard to control the hair and the curls ended up a little inconsistent, HOWEVER, I think that was a good thing.
The best thing was that I got curl high and close to my scalp which was nearly impossible with a regular curling iron. Typically, my curls fall out after a few hours. The photos I shared were taken over 5 hours after curling. I’m happy with this curling iron!

title: Great for adult acne issues
text:
When I first tried this product, I had also changed several other aspects of my skin care regiment. All of that amounted to a huge improvement in my skin. Like an idiot, when I ran out of the niacin mist, I opted not to reorder because I could not say for certain it made a difference. Within a week I regretted it. I struggle with adult acne and I absolutely feel like this product helps to balance my skin and reduce breakouts. I apply once a day (usually in the morning) right before I apply my moisturizer. I make sure to not let it dry before moisturizing so everything gets spread around evenly. I don't know where I picked that method up from but it seems to do the trick so I go with it.

Also, the bottle lasts quite awhile and compared to how much my other skin treatments cost, it is a steal. I highly recommend giving it a go.

text: I really loved this product for the first two days... after that... not so much. I had really high hopes for it so I went into it with a positive attitude. I've been using it for weeks now so I feel like I can write an accurate review. First of all, it tells you to use 30 pumps on your hair if you have long hair. That is basically the whole bottle... so if you can afford to spend $30 on every shampoo, maybe it will work better for you. I used one pump on the top of my hair, one pump on the bottom and then after I rinsed it out, one more pump to leave on my ends. The first two days it made my hair look supermodel perfect... after that, it was so disgustingly greasy that I couldn't handle it. I started to work back a shampoo into my routine here and there to help with that- but now every single time I use it, its nothing but grease and weighed down matted down hair. Also, my hair is back to frizzy and not shiney... I would not recommend spending the money on this. I am having far better luck with organic shampoo and conditioners.

Cons: Price, a equally good Sonicare costs about 1/2 of this Panasonic. Another issue are the brush heads. They also cost more than Sonicare heads and are not as common..

I think this is a great toothbrush, however I think the price should be lowered as the extra "features" are really unnecessary.

title: Convenient and decent but..
text: The Philips Norelco QC5055 clipper works wonderful if you do not have thick and full hair or do extensive hair cutting. It is good for maintaining a short haircut or shaving a beard. However, if you have lots of hair, I recommend a traditional clipper due to a wider cutting area and sheer power. The unit feels solid and heavy, but the plastics are a little on the cheap side. The cordless feature is convenient, especially if you cut your hair outside. No more extension cords. On the downside, rechargeability makes the unit lack in cutting power at times and you need to manage a separate charging base. Overall for the price, this is a good unit, just don't expect professional salon quality cuts and build quality.

Work your hair in small sections to keep the barrel from bogging down and make sure to use a good thermal protection product on your hair (doesn’t have to be expensive).

title: A beautiful, natural, dewy finish..
text:
Let me start by saying, I did NOT order this from Amazon. I ordered it from Sephora. The reviews here regarding whether this product was a fake or not made me a little leery. So, I'm reviewing the real Josie Maran Vibrancy foundation and not the Amazon version, real or not.

As usual, I ordered the lightest shade, RG5. It's a nearly perfect match. It's described as being for fair skin with neutral undertones. I typically prefer foundations with pink undertones, but this actually worked really well for me.

The consistency is on the thin, runny side, which isn't surprising since oil is an ingredient. Having said that, this foundation sits on the skin so beautifully. It looks like real skin. It's definitely not a matte foundation, so if that's your preference, this is not the foundation for you. This foundation gives you more luminous, dewy-looking skin. I don't typically care for dewy foundations, but again, I was surprised to like this one. It just made my skin look healthy and plump. It didn't look at all heavy, which is great because it didn't settle into my fine lines. I did notice it took a while to set. Again, not surprising considering the oil content, but you'll want to make sure you set it with powder before trying to blend blush/contour/bronzer, etc. Otherwise, you'll likely look pretty streaky.

Many reviewers here have mentioned a smell. I didn't notice that at all, which is another reason I think the product people are buying here might not be legit.

The only reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is because my t-zone gets oily fairly quickly while wearing it.

I'd recommend this for more mature skin and dry skin types. If you're oily, you can definitely still wear it, you just might have to blot a bit more than usual.

Overall, though, a great foundation. Just make sure it's what you're looking for. It's a very specific look.

title: Takes a lot of work to look good...
text:
3.5 stars

I have many thoughts on this wig. We ordered this to compliment my daughter's Mad Hatter Halloween costume and honestly, it looked like a hot mess when it arrived. The bangs were going everywhere, the curls were tangled, there was no part...it was awful.

My daughter, who is 12, has long, VERY thick blonde hair. When the wig arrived, we tried it on with her hair down to make sure it fit. It did. Fast forward to Halloween...I braided her hair and pulled it into a knot at the back of her head. Lo and behold, the wig wouldn't fit...it just kept sliding off her head. That was my mistake...I should have tested it with a bun when it arrived. Having said that, my daughter is incredibly petite...her doctor predicts she won't surpass 5' when she's full grown Obviously, her head isn't that large. My point? If you're an adult or are purchasing this for a teen or big child, it likely won't fit. I finally had to put her hair in a low bun at the nape of her neck to make it work.

Unfortunately, because her natural hair was so low, we couldn't do the up-do we had planned because her bun showed if we did. We ended up leaving it down, brushing it out, putting bobby pins in strategic places to help it frame her face and to contain it, and then I hair sprayed it in place. Styling was especially difficult because the wig is sparse. It's a lot of work to hide the netting underneath. The netting is a yellow-beige color and stands out like bright white against the purple and teal. We finally got it looking decent though, and she actually got many compliments on it throughout the evening, hence the higher star rating despite all the complaints.

Once the wig was brushed and styled, the waves looked beautiful. Just don't buy this expecting it to look great out of the box. It won't. It takes work.

title: My skin seems to like this product...
text: I've only used this a few times so far, but so far, so good.  It does a great job removing make-up gently...including eye make-up.  Since it's oil based, I was worried it would break me out.  I'm 41, but my skin is very sensitive and I'm still prone to break-outs, particularly in my t-zone area.  Thankfully, so far, my skin seems to be liking this product.  I do think it's a little pricey for the size of the bottle you receive, but overall, I'm pleased.

title: Beautiful, but lightly pigmented.
text: The color is beautiful and it provides the perfect pop of brightness with a more neutral, smokey eye...BUT!  (You knew there was a but coming, right?)  It's not super pigmented and you have to go over it several times to get a good pop.  Since it's lighter, it's not ideal for a winged eye either.  I usually just flick it out on the edge a little, but don't do a full-on wing.  I'd say the color trends more toward violet (with red undertones), than purple (with blue). It doesn't bleed or run, and for the price, I think it's a good choice, if you're looking for a little spark with your eye make-up routine.

title: Great shampoo, crappy bottles and pumps...
text:
I can't speak to whether or not the product sold from Amazon is fake or not, as I don't order it from here. I usually buy it from the salons or from trusted sellers on Ebay for a much more reasonable price. Having said that, I really like this shampoo. It smells amazing, the lather is plentiful and silky, and I can genuinely say that my hair does feel a bit thicker. While I don't think this shampoo has caused new hair growth, I do feel as if it's strengthened each individual strand to give my hair a slightly fuller look. Don't get me wrong...it's not an Earth-shattering change, but it's a step in the right direction.

The reason this didn't get 5 stars is because every single shampoo bottle I have ever purchased has been faulty. They leak, the pump either breaks or doesn't work from the start, and the plastic is flimsy. If it's been mailed to me, it inevitably leaks all over the package and I lose a substantial amount of product, which is pretty frustrating.

Overall though, a great product!

title: Garbage - synthetic tangled mess
text:
I’ve done my own extensions for years, and every time I try to save some money by buying cheaper on Amazon, I regret it.

This hair felt soft out of the box. But. They’ve been in for 5 days - haven’t even washed my hair yet - and they’re already matting and tangled. (I know how to take great care of extensions)

I got the sense they might be synthetic heavy when putting them in (that extra bit of elasticity) but thought I might be judging them since I bought the cheap ones.

Nope, they’re definitely not fully real hair.

The wefts will not blend together. I had to cut a ponytail holder out bc the hair had somehow snarled itself around it and I couldn’t get it out for anything.

Installing keratin extensions is time consuming, especially if you’re doing it yourself. I am not looking forward to removing these so soon after *just* putting them in!!! I ended up cutting them about chin length to keep them from getting further matted and buy myself a few more days.

Buyer beware - do not!!! buy these

title: Tapered Ends!!!!
text:
I’ve been experimenting with dupe cluster lashes from Amazon for a few months. I wore L@$h!fy for two years and am so pleased there are finally more affordable options!

I ordered all 3 packs of lashes to test them. My absolute favorite are the tapered 10-20s!!! The taper makes the corners VERY realistic and finishes off the set beautifully. I’ve always had a hard time making my outer corners flick up in a cat eye shape, I usually do them all in a fan across my lashes. This is the first I’ve seen this taper in cluster lashes and I wish they all came like this!!!! I’m about to stock up on these.

I still use the L brand glue and the lashes are holding on great.

title: My new go-to nails
text: I am so glad I found these nails -- they are AWESOME. I've used them three times now -- and now that I'm familiar with them I can apply them in 10 minutes start to finish (including that I trim mine down with clippers and a file) and I can take them off in under 10 minutes by using oil, not acetone. This is so much more convenient when I want my nails done for special occasions.  They feel a little weird for the first few minutes, but once you are used to them you don't even realize you have fake nails on. I was able to do barn work and pull and grab at things and not have them pop off. I'm seriously addicted to them!!!

title: Messy & ineffective
text: Let me just start off by saying if you have a white sink don't even think about buying this product. It doesn't matter if you have running water going and you spit right in the sink, or if you spit it out with running water a foot away from the sink it's going to go everywhere... black dots everywhere.  I see Zero difference 2 weeks in from using this product. I would just spend an extra 10 or 20 bucks and get Crest White Strips.... if you don't believe me, buy it and you'll find out the hard way..

title: Amazing and Hydrating
text:
This is the first time using this product and I was pleasantly surprised. When I received the box the first thing I liked was the packaging. Adorable box with cute cartoons on it and the individual mask package is really nice as well.

How I used it. First washed my face and dried it. Then gently took the lace mask out of the package and peeled the backing off. The mask is loaded with product on it and I didn't waste a bit and put excess from the bag on my hands and arms as well. I padded the mask down on my face and attached the part for you ears to secure it on your face. Then went to relax for the next 15-20min and enjoyed the feeling. When you take the mask off do not wash off the serum instead run it into your face.

I've never used this brand before but I'm officially hooked! I've just turned 30 so I'm taking my skin care more seriously these days and very happy I found these masks. It's been a week since I've used it and my face is still feeling and looking great. I've started to purchase their other masks to see what I like best. I have nothing bad to say about this product it worked very well for me and I did notice a difference in my face. It also really liked the strap that goes under your chin. When I took it off it felt like it lifted and tightened my skin with still being extremely hydrated.
Try it, it's great.

title: Tried Hundreds but this one is a Favorite!
text:
One of my favorite scents ever. Performance is great with this hard soap. So slick and creamy, and at a great price too.

If you have dry skin, you should get a good balm for afterwards. Everyone else should be fine.

title: Works well
text:
I really like horn combs. No static. They sort of fluff ones hair and tame fly-aways. They’re sturdy and they last really well. And, the main thing, they float nicely through your hair.
This one does most of that. The teeth are a little overdone. The edges of the teeth are cut a whole lot sharper than is entirely necessary. This makes this particular comb catch more than it would have otherwise. The wood is nicely finished and it’s generally well made. Just went a bit too far with the milling.
Also, while the case is a nice gesture, it’s really on the cheesy side. As far as storage goes, it’s not much help. The velveteen sleeve is adequate for throwing it in a drawer or bag.
I considered getting another and sending this back, but really didn’t want to go through the whole process again. So, now it’s mine.
It gets the job done, and will probably last years, assuming I manage to hold onto it. I wish I could be more whole hearted and hope this is helpful to someone. Thank you.

title: If you're looking for a starter kit...
text:
This is probably a great starter kit for someone new to dry brushing. It's a really beautiful set and I especially like the back brush, but I have to admit that I'm happier with the little oil sample that came with it than I am with the brush.
The main dissatisfaction I have is that the bristles are very soft. Very. One has to work a very long time to get that pink tint that lets you know that it's working. And it sheds. For someone who likes a gentle brush, this may be perfect. Or for a beginner. Just not for me.
Shipment was prompt and fast.

**Update: I misstated the shedding of this brush the first time around. I ordered two at the same time. This one shed a lot the first couple of times I used it. It shed when I opened the bag right up until I realised that it just wasn't for me. I'm sure it's a temporary problem since so many people like it. Just be prepared in case it happens to you.

title: Not a great buying experience, and not a great brush
text:
The brush itself is okay. The bristles are a little softer than expected, but I've been using a boar bristle hairbrush for years. I expected something more like that. And I expect that after using it a while, I'll be looking for something with a little more bite. Anyone that uses a actual loofah pad will find this much tamer. It also shed a whole lot of bristles the first few times I used it.
And now for the down side. This product was listed as prime eligible. I ordered this along with a few other things and this item was singled out for slow shipment. Which then got misplaced somewhere in the Midwest. After waiting something like ten days, I notified Amazon and the nice rep did his best to fix things. The brush finally arrived about a week after the replacement did (another brand. I didn't want to take another chance on this vendor).
This is the first time this has happened in all the time I've been a prime member without my permission.
I really hope no one else has this experience.

title: About what you'd expect with better than average customer service
text:
These are pretty much what you'd expect. They aren't as flexible as some. I can't say that I'm overly impressed with the quality, since the ends have popped off a couple of them while I was folding them up. They did go right back on, but it's not the sort of thing you expect the first couple of times you use something.
The good news is that there are plenty of them.

Edit 1 September 2016
Since posting this I have heard from the customer service department with help for the issues I had with the rollers. I wanted to publicly thank them for this. For anyone with questions, don't hesitate to email them. They are really much better than the average out there. To me, that's important.

They were easy to apply but I did experience the same issue another reviewer reported with some of them tearing in half when pulling them off the strip on the case. This is not a problem for me because like the other reviewer, I can use them to fill in smaller areas toward the inner corner of my eye. I like the variation of sizes in this set as well 12mm -18mm. I used the 14mm, 16mm, and 18mm lashes and I like how they turned out.

title: Great shape for treating frown lines, but they DO NOT STICK!!No matter what I do they just fall off
text: Great shape for treating frown lines, but they DO NOT STICK!! So when you wake up there's no difference because they refuse to stay in place! I make sure my face is totally dry and free of any skin care products before putting them on. I hold them in place for at least 15 minutes which is ridiculous to have to do, and that gets them to stay on place for a little while. However if you more your mouth at all they immediately pop up off your face and you end up having to hold them in place again. They absolutely do not stay on overnight. It's a shame because the ingredients are great and the shape is perfection to treat frown lines and nasolabial folds. If they would just stay in place long enough to let them work, these would be fantastic. Unfortunately even with my best efforts they will not stay on:(

title: Works much better than expected
text: My nails are in terrible shape. I'm doing everything I can think of to improve their condition but the going is slow. This was one of the many steps, using a non-acetone polish remover. I was surprised to find how effective it is, easily cutting through two layers of ridge filler and two layers of nail polish. Didn't have to soak or anything, just put it on cotton and take it off with a few wipes. In fact I found it a little easier than acetone. Now it remains to be seen if this step will also help improve my nail condition of weakness, ridges and splitting. And I also found no problem with the odor.

text: I found this doesn't fit very comfortable on my face and doesn't quite lay on my chin area the way I had hoped. I find I have to turn it nearly all the way up to feel some pulses . There is no plate directly under the center of the chin, which is my targeted area. The pro is it is cheaper in price then many other devices that look exactly like it. It's too soon to tell if it's really helping. I bought this to help with lymph drainage massage in the chin and neck area. If I put it all the way up, I do notice pulses in my teeth nerves so that's annoying. But too low and with the bad contact to skin in most areas, then I feel nothing. Might work for others better.

title: Pretty good brown
text: It's alittle more course then other synthetic hair, but it's not bad. Length is great. Has a small 2 inch lace to help blend it. Some hairs on top are alittle short compared to rest and may look like a few fly aways, but I think that makes it look more natural honestly. Will tangle easily so keep a wide comb. Curls are nice without being over styled. It's alittle thin near the crown so be careful as it doesn't take much to find the wefts. It's a nice brown#6.

title: Better then most at this price point, depends on which one you get
text: So it's honestly not bad at this price point. It sheds a bit but all units have some shedding. For the mix brown I give 4 stars.The face front is about 2 inches and is meant to be cut and plucked for a natural look. I did neither in the photo. I just folded it under the the front as I'm afraid that cutting will make it look lifted in the front and obviously show it's a wig without some glue to put it down. The color is not exactly what I wanted. I was hoping it would be a darker brown. It's kinda a mousey brown and alittle strange in my opinion. It will need to be restyle in the front as some waves/curls flattened out by how it was packed in transport. The part is both a plastic fake skin and a mesh on top. You can see the mesh upon close examination. Makeup might help to conceal this.... Or make it worse. What I did like was the fullness and length. The weft was not too easy to be seen even when pulling hair apart. This is good compared to other brands where the wefts are often very visible, especially in the back and crown of a unit. Because the simulated scalp is narrow, you won't be able to change the part. It's also a bit flat near the part so it's gonna take some work to give a bit of volume. I would have enjoyed this much more had the color been a rich brown and if the scalp was a bit more realistic. Would I wear in public? Probably not. Would this be good for photo shoots or costumes ? yes. Would I buy other colors from this brand? Yes and I haven't done that with other brands on Amazon. For the purple ombre: I give 3 stars. It doesn't have the lace in front. This is more pure costume. The black is very shiney and the front of wig where the part is shows a bit of the black backing for construction. If it laid more flat and had the lace I would have given the purple ombre 4 stars. Dull the shiney with some powder like dry shampoo or maybe even dark eyeshadow. The fake scalp is actually better on the purple ombre compared to the brown mix. The ombre for the blonde is also a 4 star. Hair at the crown is a bit flat but the rest of the style is beautiful. The brown to blonde has the 2 inch lace like the long brown one. It's not as full on the head but you don't see the wefts unless you pull it apart a bit.  I feel the color is much more realistic. Hair feels pretty good for a synthetic. Note if you play too much , it will get a knotty feel. Again, good for photos. Some people might actually wear it daily but I don't know if it took take daily abuse. Length is great.

title: Very flat top. Some fried pieces under the wig.
text: So I felt they did a good job of hiding the weft and had alot of hair. The unit shed pretty bad just by touching it though. The hair was shiney but powder should control that. The length was there. It had one spot near the bangs that looked like someone fried it. And that would be hard to conceal. The bangs looked nicer then most but it just wasn't for me. Fake scalp also not best I've seen but concealer would probably fix that. The top had no volume and I don't mean amount of hair. It was slicked down really tight. I tried to shake it a bit with my fingers to see if it would gain some life but it didn't, plus a bunch of hair fell out.  This super flat look near the fake scalp and with a mid part that cannot be moved is just gonna make me look like the Amish. I would look at this company again if they had a unit without the bangs and maybe a more flexible part. A mini front lace would probably help.

title: Thought it was like flexible nail gel. No. It's a press on nail.
text: It's just a weak press on nail. Does not flex and form close to your own nail. Lifts very easily and will snag and pop off. Okay if you have maybe a photo shoot and your not a hand model. But don't expect to use your hand or nails without these popping off within mins of application.

title: Bought twice and neither was right color nor brand
text: So they came packed nicely but not in the s-noilite package. No logo. Just staples to a cardboard slip and wrapped in a pink bag. The hair feels nice. However, I bought the same one twice. First one was brassy in color. I was ordering the #60 in platinum. The thick version. Alot of hair. But totally brassy. So I saw the price drop so I was like okay I'll try again see if they get the color right. Nope. Still brassy and the second one was not the thick halo version. No more then 50grams. Both have double thick wires which don't hide well compared to other companies. The thin version they sent on the second ordee  had clips as well. Why doesn't the thick version have clips? It would help so the ends stay close to the head. The wire was also short. So not happy based on color, difference in style sent even though I ordered same style twiced, and not package from s-noilite. My seller was us fashion outlet. I'd be sceptical to purchase from them if they are the only seller.

title: The lashes look beautiful but you'll never get them on
text: The magnet is strong. I bought the two paid sandwich style. I tried the videos, and the hacks that say cut them ...I tried applying with special lash tweezers... Nothing works to get them close to the lash lid. The magnetic is strong so I'm sure it won't fall off, but it's so strong that when you start to move the under lash toward your eye with the upper lash laying on top of your lashes, the magnetic pulls and moves is soil quickly that it always ends up locked half way through your natural lashes. And I'm a contact wearer...so it's not like I have  fear of putting stuff near my eyes. These probably will work well with lash liners. The lashes themselves look nicely constructed. It's just the application as intended is impossible.

title: Eh...
text:
So first and foremost: I am a State Board Licensed nail tech and I have been doing nails for 15 years.

I was a little leery of ordering product from Amazon but overall the quality of this wasn't bad. The only reason I gave it 3 stars is because the photos are a little deceptive: they are not black with glitter. They are colors with chunky glitter. Which might work for some but didn't create the look I wanted for my Halloween costume.

Overall not a bad product. I wasn't impressed with the magnet cat eye effect - it's very minimal and barely noticeable. The glow in the dark feature is pretty cool and works well.

Pro Tip- after looking through the photo reviews: keep your layers thinner. This formula, by nature of the chunky glitter, is on the thicker side, so keeping your layers thinner will prevent the lumpy mess I see in several of these photos.

title: Recommended by my dentist!
text: My dentist recommended I purchased a water flosser but the one he was selling in his office was almost $100! I looked them up and found that they were all considerably cheaper online. I’m extremely happy with this one! The best feature is that it’s cordless (with the exception of when it’s charging, of course). I’ve had mine for a few weeks and I’ve only had to plug it in once so the charge is lasting. For those of you who’ve never used a water flosser before, they can be powerful and messy (with water getting everywhere) so it’s best to keep and use them in the shower so that the water is confined/contained inside the shower during use. This was actually my dentists recommendation – so this being a cordless flosser was very important! I usually get about 3 flosses in before having to refill the water reservoir (which is very simple). This one does come with several tips so I tried them all after settling on one. I think having several different options is nice so that you can find the pressure and kind of tip that works best for you and meets your own unique needs. Overall, I think this water flosser is great. It does exactly what I need it to do and I got it for a fraction of the price from the dentists office. I would confidently recommend it to others! For anyone looking to buy water flossers, I hope my review is helpful to you!

title: Electrolysis... FOR WHENEVER YOU NEED IT
text:
Love being able to access electrolysis at home! I have been going to a professional for months now and when the 2020 pandemic began and all service providers closed up shop, I wasn't sure how I would deal with unwanted facial hair. Where other methods of hair removal can encourage stronger hair regrowth I did not want to regress. Then I found this! I have had this product several weeks now and am very happy with it. I wish I had found this earlier. Not only can I do a treatment whenever I want, I am able to target hairs when they first appear as opposed to waiting for an appointment. It is very easy to use. I was afraid I would be unable to target the follicle in the right spot but that has not been a problem. It has a high pitch buzz when the current is delivered to the follicle. Most of the time the sound is my only indication that anything is happening. I do not find this painful. I can tell it is working because when I go to remove the hair it comes out with no effort. I do keep the power at the highest setting except for the delicate area above the upper lip. That can be a painful area at home or at the salon.

My only complaint with the product is that the tweezers included are useless. Just use your own.
I bent the stylist at first so I did order extras to have in case that happens again... so far so good as I haven't ruined another. I don't think that is a product flaw as it must be very delicate to do the job right... just be careful.

If you are unfamiliar with electrolysis, do not expect that one shot will forever kill a hair. I suggest reading articles on the subject as this can be a long term process. But considering other methods are a FOREVER process... go for it !

title: My hubby likes his new shaver
text:
My husband has complained about shaving irritating his skin, so when I saw this shaver I ordered one for him. Here is what he had to say after using it:

I've used Norelco shavers for years, but never a "wet" system, so I was quite interested to compare the Cool Skin 8040X to my old shaver. When I first opened the package and set the shaver up, I had to not only charge the batteries but also fill the shaver with Nivea For Men shaving conditioner. This was no problem following the easy to read instruction manual.

To begin shaving, you first press the on/off button on the shaver to turn it on and then press the conditioner release button. This pumps a small amount of conditioner out of holes in the center of two of the three shaver heads. Then you shave as you normally would with an electric shaver. I found that I use three pumps of conditioner while shaving: one for each side of my face and one for my neck.

Although I have a tough beard, I have sensitive skin. Because of this, in recent years I've starting shaving every other day. So when I shave my beard is a little bit longer than most men's would normally be. The shaver has no problem coping with this. It cuts clean with no pulling on the hairs. However, it begins to have problems with three days of growth.

I also have a mustache and goatee, which has always caused me to use a razor to shave along its edge. The same applies when using the Cool Skin, but with less irritation as it is now being done with skin conditioner in place instead of on dry skin.

The shaver also comes with a beard trimming device. Just snap off the triple shave head and replace it with the trimmer. (Conditioner cannot be used when the trimmer is installed.) The only real fault with the Cool Skin is this trimmer which, frankly, is useless. It just doesn't want to cut any hairs. But then, the one on my old Norelco is the same way.

I also find the conditioner application button is in a position that I want to place my fingers when using the shaver, so occasionally I'll get an extra, unneeded dose of conditioner. A pretty minor issue.

The Cool Skin can also be used in the shower, but I have not tried this as I'm blind as a bat without my glasses on.

I find that the results of my shave are the same whether I use my old standard Norelco or this new Norelco Cool Skin 8040X, with one exception: ­ there is much less skin irritation with the Cool Skin. I like my new shaver.

title: Would be right at home as a decorative accessory in a nice bathroom.
text:
The container, thought plastic, is decent, and both the label of the product and the colored bath salts look visually appealing, and will add a warm purple color to any room.

The salts are also of a good size, larger than typical “sea salt”, with not too much salt-dust to speak of. Most importantly, and probably the reason you are buying this, is that there is a very strong lavender scent when you remove the cap and breathe in.

I can find no fault with this product; it does exactly what it is supposed to do. It looks nice, and it smells of lavender. And when added to the bath water the salts dissolve as they are supposed to, leaving the lavender aroma behind.

title: Not as long as described
text: So this wig is very cute and is not the worst quality, but it's nowhere near as long as it's supposed to be. I believe I chose the 16" length,but it might be 12' if I'm lucky. Otherwise it's not a bad wig at all if you want something quick and easy to put on. It has an attached black headband and comes with a detached patterned headband you can out over it. It's just too short.

title: Good for what it is
text: This is not a high quality wig that will trick people into thinking you have long, luscious locks. But if you need a wig for a simple cosplay, girl's night out, or you just want to look different  - this is for you. And you want real hilarity? Put it on your toddler and watch him be very unhappy and uncomfortable for a few minutes.

title: becomes mush too quick
text: Everything about the soap is awesome except for the fact that it does not last very long. It gets water sopped very quickly and the last half of the bar seems to disintegrate way too fast. It becomes barely usable mush.

title: My holy grail and new go to product!!
text: I finally gave up on the cat eye.. until I found this! And for 12 bucks it does the job. The stamp isn't very bold so it is better if you fill it in with the other side to make it stand out a little more, but this is a no brainer and it took me a few seconds to have the perfect cateye!

title: Very thin and doesn't condition well
text:
I have been using expensive conditioners with argan oil for awhile, so I decided to try this to see if I could purchase a cheaper conditioner and add my own oil to it.

1. The scent of this is very strong. It's a pleasant smell, but definitely strong.
2. I added a good amount of the oil to my conditioner and can definitely smell it in there, but I don't notice any difference in the softness of my hair like I did with the other argan oil conditioners.
3. As others have stated, it is very thin. I don't think it is pure argan oil and it feels like it is watered down.

Overall, I think I would look for a higher quality product.

title: Why did I stop
text: Snail essence was so big a couple years ago and for good reason. My skin loved this stuff but going with the skin trend, more exciting products came up and I stopped using snail essence. I am so glad I started using this  again. Instant difference to my skin. NEOGEN is a trusted brand for me. I currently use their exfoliating pads which is also five stars in my book.

title: Silky just as described
text: This shading powder is super silky. I love that this is actually made for contouring because it has hints of grey compared to bronzers that people mistakenly use for shading. I have light to medium skin and this (color #3) shows up naturally.

title: Skin Loves it
text: I have really dry skin and my skin really likes this toner. The smell is very pleasant too- strong scent of floral but does not linger. I do not notice a big difference from using this toner versus my other toners- which isn't necessarily a bad thing.

title: Different Color
text: I don't mind the color. The stone is nice and smooth. The weather where I am is also cooler which is nice because the stone matched the temperature and it feels great against the skin. I can't say if this works at depuffing or not since it will take at least a month of constant use to see small difference. However, it is quite nice to massage the face with it.

title: Lovely
text: What a lovely wig! The color is true to the picture, and the inside has an adjustable cap, so you can position it on any head with comfort and ease. The inside isn't itchy either, and looks very natural when laying on your natural hair line. No lace front, but the hair looks almost real and it's very easily manageable and easy to wash and style without looking cheap or frizzy. The hair stays in pretty well even with conditioning and combing, and I love the ombre hint of pink at the end. The wig feels really well made and doesn't have gaps at the scalp, fits well, washes well and looks like it could be totally real. It's great for everyday as well as cosplay.

title: Delicious
text: A great smelling essential oil with a spicy feel and smell. Excellent simple packaging, great addition to my oil collection, and overall a great purchase.

title: Cool
text: This is a cool set of wave rollers that come with a few needles which you can add links onto for the length of your hair. Sort of easy to put the silicone feeling rollers onto the needle, and you really have to try a few techniques to get it to work for the size, length and texture of your hair, and sometimes it's too tight, sometimes it's too loose, and sometimes you somehow miss hair, but it works pretty well to curl overnight. Not the easiest thing to sleep with, clearly, but curls come out bouncy and look great with all day wear. Great amount of set, perfect for thin hair like mine (I didn't use very many at all), and definitely for thick hair since there is such a huge set. Easy to clean, store, and a great addition for my heatless curls of the summer.

title: Cool!
text: My dentist has been telling me to use tongue scrapers for years, and I've tried plastic ones and they just make me gag and they constantly smell and are hard to clean. These are pretty amazing!  Stainless steel, wide scraping area, but a very soft side to scrape with and two handles which are easy to grip. Gets every bit of gunk from your tongue in one foul swoop, and easily rinses off.  This four pack will last me forever, and I keep them in the cardboard holder which is a nice little spot for them. I didn't realize how bad my tongue was until I used it this morning, and rinsed it off and was amazing at what this little thing can do!  Doesn't smell at all, and should be easily cleaned in the dishwasher with every other utensil. Great sturdy product that should definitely be a part of your beauty routine.

title: Great variety of sizes and I love the seeming sturdiness ...
text: Great variety of sizes and I love the seeming sturdiness of the product, however, after one use the zipper broke on the large back after about five minutes.  So, looks can be deceiving.

title: Exceeded my expectations, another wonderful Wild Soap product!
text: This tooth soap exceeded my expectations.  First, I have never tried this type of tooth cleaner before.  I took the leap because I had previously tried soap from this company, that I purchased first from a National Park.  I loved it!  It worked wonderfully and smelled great, not soapy.  I then moved on to try a hair shampoo from this company.  I love the natural clean from this as well.  So, to the tooth soap, it cleans my teeth and leaves them feeling clean for a long time.  The clean feels more real than some other pastes that cover a grimy feeling with strong essential oils.  Another way this soap exceeds my expectations is that in reading the description and reviews I anticipated that what i was getting would last about a month, brushing 2-3 times a day.  There is far more in the small jar than I knew.  And a small piece goes a long way.  I break each piece in half before using.

title: Go to
text: Great product for naturally curly hair.. I find that it definitely helps with growth. Also, smells great!

title: Great product and value

title: American Shaving Co Beard Wash
text: My husband did not like this American Shaving Co Beard Wash and ended up throwing it away after the first use. He said it was runny and he didn't like the scent.

title: GLO Science Teeth Whitening Pen
text: I am not a fan of this GLO Science Teeth Whitening Pen. The clicking mechanism is super annoying- a twisting mechanism would have been so much easier. The thick, bulky, silicone tipped applicator is annoying as well and a lot of the gel gets left in its little bumps and grooves. It doesn't apply smoothly or evenly at all. I have been using it twice per day but have not seen any results. The taste of the gel is absolutely horrible- there's like a weird floral perfume quality to the taste. Do not like.

title: Teleties - Spring Collection Hair Ties
text: I don't know why these types of hair ties are popular. These Teleties - Spring Collection Hair Ties were super awkward to use- like tying your hair back with a phone cord. I can only wrap it around my ponytail twice but it is not at all secure. It also rips my hair out when I take it out. I am going to stick with my traditional elastic ties.

title: NEOGEN DERMALOGY REAL CHARCOAL PADS
text: These NEOGEN DERMALOGY REAL CHARCOAL PADS are easy and convenient to use. They are a nice size and are very moist. One side is exfoliating and the other is more cleansing. They leave my skin feeling clean and hydrated. I don't know how effective they are for drawing out impurities but they do work well for cleansing. I have not experienced any irritation or sensitivity after using these.

title: Jade Rose Quartz Roller for Face 2 in 1 Gua Sha Set
text: I'm not sure what I was expecting when I received this Jade Rose Quartz Roller for Face 2 in 1 Gua Sha Set. It seemed kind of gimmicky but I have read about jade rollers on blogs before and decided to try one for myself. I guess it feels nice on my face, especially when it's cold but beyond that it doesn't do a whole lot. There weren't really any instructions for using the little scraper part so I don't even know what you're really supposed to do with that. I have not seen any difference in my skin's tone, texture, smoothness, elasticity, or anything like that. The quality reminds me of something you would see at an ethnic discount store. I don't know, maybe I'm not doing it right or maybe I'm missing something but I don't see the point of this product.

title: sturdy and long
text: This sturdy scrubber has easy to grip handles.  It is long enough to reach all of your back without a problem, even if you aren't that flexible.  I find it works well for doing the bottoms of my feet too.  I use the side that is similar to a face scrubber, the other side is more a massage than a clean.  The handle is small enough that I can hang it on a small Command hook in the bathroom.  But it is still large enough to be sturdy and easy to grip.  It dries quickly since it doesn't hold water.  The rest of the scrubber is also thick enough to be sturdy and hold up to being pulled on.

title: awkward but pull free
text: I didn't see how these would actually work when I got them, they seem plasticy like they would stick in your hair.  Then they were kind of awkward to get in until I got the hang of them.  But they were indeed pull proof.  Even when hair ties don't pull my hair they end up with hair stuck on them so they must have even if I didn't feel it.  These did not do that.  They also are not too tight to wear on your wrist.  They don't stretch a ton which seems weird that they'd stay in your hair but they coil in.  This also means they don't have to be in as tight which is better for my thinning hair plus less tight bow headaches.  All in all I'm still not sure about the look but they really do work great.

title: relaxation
text: This is more a thick oil or serum, not as easy to apply as a lotion but thick enough that it doesn’t run all over so can be applied.  The smell is pretty neutral and subtle.  It does not sting or leave any unpleasant feeling like some magnesium products.  It is not a magic lotion that will put your child to sleep instantaneously.  It will relax your child though allowing them to fall asleep with time.  More importantly it will help their quality of sleep through the night.  The bottle isn’t huge but you only need a squirt per foot so it lasts a while.  The small size makes it easy to travel with as well.

title: Soft lavender scent
text: It is a natural choice for baby and works for my kids with sensitive skin.  The lavender is a very light scent, not like the commercial products out there with the artificial lavender scent.  It doesn’t suds that much but still seemed to work on both hair and body (though they’re boys so don’t have a ton of hair but definitely more than a baby).  I like that it doesn’t contain chamomile which irritates my sons, it is hard to find natural body wash without it.  This is the only lavender one I’ve found.  The bottle is kind of small compared to even other natural brands but if it isn’t too expensive it wouldn’t be bad.

title: it’s plain old nail polish remover
text: Works as well as any nail polish remover I’ve used.  It quickly and easily removed regular nail polish, the at home lightless gel polish took a bit longer.  My problem I have with the product is that it is not sealed under the cap.  I know some brands aren’t and that’s probably fine in a store (though I still prefer sealed in this day and age) but the screw cap was just taped to keep it from unscrewing in travel.  Taping worked fine but some still leaked and the box smelled of nail polish remover.  Also, the price isn’t exactly great, I can get regular nail polish remover at the dollar store.

title: Light, daily primer
text:
I was a little leary about a spray but it feels so refreshing to spray on. It also makes it much easier to use a light amount. Considering the light amount you use, the size of this bottle is going to last FOREVER. This really makes me more likely to use it daily vs just when going out. It really does make a nice smooth surface to apply makeup to and reduces the powdering or blotchy look of your makeup.

Do not let “moisturizing” fool you though, this isn’t like a bb cream, you do still need a separate moisturizer. Also keep in mind it is “minimizing”, it doesn’t make your pores magically and completely disappear, especially if you have any enlarged pores. It works great on my chin and forehead to reduce pores but I have some enlarged pores on my nose that it doesn’t touch.

I’ve used other primers that work slightly better but at a MUCH higher cost so I save them for going out vs every day. I think this makes a good every day primer. And since I still use a separate moisturizer that has spf I don’t have to worry about this not having it. Between the affordable cost and the refreshing feel and scent this has definitely converted me to a daily primer user.

title: Seems to work well.  Reusable and economically friendly.  No soap required

Overall, this works well and makes my face feel clean. It is quick and easy to use.

Make sure to wash the towels before first use. Machine wash warm and tumble dry.

title: Love the all natural ingredients
text:
We live in Florida so I am always looking for good sunscreen for my 3 kids. Since I have a 9 month old, 2 year old and 5 year old, I need something that is soft on their skin and prefer natural ingredients if possible.

This sunscreen is 100% natural and uses grape seed oil, sunflower oil, honey and sea salt so I thought I would give it a try. So far I like it. This sunscreen is a little thicker than some and tends to be a little bit more oily (I think this is due to some of the natural ingredients used). Once the sunscreen is absorbed, however, some of the oil dissipates. The only thing I would change is maybe to give it a little bit of a scent. As it is now it has strange smell, as such I only use on their body (I think it would be a little overpowering on the face).

I hope you found this review helpful. If you did I would LOVE it if you would click yes below!

title: Attractive, Well Made, and a Good Value
text: I'm really liking these attractive Spove Boho Headbands for Women, 12pcs, which is a good amount of variety in both color and design.
